Title: Don't Buy If You Have Sesamoiditis
Review: As the title states, don't buy these if you have sesamoiditis. I tried to walk in these things and my foot, which wasn't hurting before after walking barefoot around the house on wood floors, started to get stabbing pains on the first step.They are also way too big. I'm a size 9.5 men's and depending on the shoe, regular to extra wide width. I ordered these in a size 10 men's and they were huge all the way around, about a 1/2" on every side and nearly an inch too big front to back. It would probably take a few layers of thick socks to fit correctly. I'd say a size 9 men's would fit fine.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 21, 2020

Title: Crocs Review Correction
Review: I originally left a positive review but after wearing these Crocs the size was just too small.  I purchased a pair of Khaki Crocs in April this year from Amazon and the size was perfect.  These Crocs were definitely smaller.  I thought I could make it work but then decided to return.  I was not offered to exchange for another pair.  This made me think that they know that this color in their Crocs was mis-sized.  If they would have offered another pair sized correctly, I would have definitely exchanged.  The color is really nice.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2020

Title: Not all crocs are made equally
Review: I have gotten two pairs of crocs off of the actual website and I was pleased with them. When I saw Amazon had some at a cheaper price, I decided to try them using prime wardrobe. As soon I got them and tried them on, I immediately noticed a difference. The toe box was a little smaller and my feet would slide out when I would walk. I compared them to the crocs I got on the website, and the ones from Amazon definitely looked lower quality. The "crocs TM" logo across the strap wasn't as defined and the edges along the sides of the shoes weren't as smooth. The grips on the inside of the shoe weren't as defined either which is probably why my feet would slide out.. I looked at the tags and the ones I got from Amazon were made in Brazil while my other crocs from the website were made in Vietnam. I did research online and found that Crocs indeed has multiple factories across the globe, so the ones I were sent were likely NOT fakes. However, I am not the first person to note that the factories in Asia use a different mold than the ones in Brazil. Other people have also noticed a higher quality from the ones made in Vietnam. I TRIED to get myself to like these ones, but I just couldn't. Even if they were cheaper, I could TELL they were cheaper just by looking at them. I had to send them back. It's a shame that Crocs doesn't require the same mold and quality at all their locations. The lack of consistency is disappointing.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 29, 2020

Title: Mexico crocs are horrible
Review: I bought these and had to return them right away the pair my daughter got me for Mother‚Äôs Day were made in  Vietnam and they were soft and comfortable and last I am a certified nurses aide and work 12 hour days and were what I wanted then I ordered some same kind got them tried them on hard as a brick no give horrible and looked on the bottom and said they were made in Mexico I wish we could choose where we want to order them from cause I would order a pair from  Vietnam and not Mexico now I have to go store shopping to be able to get the ones I need for work so disappointed ‚òπÔ∏è ‚òπÔ∏è‚òπÔ∏è‚òπÔ∏è

Unfortunately, even though I purchased the exact same size, they are very small in comparison to my other classic Crocs.  In addition, the left shoe was noticeably tighter then the right. Will be returning.  And wasted a $10 coupon on these that I won't get back.

Title: Too big, and not comfortable

Title: now I've got a pair too
Review: I finally bought a pair of Crocs after finding them for the reasonable price of $19.99 on Amazon. I like Crocs, but I refuse to pay something like $30 to $45 for what essentially amounts to a pair of plastic slippers. I was skeptical of their usefulness, but they fill the niche (for me) between slippers and clogs pretty well.The fit was surprisingly small. I mean they are wide and clunky, but seem to run a bit short; I bought the 9 for my 8 1/2 foot, but there is not as much room in the toe-box as I expected. Despite being plastic, the shoes breathes very well and are comfortable enough for extended wear. Running to the mailbox or cleaning the house is an ideal use for this type of footwear. Beware taking out the garbage in the morning as the dew seeping through the holes will come as unwelcome surprise.Not that I knew I needed them, but Crocs are popular for a reason.  They are great for lounging around, but I am skeptical at the touted advantages of some of the more specialized models. Now, having bought a pair I feel existentially complete.Update 10/12/2012I am writing this review after about a week's worth of wear. The fit was simply too small and I had to give them away. I am trying the men's size 10 to see if they will be more comfortable. In my case it may be a matter of going a full size up.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2012

For the price I'd expect them to last longer or use a more abrasion resistant rubber. Other than that, they're comfortable.

Title: Just Ok
Review: I am a woman who wears a size 10. The length is exaxt, and while I do understand the sizes were unisex, these are extremely wide for a normal sized ladies foot. My foot slides side to side in them. I also thought there would be at least a 1/2" lift from front to back since there appears to be deep sole, however it is actually totally flat because your heel sits lower than the top edge of the heel. There are air holes that go around the front and sides of the shoe, and one in the front is in the exact place that my second toe sticks through it and debris gets in. The strap can swing frontward or backwards, however when it's backwards, it barely touches my heel since it's so long. It's not as cushy soft as other crocs I've tried on. They are something to kick around in, but nothing I would have bought had I tried them on at the store. I think I will stick to the ones made specifically for women.

Title: A health Hazard
Review: I used to love Crocs.  My first pair were the Classics then I got the slippers then the Yukon Sports and told everyone how great they were.  I could not have been so far from the truth.  These shoes keep podiatrists in business.  After 3 years of wearing my Classics nearly every day of the summer and spring I started to feel a growing discomfort in my knees when walking and especially when going down steps and began to suspect the Crocs when I noticed uneven treadwear.  I went to a podiatrist and he said the Crocs due to their spongy sole where not providing support or stabilizing my knees correctly.  He said I was experiencing pronation as a result which explained the uneven tread wear. He recommended Keen shoes instead.  I tried them on and it was immediate relief.  I could literally feel the pressure redistribute in my knees.  It felt like someone opened a pressure valve within my knee joints!  I also learned Crocs act as isolators and cause static electricity buildup which explains now why I regularly would get shocked when stepping out of my van.  Lastly, they are slippery as snot on wet concrete.  Almost went down several times.  They may feel soft on the feet but these things are the devil in disguise.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2011

Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 6, 2012

Title: Inconsistent shoe sizes
Review: I ordered two pairs of Crocs - one pair of thongs and one pair of cayman crocs. I used the sizing chart provided and ordered both pairs in M5/W7. However, when they arrived, while the Thongs fit perfectly, with room to wiggle, the Caymans were way too small (I'd almost say a full size too small). The Thongs were "made in China" and the Caymans "made in Mexico". I went to my local store and discovered that they receive Croc orders which are often made in multiple countries. It would appear to me that there is no "standard" mold used. So beware - just because you have tried them on in a store and think you have the correct size - you may end up getting a larger or smaller size, depending on where they are manufactured.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2008

Review: Wir haben gleich 3 Paar dieser Schuhe in unterschiedlichen Gr√∂√üen und Farben gekauft. Da wir diese Schuhe im Garten und auf der Terrasse benutzen wollten, lagen sie bei uns immer drau√üen. Nach einigen Tagen in der Sonne sind sie so eingeschrumpelt, dass man unm√∂glich noch seinen Fu√ü hinein bekommt. Die schwarze 43/44 passt h√∂chstens noch jemandem mit Schuhgr√∂√üe 36, und die dunkelblaue 42/43 kann niemand mehr tragen, da sie sich zus√§tzlich auch noch vorne extrem nach oben gebogen haben und jetzt gute Clownsschuhe beim Kinderfasching w√§ren. Das dritte Paar hat sich nur ein wenig verzogen, vermutlich weil es die hellblauen waren und da die Sonne nicht so draufbrezelt. Geht jedenfalls √ºberhaupt nicht f√ºr den Preis! H√§tte ich bei 5‚Ç¨ Schuhen erwartet. Wenigstens ein Hinweis, dass man die Schuhe nicht in die Sonne legen darf, w√§re wichtig!

Review: Die Schuhe passen gut und sind bequem. Da ich sie haupts√§chlich im Garten und auf der Terrasse benutzt habe, standen sie logischerweise auch mal in der Sonne - mit dem Ergebnis, dass sie nach nur 3-4 Wochen mindestens 3 Gr√∂√üen geschrumpft sind! Im ersten Moment dachte ich, dass ein Kind seine Schuhe aus Versehen bei uns stehen gelassen hat, weil ich mir gar nicht erkl√§ren konnte, wieso ich pl√∂tzlich nicht mehr in die Schuhe passte!Dabei wirbt der Hersteller mit "der perfekte Schuh f√ºr Strand oder Boot!" Nur darf die Sonne eben nicht l√§nger scheinen. Amazon hat kulanterweise den Schuh zur√ºckgenommen und den Kaufpreis erstattet, obwohl die Frist zur R√ºckgabe bereits verstrichen war.Da bereits mehrere K√§ufer von demselben Ph√§nomen berichten, sollte man den Schuh auf keinen Fall kaufen, wenn man vorhat, ihn auch drau√üen zu benutzen. Sehr entt√§uschend.

Review: Finger weg, Schuhe schrumpfen bei W√§rme. Verk√§ufer lehnt Gew√§hrleistung mit folgender Begr√ºndung ab:"Wir entschuldigen uns f√ºr Ihre schlechten Erfahrungen. Leider ist das Schrumpfen der Crocks jeden Sommer ein h√§ufiges Problem. Wir verstehen Ihre Unzufriedenheit vollkommen und es ist unsere Politik, jeden Kundenanspruch zu untersuchen, aber in diesem Fall k√∂nnen wir nicht viel tun. Die Garantie von Crocs deckt keine physischen Sch√§den ab, die durch Missbrauch und falsche Handhabung durch den Benutzer verursacht wurden.Einige F√§lle, in denen Crocs-Schuhe wahrscheinlich schrumpfen, sind:- wenn in einem hei√üen Auto gelassen;- wenn in der Sp√ºlmaschine gewaschen;- wenn drau√üen in der Sonne gelassen.Dies ist kein Herstellungsfehler.Im Internet finden Sie verschiedene Tutorials, mit denen Sie Ihre Schuhe reparieren und wieder anziehen k√∂nnen."Die Schuhe wurden -naturgem√§√ü- draussen gelagert, da sie als Gartenschuhe Verwendung finden sollten. Bei der ersten Hitzeperiode (35 Grad) sind sie geschrumpft und passen -vorher Gr. 46/47- nun noch Gr. 40. Wir haben seit vielen Jahren viele Modelle an Crocs, aber diese "Qualit√§t" ist uns neu. Keine Kaufempfehlung!

Review: Crocs sizing drives me mad. With both UK and US sizes and then even the UK sizes are incompatible with my feet. Normally a size 8 and knowing they're always on the large size I ordered a UK7 and this is still too big.

Review: They have changed the shape and feel of Classic Crocs which I think is a shame. I prefer the rounded wide front and squishiness of my old style crocs, these are considerably narrower at the front. I'm sure they have done this to try and make them less disagreeable to the anti-croccers, but actually they look more silly in their new slimline shape. They are also firmer- I preferred them soft.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on March 26, 2016

Review: I ordered these for my husband as a Christmas present.  He is size 7 so clicked on that size.  When they arrived they were good quality but looked too big, so Christmas surprise spoilt for him as I had to ask him to try them on just in case they were OK - but no they were much to big.  When I checked to bottom of the Crocs it said size 8.When you order the sizing chart shows mens size 7/women size 8 which I presume is wrong as generally women have smaller feet but quite what determines which size you get who knows a crystal ball maybe. I have had to return them so a complete waste of my time and a Christmas surprise spoilt.I now have a dilemma,  do I re-order size 6 hoping to get size 7 or just forget the whole thing.I noticed in the reviews that the quality is not generally in question but that wrong sizing  is a frequent complaint so maybe time the production information was corrected and customers stopped wasting their time..
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 29, 2020

Review: Others have commented on the strange sizing of Crocs, which seems to depend on whether they're made in Italy or China. I already had a pair of size 7s, which are roomy, so I only wear them round the house and garden.  And my son wears them (he's a size 9).  I needed something big to wear following a broken ankle so ordered a pair of black size 7.  They arrived and were visibly much smaller than the ones I already had. Small pair made in Italy, large pair made in China, both purporting to be size 7.  Really annoying.  I exchanged for a size 8 which is about the right size on my 'normal' foot - but I'm not usually an 8!Surely such a well known brand should be able to get its sizing right!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on April 2, 2013

Review: The soles inside most Crocs have very small, slightly raised bobbles, presumably to invigorate one's feet, except these can cause nerve damage over time to diabetics' feet like my husband's and he has many various wide styles of other shoe makes bought from Amazon and been very satisfied. Eventually after only a fortnight, his Crocs were causing considerable nerve pain, so he bought gel insoles to prevent further discomfort.Otherwise Crocs are very comfy. They come in a variety of great colours and whose straps help keep one's feet safety inside the shoe.I wrote to Crocs many times, only to receive no reply.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 13, 2020

Review: Sadly, I cannot get on with these crocs. I persevered for 2 days as I have used crocs every Summer for at least 20m years.I cannot wear these however as I think that the raised areas on the soles are too high.  The bottoms of my feet were too painful to persevere and further.By the raised areas, I mean the many bumps in the shoes.I printed a label and sent these crocs back to you last week so you should  have received them by now.  No sign of a refund to dateThese were returned via hermes on 26/05/2020. I guess hermes still has them.

Review: I usually buy Croc lookalikes (or mock crocs as I refer to them) from a well known high street shoe shop, but they seem to wear down on the heel quite quickly, so I thought I'd try the branded one's. I have wide feet, so purchase men's size 7 in the mock croc version. Other reviewers stated that sizing depended greatly on where their Crocs were made, but as I had no idea in advance which version I would receive, I thought I should stick with a size 7. I have to say mine are a little on the small side - not only narrower but also shorter in length. I wear them instead of slippers, so during the summer months they fit fine, but I cannot wear them with socks once it gets cooler - there simply isn't enough room in them. I think in future I will stick with the 2 pairs for ¬£8.00 mock crocs, and just replace them more often. I find it rather ironic that a cheaper high street pair, is more generously sized than the expensive branded version.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 26, 2015

Review: Bought a Womans size 6 to replace my girlfriends identical size 6 Crocs which are stamped Made in China.On arrival they are visibly smaller and stamped Made in Bosnia.Tried them against my mum's identical size 5 Crocs stamped Made in Italy and they are the same size.Size 7 made in Vietnam too big.So, check your sizing before buying

Review: I can wear them (UK 8)  although they are somewhat small but may stretch to some degree with service ,but if  I buy UK  9's they are too big and are like boats! I fully undertand they are designed and purposefully and made to a style " loose fitting" for comfort . But the one thing for us "inbetweeners", and I have experienced this with plenty of other footwear design/manufacturers is that it would be extremely useful if our Italian cousins who apparently made them (unless their plant is with our Far Eastern Cousins?). Would it be possible to suggest that theythey consider makig  a (1/2 half size ) through the perceived popular average range for for UK market feet i.e. some half sizes from 7 through to 11 1/2Love the Colour ,love the design the grip underneath,would just preferred a half 1/2 size bigger (8&1/2) ,would have been totally  satisfied. Thanks anyway for reading ...Brian.. North Wales ..06/08/2014.

Review: Die Crogs wurden schnell geliefert.Eigentlich ist 1 Stern zuwenig, aber ich war so irritiert als sie kamen, das ich erst dachte eine Kopie gekauft zu haben.Die Gr√∂√üe ist nun ganz anders als "fr√ºher"Ich habe derzeit - wie auf dem Bild zu sehen - ganz alte Crogs die mindestens 10 Jahre alt sind. Nun sind sie durchgelaufen, und einer an in der Sohle ein Loch. Deshalb mussten neue her.Ich habe die Gr√∂√üe, die 37/38 angegeben ist gekauft.Sie passen mir wie erwartet. Dennoch wundert es mich, das die alten eine Nummer kleiner waren, aber dennoch gr√∂√üer sind als die neuen.Also kauft jemand dieselbe Gr√∂√üe wie seine alten sind, werden sie viiiiiiiel zu gro√ü sein.Auf meinen alten steht noch "Made in Italy" auf den neuen "Made in Vietnam". Tja....Au√üerdem finde ich das die neuen h√§rter sind als die alten. Nicht mehr so flexibel.Fazit:Man kann sie kaufen, zumindest meine Farbe war g√ºnstig, aber andere sind teurer, und da w√ºrde ich schon nicht mehr empfehlen.Ich bin sehr gespannt wie sie sich in der Sonne verhalten, denn einige schreiben sie w√ºrden schrumpfen.Wenn dem so ist, haben sie nicht mal 1 Stern verdient.Meine jetzigen haben in all den Jahren ihre Gr√∂√üe beibehalten.Ich bin gespannt, und sollte dem so sein, das sie sich ver√§ndern werde ich leider nie wieder welche kaufen.

Review: I suffer from plantar fasciatis in both heels and was recommended these crocs by a friend who had suffered from the same ailment and got great relief from this type of shoe.  Within half an hour of putting them on I was in complete agony and spent several hours afterwards off my feet as I was unable to even hobble, never mind walk.  Needless to say I was very disappointed as I expected to be able to walk easier and relatively pain free once I wore them.  However, they did arrive in excellent time and were comfortable once I put them on, shoe size, width etc. was spot on.  My problems only began once I actually started to walk in them.  Perhaps this type of shoe helps mild plantar fascitis but it is definitely not good for the more debilitating type.  I would recommend these shoes only for people who do not suffer from pain in their feet.

Review: Size is somewhat large. I had ordered for M12 as per chart : but is loose on length and width. Overall you feel let down on a good product - first time Buyer need to be vey careful about size unless you have tried with friend or acquaintance and are very sure.To avoid hassles of import / refund you may buy online from shopcrocs.in - you wont have to take a financial hit.

Doch nach einigen Tagen, an denen es recht hei√ü war, glaubte ich, die Schuhe verwechselt zu haben und die meines √§lteren Sohnes angezogen zu haben.Allerdings hatte die nun mein j√ºngerer Sohn an, weil seine nahezu auf Puppengr√∂√üe geschrumpft und sich bananenartig gebogen hatten. Das gleiche Ph√§nomen zeigte sich bei den Schuhen meiner Frau und meines gr√∂√üeren Sohnes.Nach l√§ngerem Gr√ºbeln kam ich zu dem Schluss, dass wohl alle Schuhe geschrumpft sein mussten und bei Nachforschungen im Internet durfte ich feststellen, nicht allein mit diesem Problem zu sein.CROCS schrumpfen bei Hitze in der Sonne, jedenfalls diejenigen, die wir erhalten haben - und auch diejenigen anderer.Dies sind die ersten Schuhe, bei denen mir Derartiges passiert ist.Meine Schuhe mit Gr√∂√üe 42-43 passen nun nicht mal mehr meiner Frau mit Schuhgr√∂√üe 39.Diese Schuhe sind zum Wegwerfen.Ich werde mir jedenfalls keine mehr kaufen und kann sie gewiss niemandem empfehlen, da es auch kein vereinzelter Vorfall ist, wie jeder nachgoogeln kann.

Review: Y es por el precio y por el aparente "√©xito" de dicho calzado que me decid√≠ a probarlas.Primeramente quer√≠a decir que la talla es de broma. Pido unas 39/40 alarmado por los comentarios de otros compradores y a√∫n as√≠ me sobra zapato. Es grande...Despu√©s de investigar un poco sobre las crocs he llegado a la conclusi√≥n de que no son un zapato de calle. Buscad y leed que pueden ocasionar problemas musculares si andais mucho con ellas. O que la etiqueta que traen y que advierte de tener precauci√≥n en las escaleras mec√°nicas es porque ya ha habido gente lesion√°ndose con ellas... algunas muy gore....Para mi suerte, yo buscaba hacerles un uso 100% dentro de casa como zapatillas de estar por casa.Y CUMPLEN porque:1 Amortiguan muy bien la pisada y tienen una zona de masaje por todo el pie (si hace algo o no, ni idea, pero ah√≠ est√° y se nota).2 De momento no cogen olores raros (salvo su pl√°stico caracter√≠stico)3 Son c√≥modos y protegen el pie de golpes contra picos y patas de los muebles (al ser goma (o lo que sea) no notas dolor al impactar accidentalmente en cosas)4 Son antideslizantes SIIIII y da igual si pisas lo fregado que no deslizas. Pero ojo, que la bronca de tu pareja / padres por pisarles lo recien fregado no te la quita nadie.De todas formas y desde un punto de vista pr√°cticos tienen DEFECTOS....1) 42 euros.... estamos locos? que es un pol√≠mero (pl√°stico) insertado en un molde y ya est√°.2) El pie suda... Yo me pongo calcetines para no sentir tanto el tacto directo y a√∫n as√≠ las zonas con mucho contacto con el material sin agujeros suda y el calcet√≠n puessss algo si que se nota h√∫medo.3) Se rozan facilmente y pierden material de la suela (que se desgastan r√°pido, vamos).Mi conclusi√≥n es que puede que repita (a precios amazon) este calzado PARA USARLO POR CASA. O incluso entiendo gente que est√° mucho tiempo de pie y las usen para trabajar pues son c√≥modos y el pie respira m√°s que con otro calzado cerrado.PERO NO ES UN CALZADO DE CALLE... da problemas musculares, se desgastan r√°pido y es antiest√©tico.

Review: Amazon Prime is amazing! You can get the wrong size delivered the very next day - not once, ladies and gentlemen, not twice, boys and girls, but THREE TIMES! I could stuff the packaging into these size 11 Crocs to pad them out a bit, I suppose. I've looked on Amazon for a pair of size 11 feet, but any search involving body parts is frowned upon, it seems. I'd like to review the product, they look fine, and I'm sure that if I ever received a pair that fitted they'd do the job nicely, but without a road test a review would be meaningless. Review: These genuine Crocs were not a UK size 12 as advertised and as per the Crocs label.  I have been buying my Dad size 12 Crocs for years without any problem with the sizing.  His Crocs that fit have the number 12 on the sole.  These had a number 13 on the sole but the label clearly stated "UK 12".  They were too big.  My Dad has mobility issues and having shoes that fit is imperative to his being able to walk safely and confidently.  Unfortunately I could not return as I trusted the label which I had removed and had written my Dad's name on (he lives in a care-home).  This has put me off buying genuine Crocs on-line.

Review: This is the 3rd pair of Crocs I have bought online. Always same size, for my father and myself. However, this time, although the specs are exactly the same (as shown on the soles) the crocs are 2 cm shorter than previous pairs. We only noticed this fault when I gave the crocs as a gift to my dad, who lives overseas. It is frustrating and embarrassing. Also, it is very inconvenient to bring the crocs back to the UK, ship them back, etc. Very poor experience due to these nonsensical, inconsistent sizes. My advice: buy your Crocs in a normal retail store, as Amazon has proved unreliable in relation to sizes.

Pero' le suole sono consummate e quindi sono molto pericolose sul bagnato. Adesso invece le scarpe dentro sono dure e dopo poco tempo danno fastidio al piede. Title: How Crocs Changed My Life
Review: I will admit, I once was a hater. I lived a hateful negative life where I truly despised this footwear. But recently I've made many drastic life changes and these shoes have helped me see the light. They have helped me to see the beauty of the world and give me the confidence to face whatever obstacles life may throw my way. I can now walk outside with confidence. These shoes, these marvelous shoes, help me to live my life to the fullest not only in style but with such comfort no amount of words can begin to describe. I will now continue to live my life with an open mind to such fashion statements. No more will I live with my head hung low, but now I wear my crocs with pride. Sports mode empowers me while relaxed mode truly is the epitome of serenity. Crocs have also been the glue that has bonded me and one my best friends. Crocs truly change your life and bring people together. I will forever be indebted to this spectacular shoe.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2019

Title: Call me a Croc Enthusiast!!
Review: I LOVE THESE THINGS!! They're stylish and functional. These shoes are the future. It is not hard to pull them off with any outfit. Wear them to school, wear them to run errands, wear them to church! I sure do! Nothing can compare to these wonderful shoes.These shoes really show individuality. With a variety of colors and endless shoe charms, you can express who you are in a unique and fashionable way. Be a trend setter with Crocs, the shoes that should have never gone out of style!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2017

Title: Freesail vs Classic
Review: I own 2 pair of Crocs women's Freesail and figured I'd try a pair of the classics.  The Freesail are much trimmer & narrower in width than the  women's Classics.  I love both.  The Classics are quite a bit boxier and wider in width  than the Freesail and the Classics seem to have a bit more  cushioning on the bottom.  Both work well for my problem feet which are usually sporting the Alegria brand shoes/sandals  for work.  However, on weekends and downtime, I prefer Crocs.  I have hammer toes  and deteriorating foot joints and have lost most of natural cushioning on the bottom of my feet making it feel like I'm walking on marbles. I typically wear a women's 8/12 or a European size  39.  In Crocs, I always  go a size 9 for the length.  I love both the Freesail and Classics and would urge anyone with "touchy feet" to give these a try.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2017

Title: Cutest Comfy Ugly Shoe You Can Buy
Review: I bought this classic fit (wide) shoe in size 6 men to get a size 8 women's.  It fits perfectly.  Most comfortable shoe or clog ever.  They are also ugly but they are so ugly that they are cute. To be clear, I bought these to wear with fluffy socks so I have the room I need (my feet are not wide) when wearing the fluffy socks. The strap can be in the back or in the front.  I like having it across my heel when wearing socks.  Feet don't sweat thanks to all of the vents.  You can also put cute little Jibbitz on them that people will notice and take their attention away from the ugly shoes.  You can wear these things all day, 10-12 hours and your feet and legs will hold out.  I got the original classic style because so many people online complained about the soles coming apart on the newer style.  So buyer beware, if you try them you will love them.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2017

Title: and we like how easy it is to get them on
Review: I never, ever thought I'd wear Crocs, but here I am.Our 1.5 year old daughter loves her Crocs, and we like how easy it is to get them on, how we don't have to fuss over socks, etc. They're great summer shoes for kids. After a while I started thinking about getting myself a pair just as yard work/grilling/fishing/etc. shoes for the same reason. Which is what they started as, but during one Home Depot trip I realized I never took them off and was wearing them out. Fair game, I guess I'm living the Croc life now.Regarding sizing, I saw some strange advice all over. And perhaps it's different between colors, so for clarity's sake I got the Khaki color. Anyway, I saw some people talking about sizing down, but I really don't think that's the right way to go. Crocs do feel loose on your feet, but just wear them around a bit and you'll realize that they're just fine and very secure. The bottom "floats" a little bit so you don't develop blisters, but the strap holds them to your feet pretty well. If this were a normal shoe, then I'd size down. But it's not, and it doesn't wear/stretch/weigh the same, so I recommend getting your true size. I'm a 12D, sometimes 11.5 or 12.5, and once in a blue moon a 13. Size 12 works fine for me here.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2017

Title: I have avoided crocs because they are big clown shoes in appearance and I didn't want look like a.
Review: These are my first crocs.  I have avoided crocs because they are big clown shoes in appearance and I didn't want look like a ...you know.  I finally bought a pair because I am now swimming regularly and needed shoes that could get wet at the pool.  I hate flip flops, which abrade the tender area between big toe and second toe.  Well, I bought the crocs and they are awesome!  Very comfortable.  I have arthritis in my feet and the crocs are surprisingly supportive.  I wear them for long drives.  They are great at the dog park or in the back yard where I am likely to step in something that is very difficult to clean off sneakers but comes off easily with a hose or a wipe from my clogs.  Best of all, I look cool in them, and I know this because the younger generation is impressed.  Not the 20 somethings, who tend to roll their eyes, or my contemporaries who look askance and ask if I have been gardening but the stylesetters of tomorrow.  I wore them to the beach and a toddler and a four year old both patted my shoes. Now I want crocs in every color of the rainbow.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2015

Title: Never thought I'd buy but very happy now
Review: Never thought I'd buy a pair of crocs. I've been making fun of them for the past decade but when we moved into a new place with hard floors, I needed something to wear around the house. I stand/walk a lot at work and wanted something that was very comfortable.Got these bad boys and couldn't be happier. After a long day in dress shoes I look forward to wearing these when I get home. Great for working around the house and going up and down the stairs on hard flooring. I flip the strap up and go for the clog configuration. The look better that way and stay on fine without the strap behind your heel. Also nice that they are pretty grippy. I wear them cooking in the kitchen and don't have any issues when I spill stuff on the floor.I would definitely recommend these to anyone. They don't look the coolest but I'm a dad now so I'm fine with that. They are a much more comfortable upgrade from flip flop or slipper for wearing around the house. My only regret is not getting a cool color. If you're gonna get crocs you might as well go big!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2017

Title: Comfy but there are size inconsistencies
Review: I ordered 2 pairs of these crocs classics, cerulean and pepper. Pepper is a true red (I was worried it might look pink) and the cerulean is very blue, not purple at all. I usually wear men's size 8.5 shoes and an m8/w10 fit when tried on in a store. However I read lots of reviews that said the sizes were very inconsistent. I need these soon so don't have time to mess with exchanges so I ordered m8/w10 and m9/w11. They were exactly the same size. Width, length, everything was the same, it was weird. I think they fit more like a m9/w11 but that's fine. I wanted/expected these to be pretty loose like my old ones from over a decade ago. These are pretty comfy like I remember and hopefully they last like my old ones did. I didn't find them shiny, uncomfortably small/narrow or the nubs inside to be too painful, which were all common complaints. Overall I say try them on in store first especially if you're in between sizes. I have high hopes for these. (These are the made in mexico ones by the way)
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2017

Title: Yay, crocs!
Review: Because of wide feet, I've been afraid of ordering these popular shoes.  Over the years I've had to return or give away shoes I carefully chose, cos only the front of my feet are wide (like a duck). Have to have some sort of strap, or tie on.  My siblings would urge me to try them, so I took the plunge. The 1st pair had to be returned because of a simply mistake at the factory; the wrong size was put in the box.  The replacement arrived yesterday, and I could turn cartwheels, if I could. So comfortable, roomy, and no breaking in period. With regular leather shoes, the little toe on my right foot is still squeezed; with the Crocs, no problem!  And it keeps my feet cool! These are officially my fav shoes. Plan to buy more in diff colors.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 11, 2017

Title: OBSESSED.
Review: these just arrived not even 10 minutes ago and i'm already writing a review ! such a cute colour (pink lemonade) and they came brand new with all the original tags. didn't get a fake or damaged pair. also, i was VERY worried about the fit because the reviews were all over the place and i haven't worn crocs since elementary school lol my left foot is also a size smaller than my right, so finding shoes is a struggle to say the least. BUT. these fit PERFECTLY (on both feet !) i've never had a shoe fit so well before. i got a size 6 and believe me when i say i spent DAYS looking through reviews and debating between sizes and i'm glad i didn't size up. they fit very true to size. also, my adidas superstar's are a size US 4.5, sperry's are a size 6, nike air force 1's are size 6.5, and hollister/abercrombie flip flops/sandals are a size small (6-7), etc. only putting these for reference because i know that's one of the things i always look for in reviews. kind of unrelated but useful info in some cases.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 18, 2020

Title: How Crocs Changed My Life
Review: I will admit, I once was a hater. I lived a hateful negative life where I truly despised this footwear. But recently I've made many drastic life changes and these shoes have helped me see the light. They have helped me to see the beauty of the world and give me the confidence to face whatever obstacles life may throw my way. I can now walk outside with confidence. These shoes, these marvelous shoes, help me to live my life to the fullest not only in style but with such comfort no amount of words can begin to describe. I will now continue to live my life with an open mind to such fashion statements. No more will I live with my head hung low, but now I wear my crocs with pride. Sports mode empowers me while relaxed mode truly is the epitome of serenity. Crocs have also been the glue that has bonded me and one my best friends. Crocs truly change your life and bring people together. I will forever be indebted to this spectacular shoe.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2019

Title: Call me a Croc Enthusiast!!
Review: I LOVE THESE THINGS!! They're stylish and functional. These shoes are the future. It is not hard to pull them off with any outfit. Wear them to school, wear them to run errands, wear them to church! I sure do! Nothing can compare to these wonderful shoes.These shoes really show individuality. With a variety of colors and endless shoe charms, you can express who you are in a unique and fashionable way. Be a trend setter with Crocs, the shoes that should have never gone out of style!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2017

Title: Freesail vs Classic
Review: I own 2 pair of Crocs women's Freesail and figured I'd try a pair of the classics.  The Freesail are much trimmer & narrower in width than the  women's Classics.  I love both.  The Classics are quite a bit boxier and wider in width  than the Freesail and the Classics seem to have a bit more  cushioning on the bottom.  Both work well for my problem feet which are usually sporting the Alegria brand shoes/sandals  for work.  However, on weekends and downtime, I prefer Crocs.  I have hammer toes  and deteriorating foot joints and have lost most of natural cushioning on the bottom of my feet making it feel like I'm walking on marbles. I typically wear a women's 8/12 or a European size  39.  In Crocs, I always  go a size 9 for the length.  I love both the Freesail and Classics and would urge anyone with "touchy feet" to give these a try.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2017

Title: Cutest Comfy Ugly Shoe You Can Buy
Review: I bought this classic fit (wide) shoe in size 6 men to get a size 8 women's.  It fits perfectly.  Most comfortable shoe or clog ever.  They are also ugly but they are so ugly that they are cute. To be clear, I bought these to wear with fluffy socks so I have the room I need (my feet are not wide) when wearing the fluffy socks. The strap can be in the back or in the front.  I like having it across my heel when wearing socks.  Feet don't sweat thanks to all of the vents.  You can also put cute little Jibbitz on them that people will notice and take their attention away from the ugly shoes.  You can wear these things all day, 10-12 hours and your feet and legs will hold out.  I got the original classic style because so many people online complained about the soles coming apart on the newer style.  So buyer beware, if you try them you will love them.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2017

Title: and we like how easy it is to get them on
Review: I never, ever thought I'd wear Crocs, but here I am.Our 1.5 year old daughter loves her Crocs, and we like how easy it is to get them on, how we don't have to fuss over socks, etc. They're great summer shoes for kids. After a while I started thinking about getting myself a pair just as yard work/grilling/fishing/etc. shoes for the same reason. Which is what they started as, but during one Home Depot trip I realized I never took them off and was wearing them out. Fair game, I guess I'm living the Croc life now.Regarding sizing, I saw some strange advice all over. And perhaps it's different between colors, so for clarity's sake I got the Khaki color. Anyway, I saw some people talking about sizing down, but I really don't think that's the right way to go. Crocs do feel loose on your feet, but just wear them around a bit and you'll realize that they're just fine and very secure. The bottom "floats" a little bit so you don't develop blisters, but the strap holds them to your feet pretty well. If this were a normal shoe, then I'd size down. But it's not, and it doesn't wear/stretch/weigh the same, so I recommend getting your true size. I'm a 12D, sometimes 11.5 or 12.5, and once in a blue moon a 13. Size 12 works fine for me here.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2017

Title: I have avoided crocs because they are big clown shoes in appearance and I didn't want look like a.
Review: These are my first crocs.  I have avoided crocs because they are big clown shoes in appearance and I didn't want look like a ...you know.  I finally bought a pair because I am now swimming regularly and needed shoes that could get wet at the pool.  I hate flip flops, which abrade the tender area between big toe and second toe.  Well, I bought the crocs and they are awesome!  Very comfortable.  I have arthritis in my feet and the crocs are surprisingly supportive.  I wear them for long drives.  They are great at the dog park or in the back yard where I am likely to step in something that is very difficult to clean off sneakers but comes off easily with a hose or a wipe from my clogs.  Best of all, I look cool in them, and I know this because the younger generation is impressed.  Not the 20 somethings, who tend to roll their eyes, or my contemporaries who look askance and ask if I have been gardening but the stylesetters of tomorrow.  I wore them to the beach and a toddler and a four year old both patted my shoes. Now I want crocs in every color of the rainbow.

Title: Best Purchase Ever
Review: literally best purchase of my life. Everything went well was packaged very nicely. They looked great with my prom dress. I couldn't have asked for anything else

Title: My new FAVORITE SHOES üíØüòä
Review: I am so GRATEFUL my sis got her Croc‚Äôs for work and then I thought to myself those are super comfy looking. Well yes they are comfy and easy to clean. I‚Äôm basically wearing them anytime I have to run outside to do gardening or pick up dog poop üí©, I‚Äôve also worn them out running errands as well. I love the bright blue color I got. I had to return the first pair I ordered since they were too large. So I went a size down and they fit perfectly! I couldn‚Äôt be happier with this purchase! Oh and I‚Äôve stepped in a massive pile of GSD üí© and it washes right off these adorable shoes. Perfect function so easy to clean. I‚Äôm literally hooked for life and I don‚Äôt know how I never bought üêä Croc‚Äôs before?!?!My order came in the time frame they said it would. It took about a week, with Prime. Worth the wait. I love the fact that they look good with everything I wear. I don‚Äôt dress up much so I wouldn‚Äôt recommend wearing them with an evening gown üòÇ but they are breathable and my feet don‚Äôt stink in these either. They were in new packaging too. I will get lots of use out of these for sure. They are super comfortable and actually feel great on my feet. All and all my new favorite house shoes üíØ!!! I definitely recommend this purchase to anyone out there who hasn‚Äôt tried these out before! They are amazing! Stay safe out there!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 6, 2020

Title: Comfy and Convenient
Review: My husband wore crocs on our first date and I honestly almost ended it then, but I decided what the heck. Who cares what he wears on his feet?? Then he revealed that he usually wears his crocs with SOCKS. It‚Äôs freaking hideous and I have made fun of him for YEARS. But recently, I needed a pair of shoes to toss on to take the dog on quick walks or just run to the mailbox and he surprised me with a pair of these bad boys (in mint, my favorite color). I swore I wouldn‚Äôt wear them.. and yet, Here I am! Wearing them every stinkin day now!! These shoes are not stylish. They make your feet look like gigantic doll feet. But they are THE most comfortable and convenient shoes I‚Äôve ever worn. They are easy to clean, breathable and great for days at the beach or river. If my husband sees this, I admit I was wrong. I still won‚Äôt say that out loud, but here ya go.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2020

Title: Get them on sale! Worth every penny!
Review: I‚Äôve actually always disliked crocks for some reason but something sparked inside my head while in quarantine and decided to give them a chance since I wouldn‚Äôt be leaving my house any time soon and no one would see me in them and honestly It was the best decision I‚Äôve ever made!I actually got them on sale $10 off so I only paid $32 bucks and I love them! The insole was a little uncomfortable the first few days of wearing them, they poke and feel wired and itch your feet s bit after you take them off but after wearing them a few days , I don‚Äôt even wanna take them off! Lol‚û°Ô∏è Sizing!!! ‚¨ÖÔ∏èI was skeptical about ordering them online because I don‚Äôt know my size in there size but after much research and reviews I figured out that crocks are more comfortable and suppose to fit big!I wear a Size 9.5 (men) and have a pretty wide foot and everywhere said to size one up so I got size 10 (men) and they fit perfectly and comfortably!Over all I would recommend a pair for everyone ! Went outside did some grading stuff rinsed them right off looked good as new!! Can‚Äôt wait to Customize them! 10/10 recommend!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2020

Title: Crocs are my life
Review: Where do I begin. If you do not own a pair of crocs by now, you need to buy yourself a pair right now. I used to buy ‚Äúcrocs‚Äù from the 99 cents store because I was on a budget, and by budget I mean absolutely broke. It wasn‚Äôt until I got my first job two years ago where I bought my first real pair and mannnn when I tell you that these are the most comfortable shoes ever, these are the most comfortable shoes ever. I can‚Äôt believe I was walking around in the knock off ones with no support, no wonder my back hurt so much. Well here I am two years later and I own 18 pairs of crocs. Everybody used to make fun of me but now I have people asking me for croc recommendations. If you are worried about looking dumb because these aren‚Äôt the cutest foot wear out there, these shoes are made to help you come as you are. If you are confident, it shines through. I almost have every color in the classic clogs and I am now going to invest in some bayaband, lite ride and bistro clogs. Crocs are an everyday, every moment type of thing for me and I am so glad that I am able to truly express myself through my beautiful crocs.I WILL SAY AS A SIDENOTE, those who experience discomfort, it may be because you have a flat foot as those with flat feet are better of wearing shoes like vans, converse, etc. (shoes that have no arch support)
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2020

Title: Works great on my feet!
Review: My chiropractor recommended wearing crocs since I started having plantar fasciitis problems. I usually wear woman's size 8 shoes, and got these in size 8. They seem a little big but it's actually more comfortable to wear that way, so I think these fit me perfectly. I like to life up the back holder part and wear them around like sandals. It's also nice when it's cold cause I can just slip them on with my socks on. As for dealing with my plantar fasciitis, it ended up working for me! I wore these every day, and at first I didn't notice that much of a difference and my feet ached in the morning for a while too, but around a year into wearing these, I have completely recovered from plantar fasciitis!! It's like I never even had plantar fasciitis before! I think it took a while for my feet to heal since it's something we use every day. Now I am able to wear normal flat sandals too and my feet are fine in the mornings. I still wear crocs and their brand sandals for my main footwear though, cause I think it helps to prevent plantar fasciitis from happening.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2019

Title: Husband Hates the Look, LOVES the feel
Review: My husband has Plantar fasciitis (as I also have) and he has tried different inserts, balls to rub his feet on, exercises, etc.I have been wearing Crocs for over a year and they have alleviated my pain significantly, but he didn't like the way they looked.So, I decided to buy him a pair for Christmas, told him to just wear them around the house. He LOVES them. His feet are so much better, he takes his work shoes off the minute he gets in the house to put these on. I am so glad I bought them for him! He has actually talked to a couple of friends at work who told him they have been wearing them for years for the same reason!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2018

Title: BABYYYYY My feet are in Heaven
Review: So full disclosure in this review so please don't judge. There aren't any Crocs stores in the area I live in but I heard they were really comfortable and good support for people who are on their feet all day. I have issues with my arches and typically wear arch supports in my shoes so that I can both walk better and so my feet don't hurt. When I don't wear my arch supports, my feet hurt and the pain radiates up to my knees and higher. I love to wear flip flops but if you are like me, your doctor told you heck no that's horrible for your feet.So, I purchased a bunch of "garden" shoes or fake crocs. Don't get me wrong these are amazing and I wear them all the time I just had no idea that they weren't real crocs. Let me try to explain.I saw the yellow colored crocs in DSW about 3 weeks ago and fell in love, but of course they didn't have any more even online in my size in yellow. I come to trusty old AMAZON and they are selling for more than $40. No thank you I will wait. I check out the CROCS site and with shipping its more than that. So I wait. I wait and wait until they drop down to $31 and change and I get em. Now you guys don't know me but I am just excited to add another color to my collection so I thought.I sprayed them down with Lysol after I open the zip lock bag they were in and sat them on my back porch you know for safety and all that good stuff. So I take the trash out and remember that they are out there so I bring em in and wash em off again because now they have outside germs even though no one has been on or near my back porch. I dry them off and put them on my feet.HALLELUJAH!!!!I thought I had ascended to heaven! You don't know the struggles I have with these here size 8's. The support I felt, the cushion I felt, the prinkly things in the shoe that massage my feet while feeling slightly weird when my toes touch them when I am sitting, it all was surreal. I woke up my brother. I went outside and screamed YES YES YES like I was a WWE wrestler. I immediately came back to amazon to look and see what color shoe I didn't have to order more.Needless to say, I look at price too and I can't afford any of these colors at this time but I LOVE MY YELLOW CROCS. I prefer crocs over sneakers or tennis but I wear tennis to protect my foot in case I feel like jogging or running.Buy you these shoes. Don't have any yet? Ain't nothing like the real thing is all I have to say.TRUST ME ON THIS ONE!Signed,A Satisfied customer
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2020

Title: Whaaatt are thooossseee?!
Review: Ordered a W8. This is my first pair of Crocs & I‚Äôm not sure whyyyyyy I waited this long to get a pair. Now I see why ppl use it. Very comfortable. I‚Äôm flat footed. I was able to wear it barefoot & also w| thin socks (tester around the house). The strap part to keep your feet in, it‚Äôs actually shorter than the actual length of the shoe (it‚Äôs not lined up with the heel part . Around a quarter of an inch or so from the heel) so when it goes around the back of your foot, it actually pushes your feel more inside the shoe. This isn‚Äôt a big deal for me as I‚Äôm actually a 7.5 women‚Äôs. I always love ordering any shoe item a half size bigger to have the extra room for thicker socks if needed. My Crocs were made in Mexico. I‚Äôve seen some complaints about sizing issues when it‚Äôs made in different countries. Anyways, I would recommend a pair to anyone.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2019

Title: Great versatile play shoes
Review: We love crocs- all of my kids have a pair as their summer play shoes! We have a small farm and these are perfect- they can step in anything and hose off without a problem, wear them to play in the creek or the pond (if they come off in the pond they float and are easily retrievable!), and the versatility of wear with the heel strap makes it great for super active kids that like to run. I purchased this pair for my oldest, and as usual they are slightly bigger but we expected that. Great product.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 9, 2020

Title: The advice is to go a size down, but I suggest going a size up!
Review: I love these shoes! Crocs are silly looking yes, but that is what I love about them! I'm writing this review mainly just to note that in the description, it advises that if you're a half size to go a size down, since crocs can be large fitting/wide. However, this wasn't the case for me. I'm a size 7 and 1/2 in womens, so I chose a size 7, but I had to return it as I found it too tight fitting. If you fit size 8 converse just fine, then you most likely have feet similar to mine, so I'd recommend going a size up! Even without socks, it was uncomfortable enough for me to have to return it for a larger size.Besides the size issue, the shoes are wonderful! The coupon is also a great deal.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2019

Title: Some things seem off .
Review: I ordered the yellow (beautiful , bright color by the way) ! The shoe itself fits PERFECTLY!! I ordered my regular size and the fit is right on. My only concern is (after reading previous reviews about counterfeit shoes) after comparing them to my other CROCS (whom I know for a fact are authentic) , things does seem a little off. I‚Äôm not sure if it means anything . But my other crocs read ‚ÄúMade in Vietnam‚Äù and these read ‚ÄúMade in China‚Äù ... which has me a little confused. Again , IT MAY BE NOTHING !! I just had to point out that fact . Which that may be why these looks a little cheaper than my originals . They look kinda like they were RUSHED on the assembly line when you‚Äôre looking at them closely  . Other than this . They‚Äôre great ! Great color , size , fit . I‚Äôm definitely gonna keep them !
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2020

Title: Caved and bought a pair. After this review, you will to
Review: Anyone going on deployment needs Crocs, so I got these for $30ish. They came in a plastic Crocs bag in new condition. I put them on and immediately felt weird, but you eventually get over your loss of dignity, as everyone else owns a pair. When they‚Äôre new, they have these nubs that you put your feet onto that stab you with every step, but in a good way. Every other shoe brand says I‚Äôm a 9M, but Crocs think I‚Äôm a 10M, so make sure you get a size up for anything from this brand. There is no slip resistance, so watch yourself in the shower. The Off-road ankle strap seems durable and the whole shoe feels like it will hold up to any challenge. The top is flexible and will stretch.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2020

Title: Perfect! Order up a size; especially if you wear a half size!
Review: *I bought the charms separately on amazon; highly recommend(never too old for charms!!)**I normally wear a size women‚Äôs 9 (sometimes 9.5) but I bought a size 10. I ALWAYS recommend going up a size in crocs. These are not sneakers that need to be snug. You don‚Äôt want these to be tight at all! These are relaxing shoes. If they are snug, your feet will rub, get smelly, and create sores from the rubbing. And my foot just barely hangs over the edge when I bought a size 9 a while ago.They have a strap on the back to help keep your feet in place (I call that putting them in 4 wheel drive), or you can flip the strap to the front (shown in my picture). I prefer it that way because it‚Äôs easy to slide on and off like slippers.I personally wear this pair to work.I bought different colors for day to day wear.They are SUPER easy to clean! I typically use a disinfectant wipe; but you can use all purpose cleaner a towel, spray Lysol, wash them in the sink with dish soap, etc. But do NOT use bleach!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2020

Title: Surprisingly Great
Review: I didn‚Äôt want to love Crocs. They are so boxy and ugly, but that ugliness grew on me really fast once I started wearing them. I bought them because I needed gardening shoes. My other shoes were constantly having soil and other yard debris packed into the treads and it was way too much work to clean them out. So, I decided to give a pair of Crocs a try since with the holes they should get decent airflow and I could hose them off or toss them in the washing machine as needed. So, I reluctantly bought a pair of very purple Crocs.After a week of wearing my new Crocs, I can say I totally get why people love these things.They have NO arch support, which for me is generally horrible but they‚Äôre so roomy that it‚Äôs more like walking barefoot than it is like wearing bad shoes.With as roomy as they are, not at all form fitting, you‚Äôd think your feet would slip and slide all over the place and you‚Äôd have to work to keep them on your feet. But they don‚Äôt. My feet stay in place and the Crocs stay on my feet just fine.Nothing sticks to them. Dirt and soil get in through the holes, but also go right back out through the holes, just leaving behind dirty feet. And nothing has stuck to the treads: dirt, soil, mud, dog poop, compost‚Ä¶ nothin‚Äô. They also don‚Äôt stay wet long at all. I had to go out in the pouring rain and they were dry by the time I walked through my house.And, with all the holes, there‚Äôs great air circulation, just about as good as sandals. This was my first pair of Crocs; I doubt it will be my last. They‚Äôre too comfortable and convenient not to love them.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 12, 2020

Title: Great, love them.
Review: This is the second pair of Crocs I bought in the last month. Never owned a pair and always thought they looked ugly, and never understood why there was this attraction to them.I have wide feet, 12 4E, I was skeptical the 12 M size was going to be too tight.  They fit perfectly, I guess because they are wide to start off with, although if I had narrow feet I probably wouldn't be too happy with them.The things are super comfortable and around the house, I wear them with strap up front so I can just slip them off and on like a pair of slippers.  When I go out I wear the strap in the rear to secure them completely on my feet.They may not be the most beautiful pair of footwear, but I have worn them out dancing, even playing golf. They're great, that's why I bought this second pair.I was also skeptical about the little knobs on the inside of the shoe, but these I found kind of massage your feet and make them feel good.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 24, 2019

Title: Raised letters that say Hecho in Mexico on strap hurt the backs of my feet, this is new
Review: I have been wearing crocs for years. I have had many pairs of this kind that I ordered. However, this time I bought them, I put them on, and wore them for a few hours. And I was like why are the backs of my ankles hurting? It felt like something was rubbing the backs of my ankles. I tried to ignore it, but ultimately I became worried it was going to rub the skin off my ankles so I took the shoes off and looked at them. The reason why the strap hurts is because it says "Hecho in Mexico" in RAISED lettering!! The letters on the inside of the strap are raised and keep rubbing the backs of my ankles as I walk. So I have concluded that the only way to wear these shoes safely is to move the strap from the back ankle area to the top of the shoe, which I don't like. Why did you have to do this, Crocs??? Please stop putting the raised letters of Hecho in Mexico on the inside strap because it hurts my skin. I want Crocs to stop making the shoes like this, because it sucks if my shoes hurt because of this. Why?? Please remove this lettering off the inside straps because you're causing pain to your customers.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2020

Title: 13 year journey from 2007 to 2020 achievement unlocked
Review: In 2007 I really wanted a pair of crocs but we couldn‚Äôt afford the name brand so I got purple air walks instead. Most of my life has been that Clover Valley or Great Value edition. Flash forward to 2020, I bought my first pair of crocs in my mid twenties. I‚Äôve been preparing 13 years to experience this moment. Do I have regrets for purchasing hole shoes? Probably. Do I have an insane amount of air flow for my toes? Most definitely. Am I posting a ridiculous photo review on Amazon about my journey? You bet. I was not prepared for the true power unlocked through wearing crocs.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 29, 2020

Title: MOST COMFORTABLE SHOES EVER!‚ô•Ô∏èü§ûüèª
Review: I got these for my husband, he is a size 10 to size 11 in men's shoes, and I bought a size 10 and it fit perfectly.From my experience these shoes always have an extra wiggle room in the back so if you're in between sizes going down one won't hurt.Also, it is the authentic Crocs brand and is great quality. It's light to walk with, not heavy to the foot! üëû‚ô•Ô∏è
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2020

Title: Perfect for Disney!
Review: Love these crocs!!  Family planned a vacation to Disney and we heard that to avoid blisters we should purchase a pair of crocs.  Needless to say, they saved our vacation.  I wore nothing but the cros while we were there.  I didn't want to take the chance of getting blisters walking 25,000 steps a day for 10 days.  They are quick and easy to dry after getting wet, can be worn with or without short socks, are very comfortable to walk in, cushioned and arch support.  Toe width has enough room for comfortable spread with no rubbing on sides or top of toes.  I wouldn't recommend any other shoe for Disney or for sore tired feet.  Just love them!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2019

Title: Not the nicest looking shoe but the most comfy.
Review: As much as I'd love brown leather wingtip oxfords, they're impossible to find in womens size 5/6 in Wide Width. or anything nice looking for that matter. and I got tired of looking. When you have Cerebral Palsy, dressing is a struggle. I got to a point where I wanted something that I could put on without help, and comfortable with or without socks. Are they kinda ugly? Yeah. But it's worth it. I plan on getting two in black so they can blend in with my pants, but sometimes I enjoy colors. So far I own a Slate Grey and Navy. Both pairs were the right size (I ended up getting Womens 6. A little roomy but not too much, and i have tiny feet) Obviously they're snugger when I wear them with fuzzy socks.  These shoes are also great toe box wise. My heel is very narrow and my foot widens up to my toe box. The toe box is wide enough to where I don't feel squeezed at all, even with thick socks.When I'm travelling and the hotel doesn't have a shower seat I can wear these in the shower since I can't go barefoot. They are very easy to rinse out and dry.Even with my issue with dragging my left big toe, they're pretty sturdy. Most shoes after half a year would already have a hole and need to be replaced. I plan on getting second pairs just to have just in case, but I don't think my left shoes will wear through soon. They're not extremely supportive, I wouldn't recommend them for running, but as someone with chronic pain and weak ankle/foot muscles, these are great for around the house and walking through a bookstore.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2019

Title: Decent support for around the house
Review: I got these on a friend's recommendation after avoiding Crocs for years. I never understood what the hype was before, but my friend insisted that if I wanted something to support my feet while doing things around the house, these would be a good choice. I am glad I gave them a chance, and am now debating on getting a second pair for wearing out.While the arch support isn't spectacular, it's a massive step up from trying to shove insoles into slippers like I was doing before. They hold their shape well so far, they fit comfortably, have a little bit of shock absorption to them, and best of all they are EASY TO CLEAN! Also if you're a bit clumsy like me, the roomy toe area makes a great buffer to prevent you from injuring yourself by stubbing your toes.They fit very well without being too tight, and stay on my feet with or without the heel strap, so I've taken to keeping the strap folded up over the front to get in and out of them more easily.I'm definitely a fan now that I've tried them.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2020

Title: Perfect for everyday wear!
Review: As strange as crocs look, they sure are comfortable. I wear these bad boys every single day. If I know I‚Äôll be walking a lot, I‚Äôll pull the heel strap back and kick them into 4WD. 100% worth buying.On a serious note, I love my crocs. Perfect for every day wear, and even better to wear at the beach. The holes around the toes allow a lot of ventilation, and easy to shake out the sand.They‚Äôre lightweight and extremely easy to clean. They are also able to withstand different environments, whether you‚Äôre walking on sharp surfaces such as rocks or glass. I‚Äôve also tested them on slippery surfaces, surprisingly haven‚Äôt fallen yet!I get a lot of compliments on my crocs, especially when I‚Äôm wearing my scrubs. The color hasn‚Äôt faded, and I‚Äôve put them through a lot since I got them. If you‚Äôre debating whether or not you should take a chance on these bad boys, here‚Äôs your sign saying you should.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 16, 2020

Title: Order a size down if you like a normal non-loose fit...
Review: Overall, I've been very happy with my Classic Crocs.  I wear a size 7.5 shoe and I own several pairs of Croc Flip-Flops/Sandals which I ordered in a size 8 (happy I did for those).  However, many have said the Classic Clogs run large.  After sizing my foot according to the chart it still said for me to order a size 8.  I went against that and ordered a size 7 based on the reviews saying they run large.  I'm so glad I ordered down a size! They fit how my normal shoe would because I do not like any loose feeling when I'm walking.  Even with my socks on they fit great and are surprisingly comfortable.  I can walk long distances without any foot fatigue.  Only minor negative I would say is my feet get warm in them.  I don't notice it until I sit down when having them on.  Other than that I'll definitely be purchasing additional pairs and love how easy they are to clean!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2020

Title: Heavenly Feel. Massages the soles of my feet and keeps them from itching.
Review: My first pair of Crocs just arrived and after wearing them one day, I am in love!I got these shoes because my feet itch in other shoes during the summer time. The cloth interior  of regular shoes trap sweat and bacteria. It  is just not sanitary.I can wash, wipe and sanitize the inside of my Crocs every day if I want in order to avoid that issue.I intend to wear these barefoot, outside, after the shower and anytime I want because I can still keep them sanitary.Now, for the feel: Ooh, la la! I love the textured insides. The little raised bumps and spikes inside the shoes poke the bottom of my feet, giving them a massage and relieving tension when I walk. This feels so good!Often my feet are tired and stressed and I have to press them against something or do exercises to relieve them. But now, Crocs can destress my feet for me while I walk.Also, I like that I can wear the straps over the top of my feet like a slide-in slipper or behind my heel . It's so convenient to have two types of styles.  When I put the straps behind my heel, I can feel the spikes inside the shoes better so that is my preferred style after a long day.These shoes are very roomy. At first I thought they were too wide, but I like that there's so much room.The only concern was that one strap is a little looser than the other. Since most factories have standardization, I questioned whether I was sent a knock-off or the real thing. I hope these are real. Either way, they feel super good and I intend to get several pair.Now, let me get off the internet and go walk in my Crocs because my feet want to play!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 3, 2020

Title: Roomy Fit
Review: It doesn't say so on the description here but these crocs are labeled as 'Roomy Fit' so they are huge.  It's a little weird but it seems like Crocs fit differently depending on where they are made. I'm a 7.5 and initially opted for a 5/7 but found that it was too tight for my toes when I put the strap on the back of my heel. This was on a pair made in Mexico. However I have a 5/7 that was made in Vietnam that fit fine with or without the strap. So for this one I decided to order a size up to make sure that it will be comfortable no matter where it was made. The pair I received was made in Vietnam but since they are 'Roomy Fit' they are way too big. The color is gorgeous so I'm going to return these and order my regular size again and hope for the best.Update:I received the 5/7 today and they‚Äôre perfect! Leaving the review at 4 stars because it really should be in the description that these are roomy fit.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2020

Title: My go-to comfy shoes
Review: Crocs were born in my hometown, well the town I lived in the longest, I should say. At first, I thought they looked hideous, kinda still do, to be honest. They make people's feet look huge. Yet, when I tried a pair at my daughter's house, because she insisted it was like walking on clouds, and I had a very sore, broken foot, I couldn't believe how comfortable they were. I began to sing a new tune! I became all about comfortable shoes. And this ics coming from a woman who's family owned several chains of shoes stores for 77 years! High-end fashion shoes, mid-range casual boots and shoes, and lower end shoes too. We never had anything like these in our stores though (they hadn't been invented yet). We did sell Jellies (remember those?) in the summer in the low-priced shops, but Crocs are so much nicer.I have owned and worn out 5 pairs of the classic Crocs in various colors, as well as 2 pairs of the winter lined ones. I just bought more classics, in more colors, because why not wear comfy shoes? I wear them gardening and when I'm being super casual. I keep a couple pairs as indoor slippers too. Will have to order a new pair for winter soon.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2020

Title: Good Buy!
Review: A little about me so you can categorize my review:  I live in Hawaii where Crocs and Bermuda shorts are de rigueur.  I wear dress shoes at weddings and restaurants, but I have seen people wear them there without being asked to leave.I go through about 2 pairs a year (yes, Hawaii, ha ha).I actually expected to buy a pair at our local slipper shop where I normally get them, but I was shocked to find they had gone to $45/pair!  I whipped out my phone & showed the lady they are $26 on Amazon.  She smiled and said she would help me find a good fit so I could order from Amazon (Hawaii has pretty girls with pretty manners).I was apprehensive because of other reviews, but my pair fit as well as any, and the rubber seemed about average.  The toe box and width were a little more generous and the arch support was a little flatter, but overall, fit is as expected.  The tread on the new Crocs is more robust.  That is a plus for Hawaii because it rains everyday here, and slippery footwear are dangerous, especially on steps, sidewalks, and roads without dedicated walking paths.  My previous pairs were made in Mexico; these were made in China.  (Maybe these were made more with Haole feet in mind.)  The pic shows my existing (Mexico) Croc on the left, and the new (China) Croc on the right.Good: price, fit, wear, appearanceBad: (none)Summary: II like them. I am going to order another pair for our other house.-Larry
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2020

Title: WOW
Review: For the last 4 years my feet have been blistered, over callused and in severe pain by the end of my shifts! This was to the point that I almost decided NOTHING would help and that after 40 years on my feet in the restaurant industry, I was destined  to a future of crippling pain. Everyone was telling me that Crocs were that answer but, I was thinking how could a shoe for such a little price help my feet? After all I had spent hundreds on different shoes throughout the last four years... Finally I caved and figured at the price, I could just throw them away like the rest of the EXPENSIVE shoes I had purchased. Let me tell you what a glorious feeling right from the start!!! My feet and back no longer hurt even after 8 - 10 hour shifts! They feel like wearing nothing at all, so naturel and comfy! Do your self a favor and try Crocs!!!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2019

Title: We love crocs
Review: My husband and I love crocs and have used them for years. I had terrible pain in the heel of my foot and crocs has completely cured it. Fit true to size in my experience. Colors pictured are navy, pepper, neon magenta, camo, purple, khaki
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 25, 2017

Title: Awesome
Review: These guys are amazing.  For years, I avoided them despite of the hype some time ago.  The funny thing is that I was always looking for a shoe that can work as a slipper because that would be so practical for traveling.The regular clogs don‚Äôt have enough backing on the heel to be a shoe.  I got these slippers once and tried to use them as shoes but they have no soles and so very uncomfortable to walk on hard surfaces and got really wet when it was raining.  The soft shoes have too much backing on the heel and so cannot be used as a slipper.Enter the Croc‚Äôs innovative design that has a movable heel strap so it‚Äôs a slipper when you‚Äôre at home and a shoe when you‚Äôre moving around.In the picture, they look solid so you know they will work on hard surfaces.  My concern was if they are comfortable because it looks like hard plastic but it is really some rubber or silicone material so quite soft and comfy.The only thing is the sizing is off.  I wear 9.5 and got a 10 but I should have gotten a 9.  It is loose but not really an issue except if you plan to drive wearing them.  I have a manual car and I stalled the car when I drove it wearing these for first time.I don‚Äôt think looks is a problem and very subjective.  In this case, they become so iconically ugly that many ppl think they‚Äôre beautiful now.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2018

Title: Yes.
Review: I'm a pretty average looking dude, but now that I have these Crocs‚Ñ¢ I am easily the sexiest person I know.Seriously though --  they are convenient, they are comfortable, and they are awesome.  My wife hates them, but I just can't give them up.  They are the fanny pack of shoes: crazy convenient, but everybody makes fun of them for some reason.  Don't care.  I'm a middle-aged fat guy with three kids.  I don't have to care about that stuff any more and that's freaking rad.  Wear these Crocs‚Ñ¢ and be awesome like me.[I know the product description says "Women's Crocs" but they are being worn by a dude just fine. No idea what that's all about.]
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2020

Title: Never bought Crocs  befroe they are worth the money
Review: Was looking for a new pair of Crocs to replace my older pair and after going to the outlet store and finding nothing i decided to just order them from amazon found the style i liked and a color and they had them in my size ordered them i have had other pairs of Crocs in the past and knew what i was getting so didn't think twice about not getting them after the first week of getting a new pair of Crocs and telling myself im going to keep them i take and remove the straps and side buttons to get them to fit the way i like them and they are mostly my house shoes and as of lately i take them to work and switch out of my work shoes and into them for the drive home overall they are comfortable to wear the colors pop and they are true to size and you dont have to go up a size which is what i do when i am looking for regular shoes but not with Crocs they fit right and i love the feel
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 16, 2020

Title: OMG, I am now a total Crocs Convert !!!
Review: A friend bought me a pair, and I was HOOKED.  So I ordered this pair via Amazon in the Ice Blue color, in my normal sneaker-size women's US 7.  They fit true to size.  I'm so glad I discovered Crocs...  They are so comfy, light & airy, with great cushioning for walking all day long.  I used to think they were just plastic gardening shoes, or just comfy clogs for nurses & doctors.  But NOW I am seeing Crocs everywhere.... They have become a highly sought-after fashion item!  I also ordered the medium pink color (via Amazon), so now I have 3 pair of Crocs.  The bright fun colors make me smile, they are actually "in fashion" right now, and my feet couldn't be happier.PS... I advise to google them & check out the prices from various department stores, shoes stores, etc, & compare those prices with Amazon's pricing.  Although I must say this seller shipped pretty fast, had a competitive price, AND has the largest assortment of colors to choose from!  Great purchase.  -- Thank you :)
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2020

Title: Needs a little break in time to get a great fit!
Review: Ok, so I never thought I would wear Crocs but after years and years of hype through movies, online, word of mouth, internet, and personal friends, I figure I'd try them.  And they were all correct! These really are great feeling things for my feet.  They aren't cool looking (at least not for an American non-hipster male) but boy are the nice feeling and functional. Specifically on function, I was looking for a camp slipper that I could slip on around the campsite/RV/Campground/lodge/cabin and walk outside without putting on boots or sneakers.  Sandals are ok if you're a boy or when on an island beach but anywhere else, nope.  Moccasins are ok, but typically they do not have a hard sole.  So camp slippers with hard soles are becoming a thing but they are typically over $80 and at that point they are just a really cheap boot.  So Crocs help fill the void and niche for a camp slipper.  Of course, Crocs are not insulated but inside I usually have socks on so these are perfect, esp in non cold months or climates because with socks or no socks I can slip the feet right into these things. And so far, without socks these things do not make the feet hot (at least not mine) so not a lot of foot sweat and the resulting stink.  What I have learned is that these things do stretch, at least a little which is good.
