I ordered a size 9 ( i wear a 9.5 in boots/drewss shoes [Danner, Allen Edmonds, Sperry) and tennis shoes are a 10 [Nike, Adddis, Chucks]) and when they first arrived, the left one fit perfectly but the right one seemed a tad small since a couple of my toes were just barely bumping up against the front of the croc.  Plus I kinda thought my heals were right on the back edge of the croc but despite this , they were still pretty comfy but not great. Plus,the first few days of ownership and wearing without socks, the tops and sides of my feet were getting a few hot spots from rubbing. But nonetheless,  I continued to wear them and powered through hoping they would get better and rather quickly (within a couple weeks) with casual wearing these feel better (my right toes no longer barely touches the front and no hot spots) but I still feel like my heels are on the back edges of the crocks so I think they maybe too short.  But I really like that they fit snug and never feel like a flip-flop that could slide right off my feet, even when barefoot in them. Plus the nubs have a great massaging effect - super sensitive feet may not like it but the nubs are soft and with socks i can't feel them. But because of how good these feel, I want to believe the size 10 will feel better and as a result I have a size 10 on the way.If you can find these in the store, I would try on several pairs of the same size just to see if they fit slightly different due to variances in the QA/QC.  I think a person would be able to find the perfect fit in the store, esp. if they are between sizes like I am.  if my size 9 were just a tad larger they would be perfect.  As it is, I'm expecting the size 10 to be a little too big and slip around but I'm hoping they will work and not slide around but I expect them to feel just a little bit better, otherwise I'll stick to the smaller size due to a potentially better fit.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2020

Title: ugly as all get out, but so comfortable you just don't care
Review: I know, I know... they are the "Given up on life" shoe.  They are ugly as sin.  I know this.  But I also know that when I am in hour 16 of standing for the work I do, they are a lifesaver and I'm not thinking about my feet hurting.  I'm thinking about how much I doubt my career choice at that moment, but my feet are fine.  I'm thinking about crying as the sun is coming up and I still have another two or three hours to go, but my feet are good to go. And when I finally crawl into bed, every part of me is calling me names, but my feet are still my friend.Still not as bad as wearing slippers to the grocery store....
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 19, 2018

Title: Better Than My Old Ones, But....
Review: These are the genuine Crocs clogs, and are better than my old ones, which I purchased at a famous discount store chain. (Take a look at my photos.  Depending on what device you are using, the photos will show up in a different order.  I have two photos of the Crocs by themselves; one shows the excellent tread on the sole, and the other shows the bumps/points inside.  Two photos show the Crocs side-by-side with my old worn-out store brand clogs.)  But the Crocs are not an entirely unmixed blessing!  First, the Crocs cost over 3x the price of the chain store clogs.  Winner: chain store clogs.  Second, the Crocs are made in Vietnam,  while the chain store ones are made in USA. BIG win for the chain store clogs!  But the Crocs have advantages, too.  First, the Crocs fit as advertised. If you wear a size 11, order a size 11. (These do not come in Wide width. If you need a wider width, consider ordering the next 1/2 size up.  For instance, I wear a men's 10-1/2 Wide in a regular shoe. I ordered these Crocs in men's size 11, and they fit perfectly.)  The chain store clogs run small, so I had to get a size 12 of them. Winner: Crocs. Second, the Crocs sole has better tread and therefore better traction.  (See photos.)  Winner: Crocs. Third, the Crocs come with a strap that you can put around your heel to keep them from slipping off (see photos again).  If you don't want to use the straps, simply fold them up over the front, out of the way.  Winner: Crocs.  Fourth, Crocs have little buttons (or points) molded into the insole that massage the soles of your feet. This may or may not be an advantage, depending on your preference. Hint: if the points bother you, try wearing socks, or thicker socks if you're already using socks. For me, the points only took about 20 minutes of walking to get used to.  NO clear winner here; which is best depends upon your preference.  The Crocs appear well made, fit well, and are very comfortable. The next question for me is, will they outlast my chain store clogs long enough to justify spending more than three times as much money, for a foreign-made product?  The main reasons I bought these are: 1.  I could not get clogs in black anymore from the chain store.  They only come in an ugly brownish-green color that is patterned to look like dead leaves! (If you are a gardener who wants your shoes to blend in with your mulch, you might prefer the chain store clogs. Me, not so much!);  and 2.  I have always wanted to try the genuine Crocs product.  Time will tell whether they were worth the extra investment.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2020

Title: If you aint CROCIN', then you aint ROCKIN'!!!
Review: Alright guys, I'll admit it....I've been out of the Croc game for a good while, now. I needed some comfy shoes to wear around the house and to the lake for boating/other activities where i could get my shoes wet and not sweat it. I used to wear these bad boys in high school non-stop (yep, you guessed it...graduated a virgin, but things took a turn for the better quickly after - MOVING ON! lol). Amazon was the only place that carried a 14 like my gargantuan feet need....so i copped em up on wardrobe, just because i was skeptical about falling back in to my old ways. Oh you best believe, the second i put them on i ripped up that return label! Who could deny their ugly, all-day comfort and goodness?!?! Long story, short....haven't stopped wearing them since. They gone from "around the house and on the boat only" shoes to "fine dining, church, barbeque, errands, anywhere that would make my wife embarrassed to be with me, etc." shoes. Currently, fearful that my wife is packing her bags....may be single and alone real soon, idk....but at least i'll be comfortable in my solitude, right?! 10/10 would recommend.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 3, 2020

Title: Lemon Yellow Crocs.... Now I own 3 pairs in 3 fabulous colors!
Review: I started with the electric pink color, then the ice blue, then a lighter pink, and now these sunny-cute Lemon Yellow ones.  I never thought I'd like Crocs, but OMG they are so comfy & so cute... I have officially fallen in love with Crocs!  I wear a women's size 7 in sneakers, so that's the size I buy in Crocs, and they fit me perfectly.  I have looked at the Crocs in the shoe stores, and these Crocs from Amazon are indeed the real deal -- and the price is the same on Amazon (sometimes even lower).... plus Amazon usually has a much better selection in available colors, too.  ------  I live in S Florida where it's almost always hot and humid, so my feet love the air conditioned holes in these shoes.  I have loads of sneakers, dressy shoes, and flip flops. But some days you just wanna wear something totally cute & colorful, and comfy.  -----  Btw...  I've noticed that Crocs have become VERY fashionable & "on trend" lately.  I see teenage girls & grown women rockin' them in all sorts of colors.  I'm really enjoying them, and so are my grateful feet.  I can wear them 24/7 and be so comfortable.  I've gotten so many compliments on the Lemon Yellow ones already, and that's from teens to women in their 30's, 40's, 50's and up!  Apparently everyone wants to own a cute pair of colorful Crocs these days.  --- This vendor mailed mine in a hurry & they arrived fast.  I definitely recommend Crocs, and this vendor on Amazon!  And PS... Fashionable guys are rockin' Crocs too these days, and in all the colors !  It's apparently the new big thing. :)
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 20, 2020

Title: Great Shoe
Review: I‚Äôm a size 7.5. The 8 is too big. The 7 had to be broken in for 2 weeks, because it was definitely a bit small at first and the outer edge almost touched the back of my foot.But here‚Äôs the thing about Crocs. If you get them too big, the arch support won‚Äôt work. Your foot isn‚Äôt supposed to swim in these. It‚Äôs definitely up to the user to decide their fit preference.As for my opinion: If you want a bigger fit, go a size (or in my case, a half-size) up.If you want a more ‚Äúcustom‚Äù fit, order true to size (or in my case, a half-size down) and break them in. The rubber loosens up a bit and conforms to your foot.I do think that this model of Crocs has gotten progressively smaller in fit over the past 4 years. So the Crocs of old are a darn sight bigger than today‚Äôs sizes.I have wide, duck feet, and the normal width was fine for me.The interior rubber ‚Äúspikes‚Äù inside have also gotten stronger and more effective. So much that it did take me a few weeks to break them in, because the spikes were QUITE spikey for my taste. It calms down after some wear.My husband couldn‚Äôt handle the spikes because he has soft feet with zero callus (lucky duck). So if you have sensitive feet, these might need to be worn with some socks until things soften up.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 20, 2020

Title: Product Is REAL deal...
Review: I needed a new pair of Croc's and when I read the reviews (one star) some people thought that these might be knock off's...fake imitations..and I was a little concerned. But mine arrived today. They are exactly the same as the pair I have (minus the paint spills).. Like exactly. There was concern about these not being as soft as the "Original Brand.".. but what I can tell you is...they are the real deal..they are soft like my old pair. So, for what it is worth I am glad I bought them.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 21, 2020

Title: Perfect fit with plenty of width!
Review: I‚Äôve waited years to finally spend money on foam shoes. Now that I did, I don‚Äôt know that I‚Äôll ever be without a pair again! I checked the fit style on Crocs website before I bought- they have fit descriptions in each style of shoe which described the general feel and how ‚Äúroomy‚Äù or relaxed they are.These are the most roomy shoes they offer. I typically wear a 10.5 men‚Äôs, but usually need a wide size. I ordered the 10 size and these are a very comfortable fit. Plenty of room, without feeling too loose or like they‚Äôre going to fall off my feet.I wear these around the house for added support, and will wear them out fishing when the weather gets warmer.Tip: I have worn them with some thin socks and I find that keeps my meet foot bottom from getting sweaty in them.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2020

Title: YES!
Review:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.


  ¬†Ok ok, I know what you are all thinking... "CROCS ARE SO UGLY THEY LOOK LIKE CLOWN SHOES!" It is no secret that for years crocs have been violated for being big and a but um, unique to say the least but these shoes are super super comfortable! Staying home I realized my chanclas were not making the cut and decided to shop for new stay at home footwear, leading me to buying crocs. The ones in the video are ice blue, they are beautiful and comfortable! As someone with arched feet, you will not go wrong with purchasing these. After wearing them relentlessly for weeks it was super noticeable just how unsupportive other brands are with feet arches. Crocs though, they've got your back. They are of a rubbery plastic, so your feet will sweat at first, but after a while, at least for me, they'll stopped sweating. Overall this was worth the purchase since they serve as stay at home, out door and water shoes. They are true to size, however, you may consider sizing up if you want them to be roomy. Overall they're good. (as a size reference I used my Nike slides), I hope this helps!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2020

Title: So Light and Comfortable!
Review: I made fun of my husband for wearing them but then I tried his and they seemed comfortable. Low and behold I got mine and these are glorious. I don't care if people think they are silly. I'm rocking them out because they work for what I need. These are like slippers but much lighter. I can slip them right on super easily. I can wear them with or without socks. When I want to go out to the shed outside or to the mailbox I just throw these on. If it's rainy outside, no prob! They stay on really well but if I need a little extra security I just simply throw the strap to the back around my heel and put them in what my husband refers to as four-wheel drive. Definitely recommend these but not if you're lame.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2020

Title: They are smaller than my old ones of the same size
Review: I love the ones I bought several years ago. The problem is, the old ones are a very comfortable fit and say 45 on the bottom. The new ones say men's 11 which is supposed to equate to the European 45-46 so I assumed that they would be the same. they are visibly smaller and fit tighter. I may return them and get a men's 12. When I saw the Men's 11, I had reservations but figured the European number stamped into the shoe would be  a better gauge of size. Not so.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2018

Title: Ugliest Shoes Ever, But...
Review: When I first saw someone wearing a pair of Crocs, I remember thinking, ‚ÄúI would not be caught dead in shoes that ugly.‚Äù  However, after borrowing a pair to walk home from the beach (my fabric river shoes are impossible to wear if they get sand in them), I was sold.  I have bunions the size of walnuts on both feet - plus the sores from the fabric shoes - and was able to walk the mile home from the beach in the Crocs with no trouble.  The pair I borrowed were a boy‚Äôs  Junior 5 and they fit like the Women‚Äôs size 7.  I will not make fun of Crocs ever again.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2020

Title: I wear an women's 8 or 8.5, Purchased size 9
Review: Really great for the tropical areas of Hawaii.  Constantly getting these wet/ full of mud and rinsing them.  Also good for Hawaii because everyone takes their shoes of to go indoors - they slip on easily.  Not super comfortable, as people often say of Crocs, and not very supportive at all.  I might think of buying these again to wear in Chicago, because of ease of use, but not sure.  If you wear an 8 or 8.5, I'd definitely suggest following other reviewer's recommendations, and sizing up.  A 9 worked perfectly for me, but at first even the 9 felt a tiny bit short.  I think they do stretch, but like I said, I wore them constantly in wet weather, which I believe helps with the stretch.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 28, 2019

Title: Great deal on an extremely practical piece of ugly footwear!
Review: Rare to find this brand at the Amazon price I paid - wanted a clog with heel strap so I could safely drive back & forth to the local aquatic center.  I wasn't excited about the glossy black appearance, but since I only wear them to drive from my garage to the pool, walk about 200 feet across hot concrete, stick them in a locker while I swim, then reverse the process to go home, I can overlook my own fashion faux pas.  The heel strap keeps them properly positioned on my feet while driving, and the drain holes in the toes make them great for poolside.  I have falling arches & these make the walk from car to poolside & back so much less painful than foam flip-flops - and as stated before, I feel confident driving my car (automatic transmission) whereas with flip-flops, I'd change in & out of socks & shoes, while my kids wait for me to get the car started & the A/C going.  If these last half as long as my old Crocs Mammoth clogs (10+ years so far & still have a little bit of tread on the soles), then these are the best deal in footwear for my Fashion Tone-Deaf Curmudgeon Community.  (Life Member since 2013.)
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2018

Title: CROCS CLASSIC CLOG
Review: As I said on the recent purchase review of this wonderful shoe, I can't wear any other.  Most ALL other shoes I have ever tried give me back, hip, knee, ankle and foot pain after wearing them for as little as an hour or two.  When I slip into a pair of these, it's like a miracle.I love the color Garnet.  It's actually rather classy looking.  Just purchased a gray pair for my husband, and they look really nice on me, too :)  Might have to order myself a pair of gray soon :)It fits perfectly, except the opening is a little bit smaller than the pairs I bought about 10 years ago.  Yes, I stocked up on them, back then, when I found the white ones locally.  BUT, the good news is, if I order a size larger, it's now a perfect fit.  Found that out when I ordered that pair for my husband, after he saw my newest pair.I also love the fact that you can just wear them in the shower, or throw them in the washer to keep them clean.It's a WONDERFUL shoe_like none other !
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2019

Title: the perfect shoe
Review: Who could say anything bad about a croc? It's one of those shoes where I feel like a significant number of people know what size they are in crocs, but just in case: I am usually between an 8-9 in shoes. These run about half a size larger, although I can wear both an 8 and a 9 in crocs, I like the way the 8 looks better. If you have wide feet and that's a deciding factor for you in getting the larger sizes, you don't have to worry about that because of the wideness of crocs. I'm so glad these are back in style. The white ones especially are a perfect staple shoe for summer. I wouldn't hike in them, but they would be fine as an everyday shoe for sure. They also make a good house slipper for going inside and outside too. we stan
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 9, 2020

Title: Ugly, but Comfy
Review: So my dad had a pair of these years ago and I found myself putting these on for household tasks whenever I went over to his house.I got married this summer, so now that I can start letting myself go I decided to order a pair for myself. They're great. Super lightweight and comfortable. The only gripe I have is that they run a little big. I wear a size 10.5 and, based on other reviews, I ordered a size down. Even the size 10's fit best with socks. Still very comfortable though.If you find yourself at a point in life where you want comfortable shoes and don't have to impress anyone - I highly recommend these.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2017

Title: Crocs Rule
Review: FIRST- Hot tips for my Amazonians:- Get Prime. Buyer protection. Sort by ‚ÄúPrime‚Äù when browsing. Buy with confidence. Two day shipping and NO HASSLE free returns without worry. Don‚Äôt like it? Return. Doesn‚Äôt fit? Return. Broken? Return it!- Sort by MOST RECENT reviews when looking at an item. Click on reviews at the top - click on reviews again. Sort by Recent instead of Top. You‚Äôll thank me!- Research, Research, Research everything you buy here. Mainly pricing. May be way better somewhere else but watch for added shipping cost if you‚Äôre a Prime member. Many items are marked up here to compensate for shipping.- Watch for knockoffs! Believe the reviews that are heavy on the negative. Don‚Äôt trust reviews that say ‚ÄúGood product‚Äù or ‚ÄúWill buy again‚Äù only. They are bought. Look at the pics!NOW - On to the review for these Crocs!Kids LOVE these. My 12 and 14 year old girls wear them out and WEAR THEM OUT. Crocs have been around for years but it‚Äôs now a ‚Äúfashion trend‚Äù with the teenie boppers.But don‚Äôt let that fool you! Adults are obsessed too. They are super comfortable and long lasting. Great for quick trips to the store or longer walks.Tons of colors. True to size. Get you some!If this was a helpful review, thumbs it up so others can see it too!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2020

Title: Crocs are currently on trend, plus they're soooo comfy!
Review: I love my Pink Lemonade color Crocs.  (they are a true pink, as compared to the ballerina pink which is a very pale pink)  I also bought Lemon Yellow,  Electric Pink, and Ice Blue -- all from Amazon.  I wear a women's size 7 in sneakers like Nike & Adidas, so that's what I buy in Crocs, and the fit is perfect.  I never thought I'd be rockin' Crocs, but here I am... and I'm loving them.  PS...  My shipments have all been shipped & received very quickly.  PPS... these are the authentic brand 'Crocs' shoes, and the Amazon price is comparable to the shoe stores, except Amazon has many more colors to choose from & you don't need to leave your house to get them.  If Amazon don't have your favorite color in your size today, just keep checking back.  PPPS... I can't believe how many compliments I've been getting whenever I wear my Crocs -- or how all-day comfy my feet are!  Apparently, Crocs are the hottest "it" shoe to own in your fashion wardrobe these days.  Hard to believe, but true. Lol
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 20, 2020

Title: I. LOVE. My. Crocs!!!
Review: I love my crocs so unbelievably much. My poor husband absolutely despises them, but too bad! I've got bad fibromyalgia and also lingering foot issues from a fracture a decade ago. I bought the crocs because I can't stand the pain from going barefoot all the time. Let me tell you- If I wear these all day, there's no pain or it's largely decreased. They're so comfortable, supportive, light, and handy! I can wear them out to the garden and then just hose them off. They're quiet enough to wear around the house while the kids are sleeping. I have such bad joint stiffness and pain in the morning, it can be hard to get going...but if I put these on right away, I get right to whatever I need to be doing that day! Now I just need a pair for camping and a pair for at work and an indoors pair and an outdoors pair. Lol. LOVE THEM!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2019

Title: Best purchase ever.
Review: I have steered clear of buying crocs, as I assumed it would "show my age" but, having just turned 43, I think I no longer care. I am outdoors working in the yard many hours per day and my pale skin was cooking in my regular uncomfortable $4 flip flops. That, and needing arch support, my feet were aching. Now, my gorgeous grass green crocs protect my fragile skin. The crocs are SO comfy and sturdy I've begun wearing them on the regular for NON outdoor gardening and pool cleaning activities. Even as I precariously balance on the slippery rock formations around the pool, the crocs grip and keep me from sliding into the pool hilariously. 10/10 will buy more. Perhaps a rainbow version?
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2020

Title: Must Buy!
Review: I was pretty skeptical about purchasing this shoe, due to the conflicting opinions in fashion.  What is more important, style or comfort?  Well, if you were to ask me that question two weeks ago, my answer would be style without a bit of hesitation.  However, after working eight-plus hour shifts, five days a week, standing only, my mindset ‚Äì and answer to that question ‚Äì has definitely changed.  I thought my Nike sneakers would cut it, but I soon realized they provided no support, no natural curvature for the foot to follow, no air circulation.  My knees and feet began to kill, and I decided it might be a good idea to do some research.Clogs.  Clogs?  I know I wanted more practical shoes, but clogs are just not suited for my nineteen-year-old self.  I mean, I still wanted something relatively cute.  But was that possible?  I kept scrolling through the shopping tab of Google, until I saw this pair of crocs.  Now, I remember I sported a bright orange pair in middle school, but I think I outgrew that stage.  Wait, they have a white pair.  Much more mature color.  I decided to take the risk, after all, my I owed it to my feet.Not only did these crocs pull my whole scrub uniform together ‚Äì I mean what screams healthcare more than scrubs and crocs? ‚Äì but I managed an entire shift with 99% less foot and knee pain than my previous sneakers had caused.  Another plus, they are ‚Äúnot only the most comfortable shoes, but also easy to clean just using soap and water and allowing for a quick dry.‚Äù  Because one of my duties as a pharmacy technician is to pour liquids, it is easy to spill on your shoes.  But, because of the synthetic material, I am able to grab a wet paper towel and wipe the mess right off.  But wait, there‚Äôs more.  I‚Äôm sure everyone can relate to their feet getting sweaty in sneakers, especially if you are moving around all day.  Well, crocs solve that problem for you.  The holes provide circulation and leave your feet as dry as ever.I totally agree with and support this review!‚ÄúThere is a moderate arch support. I have low arches and my sister-in-law has extremely high arches; neither of us feel like more support is needed‚Äù As arch support was one of my main concerns, I can assure that crocs also leave me feeling like my feet are supported properly. I highly recommend purchasing this product, as it has changed my work day experience.  I no longer suffer with severe feet and joint pain that is caused by flat shoes.  These crocs provide just the right amount of support and maintain comfort with the foamy cushion.  If standing on your feet sounds like the majority of your days, then crocs are the shoes that will change your life.  Especially with the color assortment, there‚Äôs a shoe to match every outfit!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2019

Title: Excellent for pool deck, locker room, and at home!  Good arch support.
Review: Excellent sandal for walking on the pool deck and in locker rooms!  Good arch support!  Very comfortable. Easy to slip on and off while standing. Nice big toe box. I also wear them at home as slippers, as shoes in warm weather, on grass, on docks, and for canoeing, and kayaking. Lift your foot up and the water drains, out so your feet do not stay wet. On colder days I wear them with socks. I have worn them for many years and I keep buying more of same. Their usefulness and comfort wins out over lack of beauty due to bulky look. I hope they keep making this same classic sandal.  I have to replace them because extended wear on the pool deck concrete smooths the bottom making them slippery. Otherwise they last a long time. I wear them 5 or 6 days a week for hours at the pool while teaching swimming, life-guarding, roving, and while showering in locker room after swimming.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 24, 2020

Title: I LOVE MY CROCS.
Review: I was so excited to get the cyan blue crocs on super sale. These are the comfiest shoes ever. The dots on the soles massage your feet, they provide great arch support, they‚Äôre such a cute color, and it‚Äôs finally long enough past the initial croc trend that they‚Äôre ironically stylish again. 10/10 recommend for beach days, days at the pool, rainy days, regular days, lazy days, winter days with socks, or whatever else to want to wear them with. They definitely run large, so try on a friend‚Äôs or try them on in the store first if possible. But snag yourself a pair, you won‚Äôt regret it!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2018

Title: Perfect in every way
Review: I needed some slip-on shoes to wear while working in my garage (woodworking).  I don‚Äôt have a lot of shoes because I have long, wide feet and I have trouble finding ones with a comfortable fit. I had been wearing my work tennis in the garage, but then while I was at my job I would look down and notice sawdust under the laces lol. So, I ordered these and they are really perfect:Easy to slip on and off.Durable.Super lightweight.Waterproof. I can hose them off.And so comfortable! I forget that I‚Äôm wearing them. I‚Äôve actually finished shopping before and then realized that I went to the store in my garage Crocs lol.I have huge feet and I wear size 11 in all shoe styles so that‚Äôs what I got for these. They are a bit roomy in the width and length, but they still don‚Äôt seem bulky when they‚Äôre on, my foot does not slide around inside the shoes, and it means I can wear my thick comfy socks under them!I want more! Maybe one pair for working out in the yard. And maybe some lined ones to use as slippers. I definitely want some in cooler colors next!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2019

Title: 2020 should be filled with Crocs.
Review: Ok so I've had a pair for myself and bought pairs for friends they run big & they are actually awesome but the "melon" color looks yellow & its lime green. Not even close to the picture. so bad because of that. It's important to represent accurate description & photos for each.But let's talk about how much puss you'll get with these. If you think these are ugly or bad it's because you ain't got fashion or game. Overall I've bought 8 for different friends and now they are drippin in the streets. If you want a girl to recognize you toss those flowers & buy some crocs. If she doesn't want to be your wife after that then she ain't the one mister. If 2020 wasn't the year of Corona it'd be the year of crocs. Trust. Don't sleep.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2020

Title: These are now my favorite kick-around shoe - even went shopping in Walmart with them and they turned out to be comfy.
Review: Where have these been all my life?  I first discovered a cheap copy of these at Walmart, and I loved how they fit and how easily they slip on and off.  So I was pleased to find the original brand here on Amazon.  I live in the desert, and our home is kept on the warm side too, so I definitely need models (like this classic model) with the holes in the side and top - the one thing I didn't like about my cheap knock-offs is they didn't have those holes, and my feet (with or without socks) were uncomfortably hot and clammy inside the house.  Another good feature is being able to toss the shoes into a bucket of soapy water to clean them after slogging in the mud outside.For me, the strap is crucial.  If I fold the strap up to the front out of the way, my heel sometimes slips out over the back end of the shoe, so I hope they never eliminate the strap!My feet are 11 1/2, and very wide (12 4E New Balance 408s fit well), and the size 12 Crocs fit good - I am going to try a size 13 next for kicking around the house and see if they are even easier to slip on/off.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2016

Title: who would have thought it.
Review: I know what you're thinking, these things are ugly and look ridiculous, and you're not wrong. What grown man would wear these. Well, turns out, this grown man would. When these things first hit the market, I was with everyone else making fun of them. But here's the thing, my brother is a cook, on his feet all day, and he wears crocks for cooks (don't worry, they're different than these, not open, so no foot fungus in your food) and he convinced me to try them because he swore they were the most comfortable pair of shoes he's ever had. So I finally broke down and bought a pair, and you know what, he was right. These things are great. I slip them on when I've got errands to run, light yard work, or sometimes when it's nice, just out and about, and they are very comfortable, and durable too. Get em wet, no problem, wear them with or without socks, still comfortable. Yes I look like a goof with them on, and I thought that would bother me, but it turns out my sense of shame is way lessened by how comfortable they are. If I thought I could get away with it, I'd wear them everywhere during the warmer months.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2019

Title: Just do it, they‚Äôre pretty dang comfortable.
Review: So I‚Äôll admit I always felt crocs were ugly & ridiculous. I thought no matter how comfortable they may be it just wasn‚Äôt worth stooping to that level... but then I reached the age where comfort & convenience became more important than vanity. I needed something to wear during the summer that he slightly more protection from itchy grass than flip flops but was cooler & didn‚Äôt require socks like tennis shoes so I caved and bought these crocs. Vowing to never wear them in public.Well I‚Äôm here to say I freakin‚Äô love these shoes. They‚Äôre comfy and surprisingly durable. They have enough support that my feet aren‚Äôt sore at the end of the day even after walking all over our property doing chores. They exceeded my expectations and I will probably buy another pair when I wear these out. But just for the record still not wearing them to town.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2019

Title: Better than flip flops in the garden!
Review: I'm a old lady, concerned about falling or slipping outside working on my farm.  I have been told to buy Crocs for years, but as usual, I'm the last one to catch trends.  These shoes are easily hosed off if debris gets inside, and they are light weight and very comfortable.  I call them my new Bozo the Clown shoe because they are so wide, but I wear an 8.5, and the 6 -8 fits perfectly.  I just ordered another pair that may be less wide.  I cannot wait!  I'm a 64 year old lady chicken farmer with a closet full of fancy shoes that are going to be leaving!  I'd rather have Crocs for every occasion!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2018

Title: Great fit and fun color
Review: My old crocs finally came apart after many years of use, and I decided to invest in another pair to wear to the pool and around the house. These fit just like my old ones. They are snug enough to stay to on without the back strap down and loose enough in the toes to be comfortable. The nubby inside is not really uncomfortable, but not as nice feeling as a smooth insole would be. On the other hand, my bare feet would stick to a smooth plastic sole. . I do like that I can put my wet feet into them when I get out of the pool and I don't slip around in them. I love the color (turquoise)! While crocs aren't really a fashion statement, they are ok for a quick, casual trip to the grocery store or the postoffice. I'm happy with my purchase.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2020

Title: Got tired of my wife stealing mine
Review: Crocs are not the fashion statement of the decade, this is true. However(!), their staying power has everything to do with how functional and durable they are. Going out to get the mail, take out the trash, quick walk with the dog, they are quick on/quick off and more comfortable than they should be.Mine kept disappearing so I bought my wife her own pair. Problem solved. Sidenote: Mine are probably 6 years old and have been used far, far harder than any pair of shoes should be. They have paint on them, gouges from who knows what, are faded and don't look very good at all, but they strap is still completely intact and they are still very comfortable. I keep waiting for them to die so I can spring for new pair but they just keep going.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2020

Title: Fit smaller than expected
Review: The product arrived on time and appeared to be good quality.  Unfortunately, the size 9 I ordered fit smaller than the size 8 I tried.  I will say I was pleased at how easy the return process was and would give the seller 5 stars for that.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2020

Title: CROCS are great!
Review: So many knock offs of crocs that it's easy to confuse them for the real thing. I've picked up the fake ones, even though I've had the real ones. But maybe your old ones wore out and you're at the everything for $5 store and you buy the crappy ones, and you just end up forgetting how great and different real crocs are. If you need extra room in the toe area to use toe separators, or you have wide feet, and/or you have some foot issues with pain, CROCS can be a saver for your feet. When I put mine on today, after having worn the crappy ones for a while, I was excited to have them again as I felt the little nubs inside stimulate my feet. They will help your circulation. I just love them!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2020

Title: Now I can be like Mario Batali...
Review: With these shoes you too can be world renowned cooking stud Mario Batali...that‚Äôs COOKING stud, not creepy, fat ginger, who can‚Äôt keep his hands off the ladies ‚Äústud‚Äù...But these shoes won‚Äôt make you cook like Batali, but they will make you unattractive like Batali!!! BELLISSIMO!(Honestly, these things are ugly with anything you wear, BUT they are completely kooky and comfortable! I was wearing my kids that were a size 9 men‚Äôs with very little problem, even though I am a size 11, which I bought instead. I like the smaller nome look of the 9‚Äôs, but I was worried that another pair might be truer to my correct size of 11. I wasn‚Äôt taking any chances on them not fitting at all....I probably should have gotten a 10 because even though these fit, they just look clumsier and EVEN more outlandish. I kinda look like Batali!!Ewwwwwwwww
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2020

Title: Used for a goose costume. Ran a mile in them. New favorite house shoes.
Review: I've always made fun of crocs. Several years ago, I began to see their utility when it comes to camping. They are lightweight, easy to put on, easy to wash off, and most importantly... compatible with thick socks. But I still didn't buy myself a pair.I've been through 2 or 3 pairs of Croc Sexii flip flop sandals in the last few years, and I love them.So when Halloween rolled around last year, instead of ordering or making some silly one-use shoe covers for my Untitled Goose costume, I bought some bright orange crocs. It took a while to get used to the feeling of my foot being encased by solid plastic, but they're pretty comfortable.I had 2 pairs of flip flops break recently, and my crocs have since become my house shoes. Also one of my younger co-workers (who is all about fancy sneakers) is now wearing white crocs n socks to work every day, so... maybe they are cool now? Maybe?Also I ran a mile in them once at the end of a 5k fun run.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2020

Title: I joined the CROCS club!
Review: I purchased these for easy slip ons to go outside with my toddler.  We are usually in our backyard playing with water.  THESE ARE AMAZING FOR THAT!  I am so happy I joined the crocs club and I can't believe I didn't join the club sooner.  Below are the pros for these:1. They are great for people who have wide feet (like me)2. Perfect for easy slip on and run outside.3. Great for the beach, pool, any water activity.4. You can easily slip them on and/or you can put the back strap down and your foot is a little more secure.5. Easy to clean - If you have a colored pair (like me) and they get a little dirty you can use soap and water rub on them and they look brand new again.Cons -1. If you bend your foot and/or crouch down they can leave a little crease in the shoe.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 10, 2020

Title: Had to give the Crocs a chance.  Glad I did.
Review: I‚Äôm a late adapter to Crocs.  Arrived yesterday.  Initial reaction was the shoes were too long and wide, so I reluctantly put them back in the bag and started to return them.  Something urged me to actually try them on again.  I used the heel strap, walked around the house, then the yard, and next thing I knew, I wore them the rest of the day and long into the night. Eventually, I tried them without the heel strap and found they were just as secure and comfortable. I canceled the return request. Crocs are just different beasts; like Birkenstock‚Äôs or my K√§lso Earth Shoes.  For me, there was a brief learning curve/familiarization period.  I‚Äôm pleased with the Crocs.  Totally what I expected.  Comfortable.  Like walking on my Gel-Pro kitchen mats wherever I go.  I just didn‚Äôt appreciate that it would take a bit to get used to a new (to me) style of foot wear.  They seem like the Volvo of the shoe world. Happy with my purchase and got a nice deal on Amazon.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 1, 2020

Title: Crocs seem to run small.
Review: I bought 2 pair of crocs in two different colors. I wear size 6 1/2 shoes and the crocs are a size 7. They just barely fit, they are almost too small. I have a pair of crocs, this exact size, bought about ten years ago, and they are about a half inch longer and a bit wider. I was hoping the pairs I bought would be that exact size. The old pair says "Made in China" and the new pairs say "Made in Vietnam" and "Made in Mexico". I'm happy with the looks and quality of the new crocs, just wish they were a tad larger, more like a size 7. In the photos, the shoe on the left is the new croc, the shoe on the right is my old croc. Note the size difference.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2018

Title: Better than I expected
Review: I bought these to wear in our boat to save my flip flops. We live on the beach and I wear flip flops pretty much all year long. I decided to buy my husband a pair of these because he was always getting his shoes wet (he refuses to wear flip flops) and thought I would get myself a pair as well. They are good for taking the dogs out in the rain, quick trips to the store, etc. I like them much better than I thought I would. I ordered a size up after reading reviews, but could have gotten my normal size and been fine. If I get another pair I will order my normal size. They clean up quickly and so far have been durable as my husband has been in pluff mud with them and they held up with no problems. I would definitely recommend these crocs
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2020

Title: Ugly but Useful
Review: These shoes are not attractive at all, in my opinion, but they serve their purpose very well.I needed a pair of shoes I can just slip on and off to run out to the mailbox or take the dogs out.  I also wanted them to be easy to clean after working in the yard.  These shoes fit those needs well.I also like that there is an adustable heel strap to keep the shoe on even more securely, or it can be flipped up over the top of the foot to allow easy off and on.So, as long as no one is looking at my feet, these shoes are great.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2020

Title: Easy to modify for plantar wart relief, treads wear quickly & are then slippery.
Review: Use a Dremel type tool with a 1/2" diameter coarse sanding drum to carve out a relief for a plantar wart- otherwise the "nubs" inside will greatly pain you!  (See pic of hacked Croc)The soles on my 2018 vintage classic style Crocs wore out relatively quickly and these 2020 ones are of the same design and appear to be of the same material.  Once the treads are worn away, they are REAL slippery on smooth wet or merely damp surfaces.  I used the above Dremel rig to cut new grooves as treads in my old ones.Without socks, your feet will sweat a good deal, or at least it is more noticeable to me.  I just slip then off if I am stationary, so,  driving is the only time it bothers me- YMMV..Overall, they are a great value unless you go with sandals.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2020

Title: Life changing. Get a pair ASAP
Review: I haven‚Äôt worn crocs since I was 5. I got the ballet pink ones because during this quarantine, I am tired of wearing uncomfortable shoes. I mainly got these to wear to take my dog out, cause they‚Äôre quick to put on and easy to wash if I step in something :/. But these arrived and I HAVE WORN THEM NONSTOP. Socks with Crocs is my new look. They are the quickest slip on shoes, they are just so useful! I wear them everywhere. When I‚Äôm cleaning the house, going to the store, to my parents- everywhere.Sizing: I am a women‚Äôs 8.5 and I have pretty chunky, wide feet. I got the women‚Äôs 9, men‚Äôs 11 and it actually fits perfectly, wouldn‚Äôt have changed a thing. Feels fairly true to size for me, because it does fit like a size 9 shoe would. Get yourself a pair of crocs!!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2020

Title: Finally got a pair. Not disappointed
Review: Been wanting a pair of these especially with my buddy hyping them up. Waited til prime day to get them on sale and have to admit that I love them. Am a huge fan now. Only down side is they don‚Äôt offer many in size 14 that I need so I miss out on the American flag ones or other cool designs. They feel a little loose but when you put em in sport mode (aka put the heel strap down) they stay put. Got them to wear on a my new boat but am using them everywhere. Will honestly admit I thought they‚Äôd be a tad more soft/comfortable. I have a pair of oofos slides that if they made crocs with the same softness would be game over. They just slip too much so they need the heel strap that crocs have.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2020

Title: I really like my Crocs!
Review: I have been wearing Crocs clogs for so many years and my first pair I got in 2002 finally wore out completely after 18 years of pretty constant wear. They are so comfortable to wear all day long with no problems. I do not wear socks with mine, just bare feet. Size is "true to fit/fit as expected". It seems every time I get a pair of Crocs, they are made at a different place. The 4 pairs I now got are either made in Mexico or Vietnam & are all comfy. The newest pair I got today was the white Crocs....made in China & they seem fine so far. For about $37 a pair, these Crocs will last so many years, be comfy and go thru mud, water, crud or whatever just fine....easy to clean for sure. 5 stars for these Crocs.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2020

Title: 3 pairs of 12m all different sizes.
Review: This is my 3rd pair of crocs all size 12m.  I got navy, then white, then khaki.  Oddly enough each color is a different size- khaki is smallest, navy is in the middle, and white was so big and klunky they made me look like an idiot.  All of them say size 12m on them so the factory must have standardization problems.  Good luck getting a pair that fits right.  My first pair, navy, fits better than the white and khaki so I kind of regret buying the white and khaki ones.  But crocs are the best.  I have been wearing crocs for a long time and they never stink and never make my feet stink and they are durable enough to hike or run or fight in self defense and I can kick them off when I go inside easily and slip them on when I go outside easily.  I just wish a 12m is always the same size no matter which color.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2020

Title: Ideal for frontline worker
Review: I‚Äôm working as a frontline worker and these are ideal! They arrived in 2 days. I‚Äôm a 7 1/2 so I had to side down to a 7 they fit good but if I put the strap on the toe is a bit snug. But I‚Äôd rather that than them be too big! And shockingly my feel look small in them oppose to looking like duck feet. Now some of my coworkers are buying a pair
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2020

Title: Loved them but reluctantly had to return
Review: With a heavy heart I had to return these.  I purchased them because after shattering my ankle in Jan. my ankle/foot remains so swollen I can't get my old shoes on.  Was thrilled to find these shoes accommodated my left foot and thought all my problems were solved.  Unfortunately after a couple of hours of wearing I discovered I was in deep trouble with my right foot.  Years ago I had a hammer toe that the surgery did not repair.  That darn toe sticks up.  The clogs are molded, don't "give", and I was in trouble.  Needless to say this would not happen to a normal person.  Were I normal I would have kept them in a heartbeat..  The lime color was perfect for Florida.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2020

Title: The most comfortable shoe
Review: I've been on the fence about Crocs since the chef guy who was famous for wearin'em ... wore'em.but after a couple of friends and coworkers gave such enthusiastic thumbs ups on their own, I grabbed these.I wore them to work for about two weeks straight, around the house as slippers and I ride my bike in them.if you work in retail on your feet all day, you may be like me, blowing out shoes left and right. I've got some high hopes based off of first hand accounts of friends and their own crocs. I'll likely follow up from time to time here! So here's hoping they last a good while! Who will wear out first? The Casio or the Crocs?!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2020

Title: Great for heavy set LLC
Review: Get these now. They have always spiked my interest but I finally broke down and bought a pair. I usually always wear flip flops but wanted something a little bit different for when I‚Äôm out walking in the woods etc (taking pictures/magnet fishing) I just pop these bad boys into four wheel drive and get stepping. They are great for just lounging around the house too. I‚Äôll put them on around 7am and will basically forget they‚Äôre even on most of the day. The first day or so they felt a little different but after they broke in a little bit it‚Äôs almost as if they‚Äôre molded to my feet. Highly recommend them for anybody on their feet a lot or if your weight is pretty hefty. I‚Äôm so glad I bought these
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2020

Title: Crocs... What Did You Expect?
Review: Crocs will never be the most comfortable shoes.  They are an utility shoe for those of us who like to go barefoot around the house and need something to slip on to check the mail, grab the paper, put out the trash, or brave the harsh and hateful sun long enough to yell at the little jacktard from down the street who is letting his dog crap in your petunias for the 3rd time this week.  No, we don't wear them because we love the way they feel, we wear them because they are cheap and get the job done, and aren't all furry on the outside which attracts hair from the shedding freeloading bastard laying on the couch.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2018

Title: Highly Recommended
Review: I had planned to use these Crocs for yard work, however, once I put them on and realized how comfortable they are, I decided to make them my run about shoes.They are stylish, comfortable, sturdy, and provide sure footing. Can wear with the strap across the back of the heal or pushed forward, out of the way. Either way, the shoe is very comfortable. I like the portals, since they keep my feet cool. Nice design.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2019

Title: Comfortable, and easy to get on
Review: People laugh at Crocs until they buy a pair. When you slip into these and walk around in them, you know then why so many people tend to buy them over and over. The support is exceptional, and they‚Äôre easy to clean. I got these for my husband because he kept slipping on his bedroom slippers to go out and get the mail, set out the sprinkler, etc., and it was driving me crazy. The nice thing about this pair of Crocs is that you can either slip right into them, or take an extra second and use the back strap. If you don‚Äôt use it it slides right on top easily. If you‚Äôve never worn Crocs before, give them a try. You‚Äôll love them.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2019

Title: Comfy, easy to clean, multi purpose shoe
Review: A men‚Äôs size 12 in white is very hard to come by. I checked several times and finally found it available here. Typical loose fitting crocs. My son loves them, they are all the rage on his college campus. He was glad I finally found him some white ones vs his old black ones. Apparently white is ‚Äúthe thing‚Äù there. He is a shoe hound, and ecstatic they are the only white shoes he has that are easy to keep clean and white, lol. He usually wears a size 13 sneaker but the 12 in crocs fits him best. So if you‚Äôre iffy or half size, I‚Äôd say go down a size.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2019

Title: Good quality, as expected
Review: Who doesn't know Crocs? The pair I purchased for my mom arrived in excellent condition and are as solid as one would expect from Crocs. Shipping was handled by Amazon and arrived as expected.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 27, 2020

Title: Fabulous replacement for my 13 y.o. Crocs Original Clogs
Review: These are a fabulous replacement to my original Croc clogs from 2006. The fit is more streamlined than my old pair. Not as wide from side to side. No pinching, slipping or stubbing. The ice blue color is exactly as pictured. It's not Turquoise or Aqua Marine blue. I wear size 8 medium (a 6 medium in mens). This clog is unisex. So glad I didn't have to buy them more expensive elsewhere. If you have very wide feet, I would consider ordering a different Crocs clog. Did I mention how comfortable and supportive they are? Important for bad backs, necks, foot problems. I wear mine as house slippers.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2019

Title: Shoulda listened to hubby years ago about these Crocs
Review: So my husband has been trying to get me to buy a pair of Crocs for years. He practically lives in his. I just couldn‚Äôt get past the looks of them. Well I finally gave in and bought this pair. Oh my what have I been missing? They are so comfortable, and easy to slip on. You can get them as dirty as you want in the garden and then you just wash them off.  They provide good air flow so your feet don‚Äôt get sweaty. What more could you want in a pair of shoes? Ok so I probably couldn‚Äôt get away with going to a wedding in them, but wish I could, cause I‚Äôd have the most comfortable feet on the dance floor! I love my Crocs and are starting to actually think they‚Äôre kind of cute. I shoulda listened to hubby years ago!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2020

Title: Great crocs!
Review: I was worried based on some of the reviews. But I‚Äôm happy with the purchase. My daughter loves them. And they fit her perfectly. He typically wears a 8.5. I purchased the 8 and hoped for the best. When they arrived, she tried on immediately and they fit her perfect. I bought some croc charms from amazon as well which were affordable and fun to place on her new shoes. Will buy another pair for sure.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2019

Title: Must have investment for any wardrobe and feet care/relief
Review: These are so so comfortable - as recommended.  A great purchase and investment for any person.  I would and will buy more.  I was given a word of mouth recommendation for Crocs from a woman with feet problems from years of work on her feet.  I hesitated at first thinking do I need these given flip flops, sneakers etc.  I was not prepared for the little massage/stimulation like nodules inside which are great too.  I can't think of how anyone would not get a lot of wear and relief out of these shoes, particularly anyone who works on their feet.  At the moment working in long shifts on concrete these are like a little foot massage and relief in between.  TRUE TO WEBSITE IMAGES FOR SLATE PURCHASE.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 13, 2020

Title: sigh. I guess I‚Äôve seen the light.
Review: Yes, I used to hate these and thought they were the ugliest shoe ever. Swore in high school that I would never get a pair. I‚Äôm now 26 and now that I‚Äôve hit my quarter life crisis, I found myself ordering a pair. Saw my hubby wearing them and made fun of him every time I saw him wear them. Then one day I needed to put them on to grab something outside (seeing that those were the only ones near me lol). He is a size 12 and I‚Äôm a size 6.5 so you can only imagine how huge they felt. I saw the light that day and ordered a pair of crocs.ANYWAYS here‚Äôs what you ladies wanna know about the fit:- I‚Äôm a NARROW 6.5 in women (can fit 6 in heels and 7 in Nike‚Äôs)- the site says to size up if you are a half size BUT these are already ugly enough so I took my chances and sized down.- ordered a 6 in women (Army Green) and they fit PERFECTLY.- the shoe feels SLIGHTLY tight when I put it in ‚Äú4x4 mode‚Äù (as my hubby calls it lol) but it‚Äôs not enough to bug me.- hubby says they stretch out over time so there you go.I got these the day they were expected and I unfortunately have not worn any other shoe since receiving it. Who have I become? :(
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2020

Title: So happy
Review: These are my first pair of Crocs. I only bought them because I needed easy slip on shoes for the summer for fishing that wasn‚Äôt open like sandals or flip flops but still breathable. And can I just say how absolutely happy I am that I bought these! I LOVE them and def will be buying more pairs now. (Never thought I would say that lol) They are so comfortable and I love the color. I‚Äôm usually a size 7-7 1/2 in shoes so I bought size 8 and they fit perfectly!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 11, 2020

Title: Croc noobie
Review: I have seen people wearing these for years and always thought they look ridiculous and couldn‚Äôt imagine how foam rubber shoes could be comfortable or durable. It‚Äôs obvious they aren‚Äôt stylish. After buying my very first pair of grass green size 15 crocs here for a crazy pre Christmas sale price of under 10$ with the free prime shipping, I‚Äôm amazed. After trying them on I no longer care how they look and I now get why they are popular. They are light durable and super comfy without feeling like you‚Äôre walking on marshmallows. In fact I was shocked how firm the foot bed is without being hard. I no longer care how they look. Not sure I would wear them to a wedding but for around the house and yard they are perfect.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2019

Title: Comfort! Ventilation! Durability!
Review: The Classic Clog line of Crocs serves my needs perfectly.  I can no longer wear normal shoes because my feet require more oxygen than those of most people, but I hate slippers and sandals (or going barefoot).  The Crocs Classic Clogs provide the ventilation I  need while still feeling like shoes, they're also very comfortable with cushioning thick soles and they're durable, lasting for a long time with no damage even after 3 years of daily use.  They're also cheap compared to others.  Yes, they're ugly, but you can get them in pretty colors to compensate, like these bright yellow ones.  For die hard Crocs fans like myself, buying one pair may lead to buying a dozen or more so be warned.  Emphasis on Classic Clog line.  The other models of shoes Crocs makes provide less ventilation and my feet aren't as comfortable in them.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2020

Title: Comfortable!
Review: So I'll be the first one to tell you that I thought Crocs were the ugliest thing ever.My sister ended up getting some because she needed something comfortable and told me "they had cute colors". After a week she told me I should definitely get some since they truly are comfortable.I was skeptical but I took the plunge. I ordered the cherry blossom color and when they arrived, I immediately tried them on. They are super comfortable!I now wear them all the time. The cherry blossom color is super cute and I definitely am alleviating my feet pain walking around the house now.Strongly recommend these!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2020

Title: Treat yourself to another Croc color.
Review: Great house slippers. Just read reviews that mention this. I wear a 10  EEEE, so these were perfect. I ordered the 10, and the classic crocs width was an excellent fit. If you have a narrower foot, D size and below, check out reviews on other Croc models that are narrower. Just pay attention to the number of reviews that mention whether the length is too short, this you may have to order one size larger, but the decrease in width should not be a problem for those with narrow, D and bellow. Crocs are so comfortable and easy to slip on and off I ordered another pair. And because they come in so many colors, you can order another color that pleases you, something to treat yourself to, as they are reasonably priced. Amazon‚Äôs selection is hit or miss, with many selections not available in all sizes and colors. So try Zappos. Amazon owns them anyway. And they always have free shipping and free returns.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2019

Title: Hubby didn‚Äôt want any but now wears them all the time!
Review: I ordered these crocs for my husband. We live at the beach and have a boat and he‚Äôs forever getting his shoes wet and/or leaving them outside. He swore he would never wear crocs. Well, he loves them!! Other than while at work he won‚Äôt wear anything else now, lol. Even went fishing on the boat with them and said that was the best thing ever! He‚Äôs so happy that I bought them for him and ‚Äúencouraged‚Äù him to wear them. They fit true to size, and he has plenty of room in them even though he has wide feet. He even loves the little ‚Äúmassaging things‚Äù in the soles. üòÅ So glad he no longer leaves any shoes outside!!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2020

Title: Love My Orange Crocs
Review: This is my first pair of crocs; never had the desire to own any. But now, can't imagine being without them! I needed something easy to slip into and take off when I'm down at the horse barn, feeding and cleaning corrals. Also nice that they are waterproof, unlike my old leather clogs. Excellent price, too . At first, I thought they were going to be floppy on my feet; I did purchase the size I usually wear. I wear socks with the crocs, sometimes two pair in the cooler months. They still fit just fine. I have narrow to medium width feet, wear a size 10. I like the orange because they're easy to spot wherever I've left them. Easy to clean off the dirt, either brush off or hose off; I understand they can be thrown in the washer, too. And, best of all, these crocs are as comfortable as my slippers I wear around the house. Sometimes, I forget I wore my crocs in the house, noticing sometimes hours later! Love them! And convinced my husband to order some, too! He loves his, too!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2018

Title: Completely Croc-ish
Review: You know the drill--They're comfortable but so unstylish that they're stylish. Well, I don't think this classic style of Crocs will ever be stylish, to my eye, but we buy them for comfort and versatility, right? My old pair were so worn that they started to slip on wet surfaces so I knew it was time for replacement. These fit well, though the rear strap is now tighter than the originals I got 15 years ago. The upside is they'll stay on better than the old ones--the downside is that if you plan to use the strap, you'll have to reach down and use a finger to stretch it around the back of your foot. It's fine--just different than the old looser strap.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 21, 2020

Title: These things ROCK!!!
Review: My wife has to put in 8 hour shifts on 2 feet that are suffering!!!  17+ hour shift working for REGIS many years ago tore her Plantar Facia & a Ankle tendon or ligament & these are the only shoes she can wear along with tape & ankle support that can see her through a shift!!!  You might be wondering why Doctor's haven't helped her? Well we live in Wisconsin where the compassion goes as far as your money!!!!!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2020

Title: Just like the originals!
Review: I have a pair of original Crocs that I bought 15 years ago and absolutely love them.  But the soles finally wore through and I needed to finally get another pair.  The size stamped on the bottom says W6-7.  I started looking on Amazon and couldn't believe how many styles of Crocs there are.  All I wanted was another pair just like my old ones.  I saw these Crocs Unisex Classic Clog and they looked almost identical to what I have.  I got a size 7 in Pepper and they are perfect.  I plan on ordering a couple more pairs.  Not for when these wear out (they seem to last forever) but there are so many great colors now.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2018

Title: Functionally great. They're basically flipflops with better functionality.
Review: I was going to buy slippers to wear in my yard and patio since it's been annoying to put shoes on whenever taking my dog outside or to take the trash out. But I went with Crocs since they are just as comfortable while also allowing me to run around if needed (ie. dog randomly feels like running around the backyard).It does its job and is comfortable enough. If anyone thinks Crocs are ugly or think they are bad purchases, they should relax. They're functionally great the way one would wear "fat pants" or an old t-shirt around the house. I'm not planning on wearing this to a Michelin Star restaurant.Things to be aware of:1. Seems to run half a size large.2. Not as cushioned as expected.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2018

Title: Comfy shoes
Review: LOVE LOVE LOVE!!! I am a 7 1/2 so i went with an 8 and it fits well enough. Sometimes it feels like its a little big, if i went a size lower, I think it would be too snug. I may get a size 7 next just so i have a snug pair lol
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2020

Title: Hooked.
Review: I'm simply hooked. I'm currently training for a very strenuous distance running challenge (fingers crossed it still happens). Plantar fasciitis slowly crept up on me, and these are one of the top solutions I've found. Yes, they are an eyesore, but that doesn't mean they can't be the most versatile eyesore in the house! I have used them for years to help with low back problems from walking on concrete floors in my college dorm to having a carefree solution for gardening. Oh! And I've been known to use them for their intended purpose of fishing on occasion. They are the best. Do yourself a favor and grab a pair.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2020

Title: Great house shoes!
Review: I‚Äôm using these as house shoes for when I move to Japan! I am a true to size women‚Äôs 9.5. I always get a size 10 on Crocs. I‚Äôve never had classic crocs before, but I‚Äôve heard that these feel a little big on the feet. Since all the crocs I‚Äôve worn have been 10‚Äôs, I just got the 10 anyway. When I first put them on, I thought these were going to be too big since I have narrow feet, but once I started walking around in them, they never slipped off my feet with the heel strap. I don‚Äôt really use them without the strap. They are roomy and comfortable! I think you should try getting your regular size before thinking of sizing down. See how they fit you personally before deciding to go a full size down.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 24, 2019

Title: Bright and Beautiful üíõ
Review: Love My Yellow Crocs I‚Äôve owned a few pair and there are exactly the same super light weight and comfy.True to size and came so fast I usually wear a 7 1/2 but the 8 was fine cause sometimes I wear socks with them Again Love Love Love üíõ‚ú®
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2020

Title: Super Comfortable Waterproof Shoes For Around The House
Review: Croc‚Äôs are super comfortable shoes for messing around the house and outside.  My wife bought an off brand as a second pair for indoors (no outside shoes in our house) that looked like Crocs but hurt her toes.  I bought her this pair of black crocs and she loves the feel, although she hates the black color as she has others in pink,  but black was the only color in stock.  We highly recommend Crocs for bumming around the house,  or going to a water park or beach.  They are not stylish,  so probably wouldn‚Äôt recommend wearing outside of the house other than the beach.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 19, 2020

Title: Half-size ordering down isn't perfect for me but going up to next size would be way too big. What to do!?
Review: They arrived today and because I wear a 9.5, I ordered a half-size down but with the strap around the back of my foot, my toes are hitting up against the front too much. I'm a bit bummed as I ordered exactly as this site and the Cros.com site said to do with half-sizes....order down!  BUT I have to say that going to a 10 would be ridiculous as I only need about 1/2 size more & I don't want to fall out of them = tripping potential. Now what? Do they stretch out a bit. I hope so as I ordered a white pair in 9 from Crocs.com too as I was so sure after trying on my friend's size 8's. We both agreed to order one size up for me. I can wear them, and will but my idea to order a bunch more in different colors went out the window...
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2017

Title: Good old favorites
Review: As expected, this is my son's 3rd pair same brand and color, I keep getting a size up toward the middle of every summer, he wears them quite a while that way. These are great for running in the sprinkler or playing in a sandbox or working in a vegetable garden, or for a rainy day or sand dune trip or beach trip. They can hurt the arches after a while so I don't recommend them for amusement parks or hiking.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2020

Title: Crocs Rock!!
Review: Do crocs even really need a review anymore? We all know they‚Äôre great. I‚Äôm 9-9.5 in size so I got the 9 and they fit perfectly with plenty of space to wear thicker socks if you want. Not sure why people hate on these things - they‚Äôre comfy, water proof, they slip right on... already got them dirty, they rinse right off...If this helped ya - click helpful :)

I was a croc enthusiast. (I even had multiple pairs of the same croc just because I guess). ‚ÄúWhy the croc‚Äù, they ask; and to that I say why not the croc.Now I have changed my eyes and I see the past me was correct and that being a croc enthusiast IS my passion and will forever be my passion. Me and my mother have the same shoe size so we are ‚Äúsharing‚Äù them even though they are mine (she agreed).If you don‚Äôt own crocs I recommend that you immediately purchase a pair (or more if you are smart).The beautiful lavender color suits my skin tone very well. I will never be the same without my crocs by my side. Buy a pair of these crocs now. Sports mode is comforting knowing that your croc is safe and sound on your foot. While Relaxed mode gives you the comforting sensation of at home or taking the trash out ùïßùïöùïìùïñ.Thank you for your timeAnd crocs please sponsor me I love you and I‚Äôve loved you since I was two.:)

Title: Love my Crocs

The swelling in my feet have gone down and I've since bought a pair that fits me.  I wear them all day (I work from home) and highly recommend them.  I also had a plantar wart directly on the heel of my foot and these were almost the only shoe that was comfortable until it went away.  Buy these shoes. I was not paid to write this and have no benefit of anyone buying them.  I read all the reviews for items I buy and hope this helps someone else who is on the fence.

Title: Get them u won‚Äôt regret it!!!!!

Title: You won‚Äôt regret it

There‚Äôs litto nubs on the inside of the sole that feel really nice. The bottom outside sole is also pretty slip proof.Can‚Äôt wait to rock my Crocs! Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2017

Title: Crocs Classis Clogs are the best for summer
Review: I love the class Crocs clog.  My feet swell in hot, humid weather, and these are the only shoes I can tolerate.  I also walk several miles a day to and from work, and these are the best.I buy wear a size six-and-a-half, and I order the Crocs in size seven to give my feet room to swell.  In cooler weather, I wear socks; hot weather, no socks.  Also, putting the strap on the back of my heel holds them on when my feet aren‚Äôt swelling.  When they swell, I push the strap up to the top of the shoe.They provide excellent arch support.  I have very high arches and a very high instep and I am very comfortable in these shoes.The main drawback is that if it is raining and you walk into a store with smooth floors, swoosh, slip, slide.  You have to be very careful.  Usually, there is a mat to wipe your shoes at the entrance.  Use it.Also, I have a friend with MS who tells me these shoes do not provide enough lateral support, so if you are unfortunate enough to share that need, these shoes are not sufficient.  For everyone else, they are terrific, very, very comfortable.You can wash your Crocs, best to use a damp cloth, but you can put them in the sink if they get filthy.  Most of the time, an occasional swipe along the inside with damp cloth or paper towel is all you need to prevent them picking up odors.  If they start to squeak, put some vegetable oil on them overnight and then wipe them off in the morning with a paper towel.If they are too big, put them in the dryer with a damp towel for a few minutes.  If they are too small, do the same, but take them out and put them on and walk around in them to stretch them.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 25, 2015

Title: Misleading Images

The actual pepper clog is a bright red croc, but not necessarily neon red its kind of like the color of a pepper. I'm not really upset with the actual croc but more so that I didn't get the product that was advertised by the images. So I guess buyer beware and look up the colors on google images beforehand to make sure that you're getting the color you actually want. I'll add more to this review if there are any further issues down the line.

Title: One word... WOW!

It took me about 2 weeks to decide if they were helping. When I woke up one day and had no pain at all I realized they had worked all along but it took my body awhile to feel the effects. I think it took awhile to get used to the feeling of this type of shoe also. So far I am loving them. I also noticed that all of the cracks I had around my heels and the ball of my feet are now gone. They are completely healed in just a few weeks that I have been wearing these. I have used so many lotions etc with no success and wearing these shoes for just this short time took them away. I don‚Äôt understand how but that is an amazing bonus. for anyone that has experienced painful, cracked skin on your feet you will appreciate these. Wow is all I can say!!

Title: Try these!!
Review: I‚Äôm not one to like wearing shoes,  I always thought Crocs looked hideous.One day I had to go outside in a hurry and the quickest thing I could grab was my sons crocs.They felt so nice even a few sizes too big at the time. I started wearing his to walk the dogs and decided it was time to get me a pair. I haven‚Äôt taken them off since except to sleep! I have plantar fasciitis and have had no problem since buying these. Title: Pain free!

And yet still, pain. Working on my feet for 12+ hours a day didn't help. I came home every night a cripple. There have been days I have crawled from my car to my door. I've worn crocs every day for a solid week and it has been the first week since my accident that I have been almost pain free. I wear these suckers hard. Working 12+ hours in a hospital, on a concrete floor, running around like a chicken with its head cut off- AND THE CROCS MADE IT. I came home and cleaned my house after working a 13 hour shift because my ankle didn't hurt. I'm a believer. Thanks Crocs!

The strap is a nice option you can use or flip up and not use. Lov‚Äôem‚Äô

Title: Can‚Äôt beat them

Title: SO FAR VERY DURABLE FOR WHAT THEY ARE PUT THROUGH AND SUPER COMFORTABLE

Title: Comfort at the cost of style.
Review: Honestly, I never thought in a million years I would wear Crocs, let alone actually enjoy wearing them. They are actually a daily driver in my shoe repertoire. I pretty much only wear them around the house but for a house shoe, they are just too comfortable to give up. It's been around 9 months since I got them and they are holding up amazingly well. I still wear them around the house daily. One con I can give them is that you HAVE to wash them at least weekly otherwise they will absolutely reek. I'm not sure what causes it since my other shoes don't smell at all but these get ripe really easily.The shoe, in general, is bigger than what the packaging says just because they make the width a little bigger so make sure to measure your foot (there are guides out there to figure out your croc size) before you buy.
