Title: Comfy but came in a box big enough for 4 pairs.
Review: I got these as shower clogs, and they work fine, I do find the bumps in the bed of the shoes are a little annoying right after putting them on, but the odd sensation seems to fade.I gave these five stars. but the crazy box they came in was absurd.  Seriously 1  pair of size 10 shoes in a box that was 3 to 4 times too long.When the husband brought the box in from the porch, I hadn't a clue what was in a box long enough to have housed a 4 person tent.I guess they must have been out of shoe box size containers that day.  Crazy.I wish I had taken a picture!  but alas, it was recycled before I thought about it.Bottom line the Crocs are great though.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2018

Title: Dorky as expected but super comfortable!
Review: Crocs are dorky but keep your feet cool, great on wet days, very comfortable, easy to get on and off and last.Although I swore I wasn't going to buy shoes on the internet due to the hassle of getting a good fit, I did it again. Even with free returns a one hour shoe buying trip can take weeks to get the size right online due to the shipping back and forth. Why did I do it? Crocs closed all of their retail stores near us. I tried looking in the larger retailers that Croc says carry their shoes and found that they didn't!These were to replace an identical pair I've owned for 6 years. The tread was gone so it as time. I checked the reviews and the Amazon shoe sizer and decided to go 1 size smaller than my old pair which were comfortable but a little large. Not knowing whether Crocs had changed/improved the last for their shoe after a few years even getting the same model can be a guess on size. These are also comfortable but the smallest Size 11s I own. Overall I'm happy.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2017

Title: Don‚Äôt knock it till you try it.
Review: Ok...:not gonna lie...I‚Äôve hated crocs for years. They aren‚Äôt exactly dress shoes nor athletic shoes. They always looked uncomfortable to me and no one could convince me otherwise. Until now. My wife had an emergency c-section and was in the hospital for weeks. My baby is in the NICU right now. I‚Äôve been walking these hard hospital floors for weeks and thought my feet were going to fall off. Enter my brother in law who brought me a pair of his crocs. At this point I was willing to try anything. They were absolutely amazing!! Not just comfortable but the arch support was amazing!!! The width is perfect so that your feet aren‚Äôt squeezed in and it‚Äôs honestly like getting a foot rub with every step!!! So yeah....I‚Äôm the proud convert and owner of crocs.  Love these things!!!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2019

Title: Go with your gut. If you wear a half size go with the bigger size.
Review: This is my first pair of crocs and I really didnt know what size to buy since I have a high instep and I can wear really anything from a 8 to 9. I bought the female 8 size and they are the exact size of my foot. If you want something loose go with the size up for sure. Very happy with my purchase and I'm a believer now. These are awesome!!!!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 15, 2020

Title: Crocs... with Socks...
Review: Not sure what the "Crocs with Socks" fad is, but my tween son loves his.  Might have to rename him "Matt".  If a sink-hole opens somewhere nearby, I'm sure they'll be interviewing my kid and his smoke-show of a wife.Seriously, he's comfortable in them and wears them through all four seasons.  As long as he's happy, these are worth the buy.  Threw in some shoe charms so he can keep up with the local trend.  They're durable and easy to get on and off, so he's ready and out the door before the rest of us regular shoe wearing neanderthals.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2020

Title: The design is just right including many different colors but subdued enough that you don't feel like you have clown feet
Review: These Crocs are so cute! The design is just right including many different colors but subdued enough that you don't feel like you have clown feet. The background shade of blue is a little lighter than it appears on my screen. Goes perfectly with my jeans.I highly recommend these shoes, and all Crocs for that matter. Most comfortable shoes possible for everyone, but especially if you have any arthritis in your feet or knee problems etc.Another great feature with Crocs in general is that they weigh almost nothing. This is very helpful when packing for traveling.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 25, 2016

Title: Cosy Toes
Review: I have hammer toes and the previous type of Crocs I got, although more, shall we say, fashionable, hurt my toese because they didn't have enough height.  These are perfect, with sufficient height so my toes slide right in.  They are comfortable, and do not slide off.  I usually don't use the heel catch, but when I need to (outside), it helps keep them firmly on my feet.  They also seem to be long wearing: I have a much older pair that I use for yard work, and they are barely worn.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2020

Title: Great Shoe ( even if mom thinks they're hideous)
Review: I have no idea why the trend of Crocs has returned, yet my 15 year old is completely obsessed! She had her friends love Crocs and these white ones were the top item on her birthday list. We've had them since the end of June and today  continue to be in great shape even though they've been worn pretty much every day. They are sturdy and easily washable. The bottom line is I might think they are hideous, but she is thrilled with her shoes and her friends are jealous.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2020

Title: super squish
Review: i wear a 10.5 shoe- ordered these in a 10 and they fit pretty boxy and loose. i left them out in the sun for a while until they had shrunk up enough to fit perfectly (shrunk in both width and length).wearing them with socks isn‚Äôt comfortable bc the material pulls your socks all over the place but they‚Äôre great barefoot- perfect for trash runs, taking the dogs out, after mountain biking- however, i could never imagine wearing them in public.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2020

Title: Great shoes all around!
Review: Great shoes, fit as expected. This is the second pair we've purchased, comfy, convenient (really ridiculously convenient) and great for nature walks/river days!I started using my crocs as water shoes on accident, on that day I discovered that my crocs were wildly better water shoes than my actual dedicated water shoes.Weird, but awesome. I couldn't kick them off of my feet as hard as I swam, and they did a great job protecting my whole foot in the river. Highly recommend!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2020

Title: Love these stress-relieving Crocs
Review: I'm on my fourth pair in this style and love these Crocs. I wear them every day around the house. Three pairs I bought  a size larger and I feel like I'm not wearing shoes.  The fourth looks more dainty for travel. The inner sole features textured nubs that massage my feet. They feel fantastic, last 1-2 years of daily wear, and are easy to clean!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 5, 2020

Title: Wore out my old pair, new pair is stiff because they need to be broken in
Review: The longer I wear each pair of Crocs the more comfortable they become.  I've worn many different styles and colors of Crocs, the khaki classic clog is my timeless favorite for most every season but bitterly cold.  They are ideal for every day wear around the home or town, at the pool or even for basic farm chores. Fit is always true to size but be forewarned, black tends to shrink in sunlight whereas I've never encountered this problem with other colors.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 10, 2020

Title: PERFECT HOUSE SHOES
Review: The perfect upgrade to my crummy old house slippers! I have gone through several pairs of ‚Äúmemory foam‚Äù house slippers... they never last me more than a few months before they go flat and become practically useless... no support, get dirty fast, and then they don‚Äôt wash well. These were the perfect solution. SO comfortable, easy to slip on with or without socks, easy to clean, and they actually keep my feet a bit warm! LOVE them and I get sad to take them off when I need to leave the house. I‚Äôm between a 7.5-8, average width, and the 8 fits great.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2020

Title: I wanted to find these classic ones because I loved to wear them around the house as indoor slippers
Review: I couldn't find the classic ones in the stores around where I live anymore. They all have adopted the newer hard bottoms. I wanted to find these classic ones because I loved to wear them around the house as indoor slippers. Just for some context, I'm Asian, and we don't wear shoes into the house. Partially to keep the floors clean, but probably some other cultural reason that I haven't looked into yet. We have specific indoor slippers. I haven't looked too much into slippers, but I know these are good in the winter time because they can keep my feet warm and are easy to wash if they start to smell.The only problem I have with these are that it's hard to know what size to buy without trying them on, but that's just me.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 28, 2017

Title: Like walking on pillows
Review: My feet hurt all the time.  I bought these to walk around the house.  I have to wear shoes doing chores around the house or my feet are killing me in a few minutes.  I can't get over how comfortable these things are.  I wish I bought a pair years ago.  I got them yesterday and wore them all day cleaning the house.They fit me really well.  That makes me think they might not fit most that well.  I have very wide feet and a high arch.  I usually buy New Balance extra wide athletic shoes.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2020

Title: So comfortable and great arch support
Review: Ok, I am not a fan of crocs because I‚Äôve always thought they were ugly.  I bought a pair to wear around the house because I read they have good arch support and my arches were cramping a lot. Put them on and thought, holy cow.  I get it now.  They are extremely comfortable.  They have great arch support and a large toe box to allow wiggle room.  After wearing them a few days, I decided that they are so comfortable that it outweighs the beauty factor.  LOL.  I could wear these all day, easily.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2020

Title: Un-shockingly comfortable

After her ankle injury, even her "Zen" activities (cooking and laundry, no joke: she forbids me from taking them from her) would became agonizing after ten minutes of standing on bare feet. But these squishy shoes have brought her renewed hope that life moving forward isn't going to be chronic pain on her feet.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2020

Title: Made for very wide feet. Great for CHP

For those people with swollen feet and ankles like congestive heart failure etc THESE ARE PERFECTHowever, I have VERY NARROW feet and they are still fine for me except they fit best with socks. I wear a Womens 7.5 or a Euro 38 and I believe the size 8 was perfect
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2020

Title: Lightweight
Review: Super comfortable and lightweight. I normally wear between an 8-9, and purchased the 8 after reading the details saying they are made to be very roomy. I planned to wear them without the strap, so they were perfect. I think I would've needed a 9 if I wanted to wear them comfortably with the strap or thick socks. Sadly, my cats got ahold of them a couple hours after they got delivered üò≠ so I won't get a chance to see how they feel worn in.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2018

Title: LOVE
Review: I've tried for years to avoid Crocs and I've finally given in. These are by far, THE BEST camp shoes (walking around your campsite for car camping OR backpacking). They're also fantastic for gardening. Lightweight and very comfortable. So happy I finally swallowed my pride and got a pair.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2020

Title: Exactly the size and fit!  BEWARE HALF-SIZE ADVICE!

She likes to say that she has 'narrow' feet, but these fit perfectly with or without the heel band.NOTE: Amazon says to go a size down if you want a half-size fit, but the 7W/5M proved much too small for my daughter, who wears a 7.5W.  The 8 fit perfectly, though!  So one, purchase, one return (totally hassle-free), and one replacement!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2019

Title: Not sure about this product.
Review: I have a very old pair of Crocs that are the MOST COMFORTABLE shoe ever. In this time of Covid I wear them a lot. In fact I wear them most of the time. They were wearing out and I decided to order another pair. This new pair is fine really but nothing like the just soft enough, just firm enough old pair that I still have. I slip my feet into that old pair and my feet stop barking and start purring. They are a treasure. If my life was a nation they would be a National Treasure.So I was very sad that these new ones were not exactly like my old ones. If you didn't have my old ones to compare to you might not know what you were missing. I did not post a review at the time of purchase as I was too busy worrying about Covid and life and survival. I wonder if these are the real thing or a knock off. Again, they are fine but just not quite the same.

Title: Great quality and decent price.

Took a chance even though some reviews were pretty negative and except for getting 2 different sizes pretty minor as to the complaints.  They fit fine and I can‚Äôt come up with anything very negative beyond I couldn‚Äôt walk out of a store with them.  On the positive side, they were only $20 less than the store that only had a muddy green color so the 2 day wait was totally worth it.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 7, 2019

Title: Crocs with socks the new fashion trend

My husband felt exactly the same however for some reason I was able to convince him that these would be perfect for him. I mean heck Deadpool wears them so surely he must know that they're comfortable.ever since I've got these for him he has for gone his flip-flops and he also likes and where's these crocks almost every single day. Much to my mortification occasionally he put socks on with the Crocs.

Title: Love my Crocs!

Title: I have these in blue too

I buy size 6 because I have that size already and they are a bit big but still work. I can't find the other dark blue one but I am sure it will turn up soon. These tan ones will go great with all of my clothes through out the year and while the color is not the brightest, it is the color which I prefer. Don't want the fish to see me now do I?

Title: Never thought I'd buy these (again)

Now I'm older, live in the mountains and needed a pair of shoes that i could hose off and bought a pair of Crocs! They're still comfortable, still not my style, but they certainly are functional.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2020

Title: It really irks me when my sister is right... LOL

I finally broke down and decided to give them a try. They‚Äôre perfect to wear outside to fill bird feeders, hike out to the barn, take out the trash etc.  The heel strap on the back is a great feature and ensures that you do not pop out of them accidentally.

Title: Love Them ... Perfect Fit

She loves everything about them (because she LOVES crocs).  But, I was slightly disappointed (just a lil') because of the color. Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2020

Title: An unlikely Croc convert

And not just any pair, bright yellow. If I'm gonna hate on Croc's why not do it loudly. I just so happened to be on vacation last week, which required 10+ miles of walking per day. I wore them like my life depended on it. And alas, I find myself begrudgingly a fan. They are really well designed, so simple, but so effective. Everywhere slippers, and when I say everywhere, that includes lobster boats, scaling the rough coastline of Maine, walking endless long dirt roads, outdoor showers on the beach. I am a Croc convert, but now make fun of myself.

Title: Needs softness
Review: I had a pair which I got over a decade ago. Until recently I had kept them by the door for quick trips outside. Then I got planter fasciitis, and they became my everyday shoe. This replacement is not as soft and comfortable. Maybe it is because the older shoe was of aged material, is was softer. I wish they were still wearable. These replacements are still better than any other option though.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2020

Title: Comfort is AMAZING!!
Review: I love these shoes!! It‚Äôs like walking on clouds. The only thing I‚Äôd change is getting a larger size. They fit perfectly, for me personally I‚Äôd like a little wiggle room.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2020

Title: Amazing Comfort
Review: These Crocs are softer than I imagined, fit a bit wider than I was hoping for, and the arch support is not there for me, but I have high arches.However,  They are amazing in comfort!  Personally this is not something I would want to wear on a day with a lot of walking, but I may try a 1/2 size smaller (if they make them that way).I am normally a 6 in everything so I bought a 6.they are too wide for my feet and I cannot walk in them without the heel strap or my feet come out of them.with the strap they're great.I have told others to try them for their amazing comfort.I just need to find the right size for my feet.I wear these every day since I got them so they're not so big I cannot use them.I definitely recommend these to family and friends.

Depending on what color you choose, you can get them to match with anything, or just get two pairs. I loved them so much that I'm going to get another pair.My only thing with these is that I'm a half size. My feet are a size 9.5 (ik the small feet girls are scared rn). The size 9 don't fit me, but the size 10 are a slight bit big for me. It's not like they're dramatically big, just more wiggle room than expected. But who cares, they're cute! Go get some, sis.

Title: Crocs are nearly perfect for me

They may look dorky, but they are about the most comfortable shoes I have ever worn in my life....so far!! 5 stars!!

Title: So Ugly, they‚Äôre cute!
Review: I finally bought my teenage daughter some crocs of her own. I‚Äôve worn them as slippers for years. They were recommended from a podiatrist for my plantar fasciitis. Now She doesn‚Äôt have to steal mine to walk her dog. I never thought she would even like them, but she loves them! They‚Äôre easy to slip on over her slipper socks and they‚Äôre a cute fun color!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2020

Title: Great Product with Great Customer Service
Review: The customer support was great! I originally purchased a size too small, and they sent me the correct size a day later. I was blown away at how quickly the replacement came. The sizes are true to form. I was originally worried that the next size up would be way too big, but it fits great. The ankle strap works great for this. So far the shoes are real comfortable, and I'm very excited about wearing them in the future.

Title: Great fit for any age
Review: Our podiatrist recommended Crocs for our 94 year old father who needed more padding for his heels as well as a shoe that would be easy on his bunions. I was a bit hesitant thinking the popular slip on would fit too loosely and that my father would have a difficult time adjusting to this style and fit. I was wrong! Crocs are easy to slip on and off.  He‚Äôs using the heel strap and they fit perfectly. He‚Äôs the coolest great granddad and now has us wanting a new pair!

Title: runs small
Review: I've had a couple pair of Crocs.  Previous pair was a little big and sloppy.  I ordered the next size smaller and these are a bit too tight.  I could slip on the larger ones without touching them and they'd stay on most of the time with the strap slipping into place.  The smaller ones require a quick finger to pull the strap and then they're a little too tight at the toes.  I wish they made half sizes, but I just fall between that jump in size.  Otherwise, they're good as a slipper and a deck shoe.  They require no care and last a long time.

Title: Fun, comfortable, saves my knees.
Review: I work in aquatics. I'm around pools all the time and pool decks are hard - tile on concrete or concrete. These shoes save my knees. Others must like them as deck shoes too because I see black ones all the time (I've owned 2 pair in black), but I get tired of almost putting on someone else's shoes! So, Yellow it is. I can find them easily among all the other "men's deck shoes" and their fun! In my job I work with a lot of kids, and they really like them too.

Title: Received the wrong item
Review: I had to go through three rounds of purchases before I got the right shoe. The first time was my fault, my boyfriend wears a 10.5 so I sized up to an 11 and that ended up being too big. So I exchanged them for a smaller size (a 10). Instead, I was given a fur lined croc (I had bought the original croc) and it was a different color. So I had to send those back and order yet another pair of crocs. They came and were the right size, color, and style. Just the same as you would buy in the store.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2020

Title: better than 2$ flip flops
Review: I remember a friend of mine hopped onboard with these YEARS back and I completely made fun of him constantly because thats what friends do. After a few years and tons of thousands of people were wearing these things everywhere I figured they had to be good or just crazy hype. I had to try em so I grabbed a pair and I have to say they're very sturdy, comfortable, and theres better arch support vs a pair of slides. Its pretty much like boots combined with sandals? Anyways yeah I like them.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2020

Title: Short in the toe but Oh So fun
Review: Crocs are crocs, right? I finally, after years, sprung for a pair of classic crocs. I am spending time on the farm, and these are great for gardening, checking on the horses & chickens etc. so easy to clean. And in this incessant rain (thanks Harvey) I need a waterproof shoe. Size wise.... I wish  they had half sizes. I wear 8.5, but ordered 8 as suggested. Maybe I have weird toes (I admit to have broken 2). Although the toe box is roomy, my 4th and 5th toes feel uncomfortably squished. I hope that, with time, the Crocs will mold to my feet. A size up is not an option, they would be floating on me. In short: I love the color (pepper, not too red but defnitely cheery!) and the functionality.

Title: Elder Approved
Review: My mother took a bad fall on cement as she was walking with slippers/flip flops.  The flip flops folded under at the top which made her trip.  My sister bought her a pair of crocs which she uses in the house, so I bought her this pair for use outside.  She is pleased with the fit, and the color, and I'm happy that she's more secure walking...no more tripping with floppy flip flops.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2020

Title: Light and Comfy. Do Not Leave out in the Sun!
Review: These a very light, which was unexpected. I thought they would be like the old, heavy, rubber ones, but these seem to be silicone-based and are pleasantly light, bendable and comfortable. They are good for letting the errant water flow through during gardening, but of course, the open side holes also allow lots of dirt to get in, which is not as easy to get out without taking them off. That said, how hard is it to take them off? They do what they are supposed to.A word to the wise: Do not leave your Crocs out in the sun. They will shrink. These are a replacement for a men's size 9 that shrank to a women's size 7 after being in the hot sun all day. No amount of internet home remedies would fix it.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2017

Title: Buy em Sis ü•∞
Review: I love these shoes so much!!! Only reason I‚Äôm giving them 4 stars is because they didn‚Äôt come in an authentic crocs box they came in a plastic bag which was really disappointing. I have all my shoes organized in their original box so other than that great buy. *All charms were purchased on amazon separately* but they do make the shoes extra funky and stylish. I highly recommend üëçüèΩ

Title: I don't care if you think they're ugly

Sometimes after wearing regular shoes for a few days straight, I get really bad arch pain.  Wearing these for a day or two fixes me right up. Love them. Title: Perfect

I know these are ugly shoes but they are perfect for wearing poolside and in the lake in upstate New York where we have zebra mussels. these are literally my go-to outside shoe in the summer and I'm happy I finally have a pair of my own I used to steal my husband's all the time.

Title: LOOOOOVES

But I‚Äôm redoing an old building and my feet were hurting all the time and I kept stealing my son‚Äôs crocs at home. He suggested I get my own size 8‚Äôs instead of wearing his 12‚Äôs. So I swallowed my pride and got me some crocs.OMG I sleep in them. They have become my work shoes- I paint in them, climb on the roof with them, garden in them, and cook in them. One day they‚Äôll wish they were like me, and had their own.

Title: LOVE THEM SO MUCH but slightly big

You do have to get used to the little beads on the bottom of the croc but honestly soooooo comfortable. Btw sport mode all the way. Get yourself a pair and be ready for the judging comments. Don‚Äôt worry, it‚Äôll be worth it.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2020

Title: Comfortable for house shoes
Review: I wear these around the house b/c I have high arches and am not supposed to go barefoot very much. They don't have much arch support, so I added felt arch cookies and now they provide better support. They're a little loose but I like that, since I'm using them as house slippers.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 12, 2020

Title: Great fit, very comfortable
Review: I normally wear size 8.5. Usually when I get footware such as this they only come in whole sizes, so I have to choose between 8 and 9 (US). My experience has told me to go with the 8 (flip flops, muck boots, etc). It held true for these, I ordered the size 8 and fit is just what I wanted. Overall love the design, there is a bit of arch support which I want, very comfortable. I wear these as "house slippers" all the time I'm in the house, I live on a farm and wear boots most of the time outside, so out in the garage I leave these while stepping into my boots, and vice versa. I probably wouldn't wear these out anywhere, but you certainly could. I don't use the straps, just leave them in the out of the way position, forward, but if I did wear them any place but in the house I'd probably engage those straps.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2018

Title: Best Shoes Ever
Review: I had a pair of Crocs as a kid, but never got another pair once I grew out of them. Like so many, I fell into the "Crocs are the worst" mindset (where it's fashionable to hate them). Having a two year old, I was looking for a pair of slip on shoes that were more comfortable than flip flops. After hours of searching, I remembered my childhood Crocs and decided to give them a chance and I'm SO glad I did. I don't even care that they look a little silly (but really not bad!) because they're so stinkin comfortable. Now I can slip them on to play outside with my daughter, run to the store, or play in the lake. They're awesome!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2020

Title: Lightweight easycare slip ons
Review: I work as a volunteer with puppies, with a hygiene routine that requires me to change footwear inside and outside their pens. These are perfect for the job, being (very) lightweight, easy to disinfect and slip on and off. The back strap is useful to give added security if needed. I am an 8 1/2 (US), 39 Eur or 6.5 UK and I bought a size 9. They are easy to wear and keep on, particularly with socks, and I'm not swimming in them, as I had feared I might be. Buy up, not down, if you are a half size like me.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2019

Title: Not What They're "Croc"d up to be.
Review: Purchased for husband who wears a 12 extra wide. First pair I ordered were 13 because some said they were on the small narrow side. Whoops! Way too long and too wide! Next were size 12, and again no winner. Too long and too wide. Third time,(size 11), they fit! He says they are comfortable and not too long or wide, but he needs the heel strap for best fit. So... 4.5 stars for fit,(finally), and 1 star for too many trips to UPS to return. PS. All 3 pair are made in Mexico. So much for jobs for Americans! Really should deduct a star for that.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2020

Title: Same size but fits differently
Review: I purchased these crocs in September 2020.  Just started wearing them today.  I assumed they would fit like the last pair I purchased because they are the same size.  I found this pair to be a little shorter ad not as wide.  I noticed this pair was made in China where as the last pair was made in Mexico.  Disappointed that this pair doesn't fit as nice ad the last pair.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2020

Title: Gorgeous Emerald Green
Review: If your favorite color is green then you will love this shoe and even if it‚Äôs not you will still love it ! The green is much prettier in person. It‚Äôs like a jade/emerald green. As far as sizes go I always order a 9 but Crocs do stretch after you wear them for a while so now the shoe is more roomy! I would still recommend buying your regular size ! Because when you wear socks it will feel snug NOT tight.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2020

Title: Great for gardening & around the house
Review: I have worn these since I got my first pair for 50¬¢ at a garage sale! The price on Amazon was not quite that good, but it was on the low side. I did have to return mine though because my size was not available in my desired color of khaki. Zappos had them (free shipping and free returns). As always, Amazon is my first choice, but even having to pay $6 more on Zappos.com I got the color I needed. Crocs sizing can be confusing: the bottom of each shoe list two sizes:  M (men) W (women). So when looking for your size, look for your gender size. The shoes should fit roomy at the toe and at the heal - do not let them rub anywhere (as advised by crocs). You will get used to the loose fit after a while - or just use the back strap for more stability. I ordered M 8/ W6 and it was to small (short: toe & heal touched ends) My normal shoe size is women's 8 and on rare occasion 8 1/2. My foot is narrow to med. width. The size I needed from crocs was M7/W9 (so the women's 8 was too small/short). Amazon showed my size of US7/9 (way down at the bottom of the scroll down drop-list), but did not have my color available. Thought I'd take a chance (to save $6) and try women's 8. Zappos, like Amazon, delivered quickly and the shoes in the proper size 7/9 fit!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 9, 2014

Title: Pampering my feet
Review: I work at home during this Covid and I wear these Crocs 12 hours per day with or without socks... They are so comfortable it's like wearing nothing. It protects me from our cold marble floors. My feet never sweat in them. This is my second pair after 3 years and I just love them. For $30 it's the best way to pamper my feet. The old ones I use to go outside and they have the same comfort level, except a different color
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2020

Title: Cool but these spikes on the insole are a bit annoying
Review: I love everything about this product except for those little spikes inside. I thought Crocs were supposed to be smooth on the inside or something? Everything else is spot on. That's why I can only give 4 stars. I usually wear a size 8.5 men so I ordered an 8 and they fit perfectly! Everything else is great though. I knowwwww theses are going to bed a great investment for my knees and the little spikes inside will wear down eventually.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2020

Title: So comfortable! Use as house shoes while pregnant
Review: These are my favorite house shoes in the world! I‚Äôm 22 weeks pregnant and started to get some serious back pain as well as achey feet. My heals would kill me at the end of the day just walking around my house since we have wood floors and tile plus our carpeted areas do not have really good padding underneath. I got these and they helped me tremendously. Sure they‚Äôre not the most appealing or fashionable.. but I still think they‚Äôre cute. The color is nice and it actually has like a pearly finish to them. LOOOVE THESE shoes!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2019

Title: Comfy but too wide
Review: I returned the first pair of Crocs (unisex) that I purchased because they were ginormous. They were not only large but very wide. That said, they felt good on the sole of my arthritic feet. I went on-line again & search for a pair that was described as "women's" because other reviewers stated there was a definite difference in the width, ie, women's were narrower. Not so. These are just as wide. I normally wear Danskos so I'm accustomed to a shoe that fits loosely but I feel I could almost get both feet in one Croc.If you have wide feet, order the B(M)--Do NOT size up. These are really comfy but they are so wide I'm hesitant to wear them out & about.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2016

Title: Always will have them and more than one
Review: I love crocs. Have owned many, many pairs for years. And tread lasts years. I went by the chart and ordered the size it told me to, but it seemed to run larger and loose. So it's a shoe you need to first find the right size and go for it. Great slip on shoe for those of us who like to be bare footed but terrain doesn't protect the sole of your foot. Example: rocks...
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2020

Title: They perfect summer show
Review: I was buying crocs for my grandkids along with the charms, so wanted a pair for myself.  These are the perfect background for the charms.  They are a fun shoe and perfect for summer, to just kick around in.  With Crocs, you always know what you are getting.  Perfect.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 29, 2020

Title: Never thought I'd say this, quarantine has changed me, I actually love them!
Review: I love these, super easy and comfy. Perfect to throw on in the morning and water my plants. The little bumps on the sole are "massaging" (but wearing too long can kind of hurt a bit). Great price too compared to other outlets. I am normally 9-9.5 but tried my 10 year old son's (which converted to a 7) and that fit, so I opted for an 8 which is actually perfect, so maybe go down a size. Can't walk super far, tried wearing these out and had sore feet for a couple days, maybe not used to them though. Otherwise definitely glad this quarantine let me to trying them!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2020

Title: I'm now a croc fan for LIFE
Review: I've had so many foot issues, including persistent bursitis in my toes and now plantar fasciitis from wearing birkenstocks 24/7 (to help with the bursitis). As soon as I put these things on, I finally found shoes that don't hurt my feet, I LOVE THEM. My wife tried them on that night and immediately ordered them for herself in tye dye. I swear, I'm so mad at myself for resisting crocs all this time. That was dumb.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2020

Title: LOVE
Review: Having kids, my feet have changed a bit so sizes don't really match up all the time. These fit perfect! When the straps are in the upper position, its a little loose but I don't mind it. Doesn't make my feet super sweaty and way more comfortable than a different style of Crocs I have. I wear these all the time now, around the house and outside.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2020

Title: Went from avoiding ever sporting to loving them.
Review: We needed a good tough camp/shower shoe. What we got was a great shower shoe and they are so cutie that they look great as a summer shoe matching them to my outfits. My feet feel protected and they are very comfortable. I got the tie die ones for my son also and now he wares them all the time. Much lighter then I thought they would be. They stay on my feet really well even without the strap. Very happy. I would order more colors in the future.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 29, 2020

Title: I think they seem fairly well-made and hold up well; but the recipient has mixed feelings about them
Review: Technically, these were a gift to someone else.  He likes the convenience of a quick slip-on, and likes that they are more stable and supportive than any of the verious "flip-flop" type slip-ons, but he doesn't like that he "can't" wear them with socks ((says the socks catch on all of the openings)), and that therefore, his feet sweat.That being said, from *my* point of view:the previous pair held up to a good bit of wear-and-tear.  And the covered toe keeps them from catching is things ((which is always *my* problem with flip-flops - the toes catch and I trip)).  The back-strap is optional, but there if one needs it.  They cushion well.  They also fit his EEEE-width feet.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2018

Title: Man Crocs
Review: I am a Croc lover.  I don't wear anything else.  I bought these for my husband because he wanted to try them.  He has very bad feet and he said they are very comfortable.  He likes that you can wear them in the river to protect against rocks and then just leave them on and wear them all day.  He says they ain't the prettiest shoes he's ever seen but they do what he needs them to do.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2020

Title: Their Crocs
Review: Cheapest pair I could find on Amazon for a first time purchase of Crocs, I got the brown pair. They were made in China, I dont know if that makes a difference to anyone but I've noticed small difference in my pair from other friends Crocs that were made in Mexico or Vietnam. But overall I'm super happy with my purchase, they came a day faster than expected and I've worn them about everyday since recieving them.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2020

Title: Money well spent for durable comfort that will last and last.
Review: The classic Crocs shoe....excellent in all areas of fitment, quality and comfort. Size is dead on and that Crocs cushiony support feels like walking on clouds! Perfect for walking your favorite store (wearing your mask, gloves, gown and GPS 6ft distance alarm) or the beach! Built from the same durable material we've come to trust from Crocs...invest in foot comfort and buy these classic Crocs. It's money well spent.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 12, 2020

Title: Cute and fits well
Review: This was for my teenage daughter. It‚Äôs all the thing for girl wrestlers to wear crocs or slides when not wearing their wrestling shoes. My daughter loves these. Very light and clean looking. We went to a shoe store where she tried on for size but they didn‚Äôt have the color she wanted. This was cheaper than any other store listed online including croc store. We also purchased some jibbitz which fit in the holes of the crocs for added decoration.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2020

Title: Comfortable and super cute
Review: This is my first time ever getting/wearing crcos and I am hooked. I have high arches so I was worried about standing all day in these since my fit get sore a little more easily. I am so glad I took the chance though, there isn't a whole lot of arch support, but the way the crocs absorb your steps makes them so great! I have little to no foot pain after 8 hours of standing. Also, the color is beautiful (I got the sky blue).
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2020

Title: Runs Big!
Review: You‚Äôre not the ultimate dad until you own Crocs and/or White New Balance Sneakers.Since my family already thinks my husband is the ultimate dad, this year for Father‚Äôs Day I decided to get him the Ultimate Dad Shoe - Crocs!I purchased his normal shoe size (Men‚Äôs 10), and I had to exchange them twice. Ultimately, he needed a size 8 for them to fit. That would be a Men‚Äôs 8, Women‚Äôs 10
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2020

Title: Perfect fit - but actual color is different than described
Review: I bought the "chocolate" Crocs size 12 for my boyfriend because he desperately needed a new pair lol (I know they're described as women's Crocs in the title but they're really gender neutral). The fit was perfect, he absolutely loved everything about them and really enjoyed the feeling of new Crocs compared to the 10 years old pair he had where there was no texture to them anymore lol. Only thing I think people should know is the color is definitely NOT chocolate, they are more of a slate grey color. I mean honestly I prefer the color they came as rather than a chocolate brown color, but just know they definitely aren't brown. Still perfect though!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 25, 2020

Title: True to size. Good for wide feet.
Review: Obsessed. These are amazing. I have a wide food and high artch, these are amazing. My aunt uses hers as house shoes. I use mine for any water outings. Especially great for want butts like me who are afraid of stepping on anything in the lake or ocean. Haha.Huge fan of the range of color choices!I got a size 11 woman‚Äôs in purple. They are VERY Comfortable. Huge fan!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2019

Title: Red not Red
Review: Well they are crocs. They fit well. Are comfortable as they shod be. Have been buying crocs since they came out years ago. The price is more- but so is everything else ! Will continue to buy the original crocs - they last for ever. Would have given 5 stars is the red was really red.  It is more rose than red. SO if you like the colour rose these are for you....
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2019

Title: Converted croc lover!
Review: I never expected to love crocs or even own a pair. After slipping into my son's beloved crocks to run out to the back yard, I was hooked. I ordered a gray pair and am very pleased with how they fit. Comfortable and functional, especially for fishing and yard work. I've also converted my mom to a croc enthusiast. She was on the fence about getting a pair, even after my dad and I told her how great they were. I surprised her on Mother's Day with a pair of her own. She was very happy with them.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 17, 2020

Title: SO COMFORTABLE-- LOVE these crocs!
Review: I think these things even float! These are hands down one of the most if not the most comfortable shoe I've ever worn. No outgassing from the materials used, thankfully the company seems to be making them in a safe way with good materials (don't stop!). I no longer care if I'm teased, I love wearing crocs. Any time I do, my feet thank me for it. So let's make them hip as we de-stress & dance all day.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 12, 2019

Title: Crocs rock!
Review: Finding shoes that are comfortable for me has always been a total disaster due to my feet condition I was born with. My feet are wide and my Achilles tendons are not as long as they are supposed to be. My room mate suggested these crocs and while I admit I was a bit skeptical, I bought them anyways and they are literally the most comfortable thing I've ever worn. I wear them pretty much 24/7. I love them.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 24, 2020

Title: YEAH YEAH YEAH!
Review: These badbois are what dreams are made of. Like walking in a gardenhose-green cloud all day.Great for kickin' round the yard or garden or simply engage 4WD and take them on rougher terrain.Love them with socks as house slippers, and after a long day of adventuring to soothe yo' barkin' dogs.You won't regret these.If you got sweaty feat... maybe not for you though.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2020

Title: Good original Crocs
Review: These are the old original Crocs they've been selling for many years now. It was about 4-5years ago when they started making some newer Crocs with a newer type of plastic, I've bought a few pairs of those and they've all had problems with shrinking, which eventually causes them to rub and blister your foot in different places, to be expected when you buy shoes that fit, which then proceed to shrink! Don't know why they sell those ones, the material is clearly defective imo. These originals might wear out a little quicker but they're comfortable and don't shrink.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2019

Title: Beware the size
Review: I got three different crocs. I am usually a size 7 but I got an 8 based off of the reviews saying it comes small. I got one for myself in a size 8 and it was roomy which I like. Especially if you plan on wearing socks. I got a size 7 for a relative of mine and when I compared it with my size 8 it was extremely small! So I would recommend getting a size up. Maybe it was defected but I would rather be safe than sorry. /:
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2020

Title: Wife loves them !
Review: I bought the Croc brand because I know they are good quality footwear. The burgundy pair we received look great. My wife says they fit perfect..not to wide..not to long..and the size is correct for the size she wears. It's hard to actually review these. She loves them and says they are very comfortable on her feet. If she wants another pair of a different color we'd order a pair of Croc's again.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2020

Title: Comfy and CUTE
Review: I love these! When I first got them I was concerned because I thought they were too big, but found out crocs are supposed to be bigger on you! What a relief. They are so cute (I got the pink ones) and I've gotten compliments about them many times already. They are so comfortable and easy to slip on really quick. I've been wearing them every day nonstop because I LOVE them. I plan on getting more colors later on. Comfy, and cute! Totally worth it. And my package literally came the very next day after I ordered them. Super quick.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2019

Title: Great all-around comfy shoes!
Review: I originally purchased these for my girlfriend for Christmas. We use Crocs to go kayaking in since they're rubber and clearly don't hold water. The only downside to using these for something like kayaking is that when the surface you're stepping on is slick, don't expect Crocs to have a firm grip - they'll make you slip easily (only downside but not enough to give 4/5 stars). We also wear crocs to go out in the spring time when the yard is just mud. That way, we can just hose the crocs off and our feet off before we go back in the house.I ordered the size shoe she usually wears and it fits her perfect without any issues. We wear these around and they are very comfortable for hours. They may not be the most fashionable shoes, but they sure are comfy.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2017

Title: Perfect!
Review: I bought these because I have a broken leg and I needed shoes that were easy to put on and take off.  These fit the bill!  I bought two pairs:  one for indoors and one for outdoors.  They are comfortable, provide good support, and provide good traction.  I wear them with and without socks.For years, I hated Crocs because I thought they were a fad.  Now I'm a convert.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2020

Title: Amazing for post-foot surgery!!
Review: No joke... I‚Äôm a first time croc buyer here, and they are so awesome!!! I broke my foot 4 months ago and had surgery and a screw put in, and once I was out of the boot I tried FOUR different styles and brands of tennis shoes, and immediately after putting them on I felt pain on the outer edge where I had surgery on my foot. Excruciating pain most of the time... I decided to try these and NO pain at all!!! I never thought I‚Äôd like crocs but I am so grateful for them now. To be able to comfortably walk is so amazing! Buy these if you have pain in your feet!! The only downside is that there aren‚Äôt 1/2 sizes..
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2020

Title: First purchase of crocs, didn‚Äôt disappoint!
Review: Love the color! I was scared to order crics without trying them on first and honestly I am glad I made the choice of buying them! They fit good and are comfy too. My first pair of crocs and I love them! I got my husband a pair in a different style (realtree camo) and he likes them too. He says they are comfy and fit nicely. The little bumps in the shoes freaked me out but it‚Äôs meant for grip when you‚Äôre feet are wet or even sweaty lol. I definitely recommend!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 12, 2020

Title: Classic Clog Croc
Review: A few years ago I purchased a knock off type clog croc for working in the yard.  it lasted many years and I needed to replace it.  I decided to buy the real thing this time.  It didn't disappoint.  So comfortable.  I wear them as slippers because I can go outside without having to change shoes.  Usually I wear a 7 1/2 shoe so I bought size 8 and they are perfect.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2020

Title: Great arch support for such light footwear
Review: I only wear them around the house or yard.  I would never subject them to hardcore walking about town.I like the convenience and the arch support.I love the lightness of the Croc while wearing them, but putting them on hands-free (I'm old) is frustrating - the shoe keeps sliding forward.  I have to find a solid object (wall, stair tread, post, etc.) to stop the shoe from sliding.Trying to 'slip into' them with socks on is double-hard, since the socks snag on the little dimples, which makes the shoe slide forward that much easier.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2019

Title: Crocs Rock!
Review: I absolutely LOVE the Crocs classic.  They are basically all I wear, whether I'm at work, going to a wedding (YES), gardening, at the beach, I mean:  once you go Crocs, you never go back!!!I have a C width foot, which is just a tad wider than what the shoe industry considers "normal" (namely a B), yet really it is right in the middle of the width spectrum.  I love that the Crocs Classics are the perfect width for me.  I love how much cushioning is between the sole of your foot and the sidewalk or whatever you are walking on.  I love that, years ago, they cured my plantar fascitis or whatever it was that caused my feet so much pain for so long--GONE, once I started wearing Crocs Classics (which were then called Crocs Caymens, but I digress--same shoe).  I love how long they last.  They are my favorite shoe on this or any other planet.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2015

Title: These Deserve More Than 5 Stars!
Review: These are the most comfortable shoes you could buy! I read mixed reviews about them and was a little worried about how they would fit considering I stuck to my actual size and didn‚Äôt go up/down a size. I‚Äôm a size 8w and ordered just that and they fit me perfectly!!! I also read how some people received fake ones but the ones I got are the real deal. I compared them to my friends crocs and lucky me, I received the real ones. As soon as I got them I wore them out to the store and the arch support is perfect for me because I have flat feet and wear arch supporters in my sneakers anyway. The fact they have arch support makes them 10/10!  I definitely see myself ordering more and more!! If you‚Äôre thinking about getting these, just do it! You will not regret it I promise you.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2020

Title: These Shrink considerably if left in strong sunlight; buy 1-2 sizes larger.
Review: Mostly I wanted to note to others that if left or worn a lot in the sunlight, THESE WILL SHRINK CONSIDERABLY.I first bought 14's,  but at season's end, they were too small for me to wear.I bought these 16's and at the end of this hot Summer, they are just about right for me.One of my feet is a 15, the other a 14.Takes some time for these to shrink, so you'll have to suffer through some floppiness, or wear thick socks until the shrink to fit.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2018

Title: They're Crocs and silly
Review: We all know Crocs are silly. I bought these sort of on a whim as a joke. But now that I work from home a lot, I wear them every day. Good indoor shoes, good outdoor shoes. And they are very comfortable. I don't wear them out in public, but I have a feeling one day I'll stop caring what people think and just go for it. When they wear out, I'll probably buy some more.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2020

Title: People will make fun of you
Review: Let's be honest, you have to have some kind of sense of humor rocking these shoes. The main thing, these are the most comfortable shoes ever and can I mention safe?! I was hanging at the river and one of my gal pals was really giving me a hard time about wearing crocs, meanwhile she blew out her old navy flip flop and rocked her face on some ground and all I had to say was how sturdy and waterproof these crocs were on my feet as I blew past her for another beer.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 6, 2020

Title: I'd no idea how important it was to have these.
Review: One of my sons had a neat pair of some inexpensive rubbery shoes and I asked him to get me a pair. Dissatisfied with them I bought myself some Crocs instead. Thinking I'd have them by the front door to slip on when I got the mail or took out the trash, which usually mean walking out in the rain, and the Crocs were a decent no slip foot gear. But I'd no idea that I'd suddenly be hit by major emergency surgery and couldn't bend, and my feet swelled up! The Crocs were very important, heck, are still important in getting to my medical appointments during recovery!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2018

Title: Surprisingly Comfortable
Review: My wife has had a pair of crocs for 10 years and I never considered joining her.  I have never liked sandals.  I like flip flips even less.  Crocs looked uncomfortable to me.  I finally gave in because I needed something on my feet that could get wet.  Boy was I surprised at how comfortable these things are.  What looks like hard plastic is unexpected cushion.  Pressure washing, cleaning pool filters, or just taking out the trash is easy and I'm not worried about the mess.  I should have bough a pair of these a long time ago.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 17, 2019

Title: Lightweight, Comfortable, Runs About Half Size Small
Review: I ordered these to use on my deck, filling bird feeders, etc.  They are perfect for this purpose.  Easily washed, and super lightweight.  If you think you will have a decent walking shoe, not so much.  There is just about no support whatsoever, but I didn't expect it.  I normally wear a 7 to a 7 and a half in women's, and I guess right in ordering an 8.  These are made in China, and so run smaller.  Order carefully!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2020

Title: Buy SMALLER than usual size
Review: Love crocks!  Everyone in my whole family wears them but you must buy a smaller size.  If you are a 1/2 size then order a size down for sure.  My boyfriend is size 10 1/2 and we got him a 9.  I am a 6 1/2 and a 6 works for me.  If you are ordering on prime then perhaps get 2 sizes and return one of them.  Other than the size being large, these are great shoes for lounging.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2020

Title: Comfort Over Style!
Review: I know this fad is probably already over, but I just decided to finally buy a pair in anticipation of a cruise. I'm not crazy about the texture that you put your feet on (a little spiky), but I got used to it. I am picky about my footwear, and there are few things I can wear without the soles of my feet hurting. These things are SO comfortable! They are super lightweight and seriously the only footwear I needed for the entire week on the cruise. I wore them in the room, walking around the ship, walking around ports, to the beach, to the pool, and even to dinner. The last is maybe not recommended, but you can definitely get away with it. :) I even tried to continue wearing them once I got back to the Minnesota snow (although that did not work out so well). I like the black color because they blend in a little bit more than the brighter colors. They do get crease marks on the top of them, but there's not really a way to prevent that. You might lose a few style points, but they are so comfortable you will not even care!

Title: CROCS !!! Is the hype true ?!?!

Title: Better Than Expected
Review: I was hesitant to buy these for a couple of reasons.  First, they're...you know--rubber? Plastic? Something like that...  Second, they're...you know--not masculine? Kind of sissified? Finally, the picture makes them look flimsy. So okay. Yes--they are some kind of man-made rubber/plastic/neoprene/something, but that makes them waterproof meaning you can leave them out on the deck after you've been working in the yard and you don't have to worry about them getting soggy and ruined. No--they're not the most masculine shoes I've ever seen, so you have to be pretty confident in your manhood if you wear them out on the town but I got them for yard work which is a fairly macho enterprise. And no, they're not as flimsy as the pictures look. I don't know how long that heel-strap thing will last, but I don't use it half the time anyway and for some reason, your feet don't slip out of the shoes without it, so if it does break--Super Glue and duct tape. THEN they'll look masculine!

Title: The website is nice and there are all kinds of options
Review: I used to have heel pain --  plantar fascia.  I stretched a couple times a day and that mostly kept the pain at bay.  Then a friend suggested crocs.  Pain gone.  It has been 10 years since I have worn anything else -- or stretched.  I used to these shoes direct from Crocs.  The website is nice and there are all kinds of options.  Almost all of the styles that I tried were narrower.  My 'real shoe' size is 11 EEE.  Crocs Mens 12 work in this style.  If they feel a little tight at first, keep wearing them.  They stretch and, like fine leather shoes, mold to the feet.  Amazon Prime means free shipping, so I can buy one pair at a time without paying shipping and for the same price as the Crocs website or the local box store.And if you take a worn out pair and slice them up, they make fine sanding blocks.

Let me tell you: I can walk around for hours wearing these shoes, and I don't feel any discomfort. Even after a 9-hour shift of standing and walking around at work, I can put these on, and my feet already feel better. Do yourself a favor and buy yourself a pair. I typically wear a 13, or sometimes a 12 1/2 of a shoe manufacturer even makes it, but in these I wear a 12. If your feet sweat, you might find they sweat more in these. However, my feet seem to be getting use to them and seem to be sweating less the more that I wear them. They are a great product, designed well, and seem robust enough to last for years. I would definitely recommend.

Title: Worked well on military deployment. Durable and comfortable
Review: I wore these at least once a day for 9 months on my last military deployment. I highly recommend them if you need "shower shoes." I wore these in the shower, in my berthing, and even walking through the Kuwaiti desert to get to the bathroom. They've been folded, smushed, and packed multiple times in my pack and they don't seem to show any signs of breaking. One thing a lot of people might not realize is that they're thicker than regular flip flops and will protect your feet from bacteria better. I seriously think everyone should use these instead of those cheap, black $1 flip flops you get at the PX. I wear a size 11 in most footwear, but these were maybe a half size too big. I didn't really mind this because they were easy to slip on and off.

Title: Crocs for a win
Review: I spend 40 hours a week on my feet on concrete floors. And I walk a lot. I have a very difficult time finding shoes that I don't ache to take off before a couple hours have past. I have wide feet, tall feet, and have a heel lift I wear in my left shoe (which creates its own shoe criteria). I need slip resistant ventilated shoes. These classic crocs fit the bill. I will always be wearing these with socks. They are wide enough for my feet, tall enough for my instep (even with the heel lift) and are quite comfortable to wear all shift. These are not fashion shoes and I don't expect them to be that, but for all the rest of the times, these will be the shoes I wear. My only caution would be that these shoes have little cushion. The rubber does have some give but it is not the same as a well padded shoe. For me this is acceptable because they don't hurt my feet to wear. Other's may find that to be a turn off.

Title: Finally a perfect work shoe!

She wears them for style and are easy to slide on and they fit comfortably. She wears them out a lot and around the house. Amazon has them for a great price. Title: really comfortable but can be sweaty and get pebbles
Review: i ordered several crocs (diff styles) - all clogs1- sizes are inconsistent from color to color and style to style2- left in the heat they will shrink and distort - that being said i needed to return 1 pair as the shoe was severely deformed- probably in the shipping3- therefore - make sure return shipping is free4- i do find most of the crog clogs to be INCREDIBLY comfortable5- they make your feet sweat  - the kinds without holes are worse - BUT they are easily washable6- front holes suck - pebbles often end up in the shoe7- once the sole wears down  they are INCREDIBLY slippery - anywhere a parking lot is painted is particularly dangerous8- i think they make the best slippers ever as the support is awesome9 - i love the fact they weigh almost nothing10 - i also got the styles without holes for colder and wetter weather11 - dont leave in the sun or heat they will shrink - some people use this to get a better fit
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2016

Title: Can't go wrong with Crocs!

I have feet that are difficult to fit and need to wear something around the house that has a bit of arch support.  Crocs are the only footwear that fits the bill.  The toe box is ample, the width is just right, the length fits perfectly.  In "normal" shoes, I wear a size 10 XXW and these are perfect!

Title: Absolutely amazing
Review: The best thing on this earth for anyone‚Äôs feet!! Bought a pair for myself and my boyfriend. He absolutely hate the style, and so do I. But I cannot deny how freaking comfortable they are!!! I have trouble finding good comfortable sneakers because I have semi wide feet. But these are absolutely amazing and comfy. Great for the entire family!! Also the material is so nice, it will not allow your foot to slide out of the shoes at all. And cleaning then is super easy. No complaints.

Title: I'm sorry I waited so long!
Review: I've been aware of these since they came on the market but have never been motivated to try a pair, what a mistake.They are the do-all shoe. They are shower shoes, gardening shoes, mow the lawn shoes, kick around the house shoes. If they get dirty just hose 'em off and you're good to go again. They have great grippers on the bottom and don't slip on a wet patio like flip-flops do. Why oh why did I wait so long, better late than never!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2020

Title: Convienent shoes
Review: The ideal user for this product is any person boy or girl who is looking for a comfortable, durable, and water resistant shoe. These shoes are perfect slide on shoes for any quick, pick up situation. Whether that be running errands, taking the dog out, or anything else. These shoes are made for all ages, come in a variety of colors and are made for both sexes.These shoes are very durable and water resistant. I bought a pair of white ones in august of 2017, and they still look brand new (and I wear them way too often.) They clean up very easily and are perfect if the ground outside is wet or muddy. They have holes along the side and on the top which allows your feet to breathe. An amazing quality about these shoes is that they are wide enough so you have enough space in the shoe to wear a sock!These shoes have many positive characteristics about them. I would say the most positive aspect of them is that they are very convenient, and can be worn in any situation. But other positive aspects of these shoes are that they are comfortable, breathable, easy to clean, water resistant, come in all colors, and the list is endless!Most people are hesitant in purchasing these shoes because of the way they look, but since 2016 crocs have become popular again. If a shoe like these are this comfy no one should care about what they look like! I have had a very positive experience with my crocs and I would recommend any to purchase these, because they are worth the money. I am all about convenience and these shoes are my go to whenever I‚Äôm about to run out and need to slide something on quick.These shoes are made for everyone and not only are they convenient for an adult to wear, they are perfect shoes for children to wear as well. They can get them dirty and run around outside and the can be cleaned off fast, while not being ruined. They also sell gibbets for these shoes, making them personable and a fun attraction for children.Overall I would give these shoes overall a very positive review because I have gotten a lot of use out of mine. They are worth every penny and a great investment. They last a long time and are great shoes to own.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2018

Title: Crocs are awesome!
Review: I purchased a pair of these for my mother and mother-in-law. They both have never owned crocs before and ABSOLUTELY loved them!! I purchased the teal and the coral and both colors are BEAUTIFUL.  Crocs in themselves are incredibly comfortable, easy to clean, and fit well.

Title: Most comfortable shoe

Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2020

Title: The best house shoes ever made
Review: This is my third pair of Crocs clogs. I personally think they're ugly and I can't figure out how they ever became fashionable but so it goes. The thing is, I have fallen arches (pes planus) and I my feet kill (I used the word "kill" to describe pain) me sometimes! These are far and away the most comfortable things I can put on my feet. They're light as air and they kind of form-fit to my arches. It's like getting a mini-massage just by walking around. I wear them whenever I'm lounging around the house or doing chores but I don't wear them outside at all. Something else to note: They don't stink. At least not for a long time. I think that's pretty remarkable. When they do start to smell, I couldn't really figure out an effective way to clean them so I just threw them away and bought new ones (they also lose their form a little after a year or so). I figure I can afford a pair every year or so so that I can have happier feet.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 7, 2013

Title: New Convert to Crocs <3
Review: I have resisted these shoes for years! Finally tired of ruining my regular shoes by wearing them in the garden or accidentally stepping in something I should have picked up earlier, I have finally found a shoe that I can wear and wash--and is TRULY COMFORTABLE AND LIGHT. You don't really think about how light shoes are until you put Crocs on. In fact, I liked them so much I bought a second pair to wear out and about. I never thought it would happen but I am truly a Crocs lover now!To be fair, I don't love the way they look, and my feet sometimes get cold so I bought socks. (Yes, I went there!) But I have gotten to a point in my life that function beats form and I am the happier for it.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 18, 2015

Title: Good buy!

It has been 6 months now since we've purchased them and they are still holding up well. They are great quality and definitely originals. They also fit true to size and look exactly as seen in the photo.NB. My husband wears size nine in all regular shoes, so we ordered size 9 & it fit well.

Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2020

Title: Admirably covers my husband's big feet
Review: Crocs are ugly. We all know it. Nobody buys crocs to be a fashion icon (I hope). This aside, they're a good utilitarian shoe. My husband has to wear close-toed shoes to his work, and tennis shoes were killing his feet (they're big and not made to fit inside confining shoes ha).He has to wear socks with them (really highlighting his stellar sense of fashion) because apparently the holes on top pull the hair out of the top of his feet. Title: Looks Like Yuck,  Feels Great
Review: I usually wear a size 10D, and ordered these in size 10D.  If I wore these with socks, they'd be a perfect fit.  In bare feet, they're just a little loose (surprise surprise).  I wish they'd been available in my size in another color.  My only option was Khaki, which looks like rice-fed doggy poop.  But I don't wear 'em to look at them.  I wear them because they feel great.  And for the price (under $20, delivered by amazon Prime, go amazon!) I can't complain.  They're great clomp around clogs, keep your feet warm wet or dry, kick out irritants through the many open holes, and are very comfortable on my feet.  I have yet to use the heel strap or take them for a significant walk, but that's not why I bought them.  I wanted super easy on and off, comfortable enough to run errands in, and secure enough on my feet that I didn't have to think about where I put my feet when walking in them.  They fit the bill quite nicely, thank you very much.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2013

Title: As always crocs are way too expensive!

I didn‚Äôt think I‚Äôd like the straps but you can fold them up on top of the shoe if you want to. I do use the straps when I‚Äôm driving. As always crocs are way too expensive!

Title: I love my crocs!!

Highly recommend for people looking for easy-on, easy-off shoes that are very comfy.

Title: I‚Äôve been wearing Crocs for years!! They‚Äôre Great!!! üòÑüòÑ

Title: FIFTH PAIR...

Crocs have essentially become my go-to house slipper and, used with a pair of plush socks, provide daylong comfort.  The arch support is superb and when I'm at the workbench, standing on a bare, concrete floor, my feet are happy!Enough gushing.  If you've worn them, you know exactly what I'm talking about!

Title: and always like them. However
Review: I got this particular pair for my son, and he likes to wear it. He is size 6.5 or 7, and he wears the shoes with the strap up, so they fit him very well. He outgrown several pairs of crocs over the years, and always like them.However, if you wanted to wear the strap behind your heel as pictured, buy a size up - the strap is shorter then needed, I wear Woman's size 9 so should fit in this shoes well, but with the strap down, my toes painfully push into the front of the shoe, and I cannot wear them. The problem is consistent - I have several years old pair of the same crocs in another color, and it is the same - fine with the strap up, but I cannot wear it with strap down.The shoes are very lightweight.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2014

Title: Husband is very pleased!
Review: These were for my husband, and he is very happy!  Ordered size 11, one size up from his normal 10, because he wanted to wear them with thick socks for the winter in our chilly house.  They arrived quickly and are exactly what he wanted!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2020

Title: Very comfortable
Review: Comfortable shoes.  You can do a lot of walking or standing and your feet still feel great.  Of course this is the first time I ever bought Crocs so I really can't compare these to other Crocs.  The only thing is the heel strap could be tighter.  Other than that great shoe.  I have wide feet and the width is perfect.Would recommend.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2019

Title: Perfect fit.
Review: Bought for my 10 year old who usually wears a size 5 in men's, but I got him a size 6 because he is still growing and im glad I did cause as you see in picture he has a little room to grow in them. He likes them and they were a great price. Thank you.

Title: I am a croc lover now.
Review: I have been wanting these for so long! They are all that I have been talking about for months and I finally got them! They are way more comfortable than I expected. I don't even know how to explain it. They're just cool as heck. They're functional and in my opinion cute as heck. I have been wearing then nonstop showing them off since they arrived. I definitely will be purchasing more!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2020

Title: Recommended by my podiatrist
Review: I recently visited my podiatrist because of heel pain. Turns out I have Achilles Tendonitis.  The good news, it's fixable; I can recover from this.  Surprisingly, he mentioned that Crocs are great for this ailment as they provide firm, consistent support, much better than the Dr Scholl's sandals I bought last year.  So, I bought two pair (just to be sure I have enough!).  Now, back to the heel stretching exercises the doc taught me...
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2019

Title: Crocs give me life
Review: This was my second pair of crocs after I hadn't worn my first pair in a number of years. I am loving the new color choices and am just as obsessed this time around as the first. They're my house shoe! I regularly wear them around the house and put them on to take the dogs out, take the trash out, sweep the sidewalk - you know, quick little chores where you just want a nice slip-on shoe. I do also occasionally go out in public with them, like to the grocery store or to grab a quick bite to eat. My friends hate them but they're coming into fashion now and it's just about dang time.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2019

Title: Crocmania
Review: A person can never have too many crocs. Outdoor crocs, indoor crocs, slipper crocs, pool crocs, dog walking crocs, crocs for your dad, crocs for your cat, crocs for your neighbor with questionable morals.I've bought six pairs now. I need more.

Title: Best shoes EVER
Review: These are the best shoes you have ever put on.  They are great for every day us.  Perfect for water actives and travel.  They are endorsed by World's Strongest Man Eddie Hall.  Let the Haters Hate! If you ani't CROCING your NOT ROCKING.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2020

Title: Seem to work
Review: I never bought Crocs before. These seem to work OK, so far. My only criticism is I wish they would come in half sizes. I originally bought size 11 which was too tight. I then bought size 12 which was a little too loose but more comfortable than the 11's. An 11 1/2 would probably be just right but that does not seem to be an option.

Review: For the most part the Crocs are very comfortable and durable. My only issue with them is when I take long walks (2+ miles) and the balls of my feet started to hurt (I travel this route frequently and my feet are fine in my other shoes). I'm not sure if its the grooves on the insole or something else causing the problem.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2019

Title: One size too large...
Review: Bought a pair in 2017 as size 12, bought a pair in mid 2020, not run a size too large. My size now is 11 Men‚Äôs, and the old pair are 12. My old ones say made in Mexico, the 2020 pair is made in China. Be aware your normal size may run too big on these new ones.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2020

Title: great garden shoes
Review: My husband picked up gardening and bought a pair of these for the kid to help him. I then decided to get myself a pair too. We all have pretty wide feet and these are incredibly comfortable. Somehow they don't pinch or slip. Also with the summer heat - the design really helps keep your feet cool and being non-porous - are great for doing things where your feet may get wet or muddy (like gardening).
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2020

Title: I live for Crocs

I do make sure I check the tread because it does wear down and can be an issue on slippery surfaces.  I have also gotten Crocs for my sister who has Parkinson Disease and it has increased the surface area of her step to make walking easier.  I will definitely continue to order Crocs as needed.

Title: Kinda disappointed

This is my first time buying a pair of crocs on amazon and the shoes fit me well but I noticed that one size is wider than the other pair and that disappointed me a lot! Not sure if that‚Äôs how crocs are supposed to be made but please AMAZON, check on the shoes carefully! And to answer why I didn‚Äôt return it was because I wore it the first day it was delivered to me and didn‚Äôt really paid much attention to it till the next day and it was kinda dirty already. I also just ordered another pair after realizing the other pair was wider than the other so I hope it‚Äôs not the same problem as my first one.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 24, 2020

Title: Very Comfortable
Review: I have huge and wide size 13 feet and these fit perfectly. Plus they have a good arch support. And I can choose slip on in the house or use the back strap for driving. They are washable too, which means they are not stinky and don't get ruined right away. I am glad to have made this purchase.
