Title: Durable and comfortable LOVE THESE THINGS
Review: I've had these crocs for 2 years now and I still wear them around when running errands etc.  it may not be the most glamorous thing but it sure is comfortable.  These crocs are so durable.  If I had a pair of regular flip flops, I would be on at least my 5th or 6th pair. This crocs have paid for themselves many times over.  I've worn them walking over rocks, stones, in showers, in the house, to the store, camping EVERYTHING.  I loved these things so much I bought a pair for my husband in the REALTREE camouflage and he now likes his. (Plus his old flip flops where there is material really starts to stink when he's walking around so crocs don't smell) Hint hint ladies, buy these for your husbands as well! :)

Title: Super Comfy
Review: I resisted Crocs for the longest. But I've pretty much worn them 24/7 throughout this quarantine..now they're all I want to wear! They're just so darn functional!

Title: Highly recommend!
Review: Bought these to be supportive house shoes as the majority of my home is hard/tile floors and mylegs get achy! Love how supportive they are and my legs and hips do not hurt after being in my feet a lot. Highly recommended!

Title: THE footwear for painfully wide feet

Wearing there the last three weeks I have increased my activity, lowered my pain and foot cramps, and felt my toes spread to their natural width and length.  I also have high arches, and tend to develop bone spurs on the top of the midfoot (Danskos HURT!), but my feet still feel great in these crocs.  Only the classics fit this well.  Buying 3 more.

Title: Most comfortable shoes ever!
Review: This was my boyfriends first pair and he absolutely loves them. It‚Äôs all he‚Äôs been wearing since they arrived! We will definitely be ordering another pair for him soon and I‚Äôll be ordering a pair for myself as well. So comfortable, easy on the knees and very versatile.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 16, 2020

Title: aaaahhhh, comfortable
Review: These are the only shoes I can wear, my feet are ruined from 50 years of bartending, waitressing and retail work on my feet up to 60 hours a week.  I wear them with socks and they are more comfortable than my slippers used to be.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2020

Title: Most comfortable shoes I have ever owned.
Review: I have been a fan of Crocs for a very long time. While they are not the most attractive shoe ever, you just can't beat the comfort. I have some issues with foot pain, and my Crocs are the only shoe I have found that completely alleviate the pain. I have tried quite a few of the styles over the years, but this was the first time I have tried the clogs. They are a little snug around the tops of my feet because of my extremely high arches, but I got used to it pretty fast. I wear these almost constantly and i am very happy with them.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2016

Title: Perfect fit on my big 15 D feet!
Review: Don't know where they are made but they are made properly as a size 15 D.  I had to return a set of sandals marketed from Great Britain that were way too narrow.  It is a pleasure to get shoes that were made to the proper size, as per the way they are labeled.  These shoes are very comfortable and I am very pleased.  I had a hard time finding Crocs in my size.  They aren't sold in the regular shoe stores and many online shoe stores have a very limited selection of 15 D shoes, as well.  Now if they will just be strong and hold up for a while.  I'll update if they self destruct to early in life.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2016

Title: Crocs naysayers are so silly.  Crocs are awesome.
Review: You don't wear Crocs for a fashion statement.  Well, maybe in some places, but not most places.  They're the flip-flops of the regular shoe community.  So easy to slip on.  So easy to wash off.  When my kids were little, they were "big kid" shoes they could put on themselves.  Now all of my big kids have a pair right outside the backdoor.  Slip them on to do everything year round (we live in Arizona.)  So far nobody has ever accidentally stepped in dog poo, but it could happen and if it did - easily washable.  They wore these shoes at at sleepaway camp for everything from showers to fishing to hiking.  They're durable.  Over the last 6+ years we've owned MANY pairs of Crocs brand originals and think they're all fantastic.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2014

Title: Simply the best
Review: Who doesn‚Äôt love some crocadillies?  They‚Äôre the comfiest around.  I love the versatility.  You can likely run a marathon or wrestle a gator in these lady killers.  You‚Äôre liable to find some night time company if you rock the crocs.

Title: Best comfortable fitting shoe

Title: Great Fit & Design! Very Satisfied!
Review: I am so happy to find a cute pair of Crocs that will go with my jeans and any top I might wear with them. What I am most excited about, is these crocs fit my feet very well. In the last year or two I've had problems with the new sizing for Crocs (purchased directly) and have had to return or giveaway or not wear four pairs. So I took a chance on ordering  this pair  and I was thrilled that they fit and they look really cute. I normally wear a size woman's nine which is what I ordered.  I am so pleased that I am going to order another pair just like them so I expect to be set for a number of years! One additional note, I have diabetic nerve damage and Crocs are the most comfortable shoes for my feet, in addition they keep my feet protected and provide additional stability for walking.  I couldn't be more pleased to have found this new design and one that fits so perfectly.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2016

Title: Comfortable

Title: Love these super comfortable CROCS.üëç
Review: My daughter & grandajghters have worn these for "years", but I was reluctant because of the ribbing on the inside and I thought they were plastic-----WELL, let me say I was so wrong. Title: Extremely comfortable for hammertoe
Review: I have hammertoe on my right foot and have difficulty finding a comfortable pair of closed toe shoes. I stand on my feet for long hours as well so even wider toebox shoes chafe my toe and cause a lot of pain. To make it easy on myself I just stuck with one pair of walking shoes and never tried another one. Through the recommendation of a friend who has multiple foot issues I decided to give crocs a try.  I couldnt be more glad that I bought these shoes. The size is perfect and i wear them and work in my studio for hours standing without ever being reminded of my pain. These shoes are extremely comfortable and I wear them all the time.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2019

Title: Great product!
Review: My son has worn the same pair of Crocs forever. He wanted another pair because of how easy they are to get on and with baseball he needs something to wear to the field before putting on his spikes. These work so well and he has been super happy since getting his new pair!

Title: Most comfortable Croc!  There is a BIG difference!

If the soles lasted longer, I would give them 10 stars!

I have also discovered that they are very comfortable on wood floors.  I have only worn them inside partly because because it's winter but really because they are kind of ugly. Think I'll keep them as "inside shoes".

Title: Best thing since sliced bread!
Review: I love my crocs! I wear them everywhere on dry days and even in the shower. I bought one pair in yellow and they were so comfortable I bought another in brown to wear out. The brown ones were different sizing than the yellow ones since the yellow beach ones were size 8-9 and the brown ones size Women's 8M. Both fit fine but the brown ones fit best with thin socks if I wear socks.I have diabetes and liver cirrhosis, both of which cause problems with legs and feet, so I need shoes that are very comfortable and not too tight. Crocs really are perfect. I thought the little bumps in the bottom inside would bother me in bare feet but they don't. They are roomy enough that if my feet swell a bit they still fit. They sort of stick to the soles of my feet (even with socks) so there's no rubbing against my sensitive skin.They are also great in the shower. I don't have to worry about slipping, especially when I use hair conditioner or body wash that is slippery, and I can wash my crocs at the same time I wash me. Fantastic!

Title: For Ease & Comfort
Review: It's about the ease of donning & doffing and general comfort. It's not about any aesthetic appeal, which it is perhaps not particularly high on. I found my first pair (of the original Crocs--new in box) while dumpster diving several years ago. I brought them home to show my wife just how absurd a pair of shoes can look. For a lark, I tried them on and--what do you know? Those goofy-looking shoes were extremely comfortable! I have worn them near daily ever since. Interestingly, after they started getting popular and appearing on lots of other people's feet, they stopped looking quite so goofy.As much as I like them, they are problematic for some occasions. Little rocks and dirt sometimes get in through the holes; when the soles get worn smooth from use they are extremely slippery on wet sidewalks; goathead stickers and glass can easily pierce through the soft sole and into your previously happy foot; Bare feet can sweat in the summer and slide around a bit; I wear them so much that I get tan spots through the holes, leaving my feet polka-dotted when I remove my shoes.Overall though, for the reasons of ease and comfort, I love 'em.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2013

Title: These are so comfortable. I said that they do not have good ...
Review: These are so comfortable.  I said that they do not have good arch support, but I have an extremely high arch and I don't feel it if it's there.  The shoes are contured and someone with a lesser arch may feel the support.  I can wear them all day w/ or w/out socks.  They are also extremely light-weight and that is a bonus!  I have now purchased a pair for my husband which he loves and wears all day too.  I have also purchased two more as gifts... want to share the comfort!  I definitely recommend and they do not run in 1/2 sized... I am at least an 8.5 and usually a 9 and the 8 fits me perfectly.  Hope this helps.

Title: He's a good man and helped me during a time of distress ...
Review: These shoes are made from some strange space age material unknown to mankind before this.  Despite hiking miles upon miles through the Himalayan mountains of Afghanistan for years on end, there is so far no signs of wear.  The tactical nature of the color scheme of this pair in particular will without a doubt protect my feet from being discovered by ISIS-K or the Taliban during my trek through the Afghan arid mountains and beyond. I bought this second pair not to replace my current Crocs but to bless some random Sherpa who needs a solid shoe whom I came across during my travels. Color doesn't matter as much to me, as how my feet feel at the end of the day.However, I do have a pair that is higher end and I use sometimes when going out. Easy to slip in and out of, nice looking, and continued comfort during an evening out. .Been wearing crocs for over 5 years, almost every day.

And surprisingly, I've not had any back issues or a flare in my plantar fasciitis, so mabye the arch support is sufficient enough after all. I'm actually considering ordering a pair of the wooly style for the winter!

Title: Fit my wide feet and were very comfortable.
Review: I had always thought Crocs were rather unattractive shoes and didn't understand how and why people would wear them. Then I retired, bought a power washer, and badly needed some outdoor shoes that could handle the water and still give me the traction to push the mower. (I did NOT want to get my nice athletic shoes all wet and green from the grass.) A shoe store associate directed me to the Croc. I knew the Croc was a wider shoe and only came in whole sizes. So I ordered an 8 even though I wear an 8.5. This shoe fit my wide feet perfectly and was very comfortable. I love, love, love that I don't have to worry about getting dirt, water, soap, grass stains, etc. on these shoes because I can just wash them off with the hose. In the meantime, my athletic shoes stay in pristine condition. THEN, I started wearing the Crocs around the house while cleaning and running up and down the stairs doing laundry. I am even considering wearing them when I run to the grocery store or gym!! Another bonus is that these shoes come in a variety of attractive colors,

Title: Not just for Hippie's
Review: OK. I'm 61 years old and thought to myself, I'll never wear a pair of those goofy looking shoes. Looks like something an old Hippie would wear. But after seeing so many people over the years wearing them, and not hippies, mind you, I thought, maybe there's something to these things, so I bought a pair. The classics in khaki.Well it seems you can teach an old dog new tricks. I wear them everywhere. These are the most comfortable shoes I believe I've ever owned. So easy to slip on and kick off. And they stay on when your walking.Now I have this sudden urge to go listen to my "The Momma's and Pappa's" LP's.

Slightly big, but not too big where my foot is sliding around, not tight at all. I wear them all day, and I want another pair just to change up the color.

I wear 8 1/2 wide in standard women's shoes, and 8W, 6M in crocs was always perfect for me before. Now I think I would order a size up next time, even on what Croc bills as a "roomy" fit. Apart from fit they are the crocs we know and love (or hate as the case seems to be), nice bouncy feel, easy to clean, durable and perfect for everything but ballroom dancing.

Title: Fun story: took the Crocs to a sandal maker ...
Review: Went through Europe and the Holy Land on a pair of these.  Only problems experienced were losing the plastic "rivet" the backstrap pivots on and eventually the bottoms become slick and provide no stopping on slick surfaces. Fun story: took the Crocs to a sandal maker inside the Old City of Jerusalem. He studied the broken Croc, surveyed his available repair materials then using a metal rivet provided the needed repair.  He guaranteed another 1,000 miles.  Almost got it,too!Shalomrhp

Title: Im in LOVE!!

Your browser does not support HTML5 video.

Title: Standard Wear For Sea Kayak Trips--And More!

Title: I have a great amount of difficulty finding comfortable shoes being one of ...

I am actually not sure about the arch support, but I also can't claim there isn't any, but since there was no option to be non-committal, I opted for the yes.  I do have a brace to wear on that leg with sneakers, but it becomes uncomfortable after a few hours and the clogs are light weight enough for me to use as an alternative both for several hours but also as a quick way to slip on to go outside to get the mail etc as I am mostly barefooted while at home.

Title: I'm very pleased with these Crocs

And the support is terrific‚Äîthe first time I wore them I took a 2.5 mile walk and they were extremely comfortable. They run a little large. I usually wear a men's 10.5, but they don't have half sizes, so I got 10s. They fit great, and if anything might be a bit large. Title: You made me love you. I didn't want to do it. I REALLY didn't want to do it!
Review: Okay, so, let me get this review started off by saying I hate the way the original crocs look. I know, I know, so do a lot of people, but I really hate the way they look. I have always had large feet for a woman (10/10.5), so I really don‚Äôt like shoes that emphasize the fact that I am walking around with feet that could double as water skis at a moment‚Äôs notice.  As many of you have observed, these shoes are not very good at minimizing the appearance of the size of feet they are on.Okay, so now that I have my fussing out of the way, I love my crocs. To the point where if my house was on fire and I could save one pair of shoes, I would save my crocs.I was first introduced to crocs when I was 20 after I developed an almost crippling case of plantar fasciitis due to working a retail job where I wore heels on hard tiled floor for 10+ hours, 5-6 days a week. I could barely walk without being in excruciating pain. Not fun. I went to see a podiatrist who didn‚Äôt do any of the useful things most would have done like offering the night splints or anything like that. He said that I could do a series of injections in my feet, which sounded oh-so appealing, or I could do some stretches, stay off my feet as much as possible, and try wearing crocs whenever I could. I took option b.  I started wearing my crocs from the moment that I got up, until I had to go to work, where I now had a doctor‚Äôs note saying that I had to have comfortable, flat shoes.  I didn‚Äôt wear the crocs to work, that would have been pushing it, but I did wear the most comfortable shoes I could without making my department manager‚Äôs eye twitch when she looked at them. Then, as soon as I got home, I would take them off, and put my crocs back on. The pain lessened almost immediately, and while it was a combination of keeping off my feet, the stretches, and the crocs, the shoes were definitely the most important factor. They helped so much that I wore them outside of the house while running errands. Within a month, the pain had gone from an all-day, all-consuming factor, to something bothered me for only one hour after waking. After two months, I didn‚Äôt even need to wear them anymore, so I stopped.Fast-forward five and a half years and I am pregnant with my first child and the crocs came out yet again. They were my best friends during the second and third trimester and I haven‚Äôt put them up since. For some reason, probably partially due to the way I sleep, which allows my muscles in my calves and ankles to tense up really well, I have had a mild problem ever since having my daughter. It isn‚Äôt debilitating like the first time, it only hurts for about 10 minutes when I first get up in the morning and I am stretching my muscles out, but I wear my crocs at all times when I am in the house.  My husband, whom I met after my first experience with crocs teased me about them quite a lot. He is European and thinks that crocs are some bizarre American fashion statement and had an excellent time laughing at them. But he also has a job where he is on his feet all day, and a month ago he started showing symptoms of plantar fasciitis. I gave him my crocs to wear around the house, remember, I have giant feet, and they went up a size due to my pregnancy to boot (11) , and he has wears a 10.5 in men‚Äôs shoes, so while mine were a little tight, they were comfortable enough. He stopped giving me any grief after he spent a few days clomping around the house in my bright purple crocs. After I peeled myself off the floor after a very satisfying guffaw I got him to admit that they were really helping and that he didn‚Äôt want to walk around without them anymore. Victory is mine! So, because I wanted me crocs back, guess what he got for Christmas? A lovely pair of plain, black crocs all his own.Now, I‚Äôm not a doctor or nurse of any kind, but I can tell that these have really helped my husband and I ease the pain from, and in my earlier case eliminate, a painful condition. Are they pretty? No. Have they worked for us? Yes.I have a pair of size Women's 11 crocs right now and they are perfect for walking around the house, but they are a bit loose, I wouldn't want to try to sprint in them. I have wide feet, and they are perfectly roomy, not tight at all.I bought my husband a Men's size 10, he usually wears a 10.5, and they are a little roomy for him as well, but not to the point where it is an issue. So, judging from my experience, these run a little large and wider than average.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2016

Title: Roomy but comfortable

Previous non-Croc branded clogs we've owned shrank over time, especially when exposed to a lot of sun so it is possible that Croc brands do the same and account for the generous sizing. Overall, the build quality is quite good and these Crocs are comfortable.

Title: I don't care how many times i've been told how ugly these are. They are comfy!
Review: The first pair I had were a knock off brand and I got these hoping they would last longer. It's been at least a year and they have. I mainly wear these around the house and the patio. I have bad knees and the cushion in these really help. They are really light weight also. Barely seems like you are wearing anything. I like wearing them while I'm cooking (careful of hot liquid, won't protect from burns) or doing dishes. Also good when you have to be on your feet a long time cleaning and vacuuming. Not good on hot days. Wear with socks if you plan to wear them all day. The grip on the sole is much better than the off brand ones. Still won't wear them on wet ground after slipping badly with my old ones. I do use them as pool shoes though. Buy them a little bigger than you would think because if they are too tight and you wear them without socks you can get blisters easily. My friends kid wears these all the time and he gets blisters because he runs in them. The off brand ones I originally bought i told myself they were for gardening. After slipping a few too many times and being freaked out by bugs crawling in the little holes and I don't use them for that anymore. I have been told many times how ugly these are and i tell the people to try mine on and see how comfy they are. They agree and then say not to wear them in public ha ha.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2014

Title: Good for Short Walks (dogs/chores)

They fit as expected b/c the description does say they run a little large.  I normally wear a 6.5 so I purchased the Women's 6 US.  You have to get used to the cushioning/padding inside.  They're textured with little plastic nubs that massage your soles as you walk. B/c I don't wear socks, when I take them off and walk on the carpet, there's a strange sensation on the soles of my feet. Not really a complaint, but I can see why it might not be ideal for all-day wear.

Title: Most fashionable? Not really. Comfortable, practical, and durable? Definitely.

Obviously you feet will get cold on a cold day, but it's refreshing. I would buy it again, but it's unlikely that'll i'll have to buy another because the Crocs feel solidly built and durable.Note that the shoe is typically larger that average shoe sizes, but frankly it's not a big deal. Title: Durable, comfortable, all-weather

I also use them for boating on a pontoon boat and for general, quick around-town use.  These clogs fit the bill perfectly.  They are durable, don't get dirty easily, are very easy to clean, and provide the foot with protection without stifling the foot.  I'm very satisfied with this product.  One caveat only - they wear a bit small in size for me, so I had to order a half-size larger than shoe size.  I'm a 10 1/2 in shoe size, and a size-11 croc fit perfectly.

Title: Crocs are a good fit and quality product
Review: Shipment arrived and one of the straps was not attached correctly. Title: If you already own crocs, mind the shoe size

As in: her lady size 9 fit my lady size 10 foot.  But when my new crocs arrived in the mail they were too small.  Should've ordered at 10. Which is my foot size.  Let this be a cautionary tale for you, weary traveler: Buy the shoe size you are, not the half-forgotten-dream of a shoe size your girlfriend wears.

Title: Amazing Relaxing Shoes For Hiking and Camping!
Review:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.


  ¬†I never though about getting crocs until a good friend, who hikes days at a time in Yosemite every year takes crocs with him strapped to his trekking backpack. When I went with him this year I soon realized how awesome the crocs where. Whenever we camped or stopped by a river he would switch out his shoes and socks and slip on the crocs and off he went into the stream, river, or lake with no worries of stepping on rough rocks, sticks or whatever was underneath or rocks and boulders that are above the water. I didn't have any crocs at the time so I had to walk with my bare feet if I wanted to go in. They also made great camping shoes when setting up camp and just relaxing. Needless to say I was convinced and bought some for myself and my wife. We used them on a recent overnight hiking trip. Amazing shoes!

Title: My first pair of Crocs and I love 'em!
Review: This is my first pair of Crocs and I love them!  I have a wide foot and comfort is key.  Crocs reminded me of the white "earth shoes" I wore back in the 70's & 80's while working in the medical field.  I remembered they weren't the most attractive shoes (looked like I had "duck feet") but they were comfortable.  I have friends that wear Crocs and decided to give them a try.  I usually wear an 8-1/2 or 9 and was torn between sizes.  Crocs recommends you order down to the next whole size if you are in-between sizes.  I ordered Classic Crocs / size W9 and I thought they were slightly longer than I needed so I ordered an 8 to be sure.  The length of the foot bed for the 8 was fine but I found the toe box to be a little snug on my littlest toe.  I kept the 9's and am glad I did.  I work in an office of a manufacturing plant with a casual dress code. Most of the building has concrete floors and the Crocs are just perfect for me.  I have since bought another pair in a different color and a pair of Crocs sandals.  The Classic Crocs clogs have ventilation so my feet don't get too hot like they might have in some of the closed styles.  I know Crocs have been around a long time and I don't know why it took me so long to try a pair.  I'm very happy I did.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2016

Title: Weightless, comfy, but tiny break in period
Review: Newbies: Wearing Crocs is not like wearing shoes. They weigh next to nothing and are cushiony without feeling spongy. Your feet don't have to 'grab' them to stay on: you walk effortlessly, even with the backstrap worn forward over your arch, like clogs. They are waterproof, so the shoes are great for gardening, and the ventilation holes will help your feet breathe; you don't have to wear socks, but I do to avoid any hint of sweaty feet. That's not a real problem for me, but feet vary.  After a short period of wearing them, they become even less noticeable as they conform to your feet. Two days later, most of you won't remember any problems, if you had them. Note: They will wear out eventually, especially if you wear them frequently on concrete. Replace them when the soles wear down, before they become dangerously slippery.Previous users: Remember that new Crocs won't fit like the old ones. The need time to adapt to your feet, particularly the backstrap, which will feel shorter at first.All: Khaki is a wonderful dust color for summer wear. Chocolate is not exactly milk chocolate or bittersweet. It's got a bit of green tinge, which makes it quite attractive for brown feet.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2008

Title: Crocs are now my "go to" shoe
Review: Have been wearing the Bistro (no holes) model for a year and loving them: light, comfortable, roomy and easy to get on and off--so I thought I would try the perforated model.  I normally take a mens size 10 in other types of shoes, but for both the Bistro and Classic Clog, I got mens size 9 and, for me, they fit perfectly:  Roomy, but stay put on my foot.  Besides the holes, the only other difference between the two models appears to be the tread pattern.  I'm retired and now able to enjoy the opportunity to wear what's comfortable--not what's expected at work.

Title: Fantastic for swollen, pregnant feet
Review: I'm 7 months pregnant, and in the summer, my feet get very swollen.  I was down to 2 pair shoes that I could wear to work (closed toes shoes) and saw these on sale.  I was looking at Crocs for sometime, but was balking at the $34 price tag.  These were on sale, so I figured I might as well.  Oh, my fat feet are happy.  Good support, and they stretch with my feet throughout the day, so no pinching.  They do seem to shrink overnight, because they don't seem overly large the next day.  Obviously not very fashionable, but I was not looking for fashion, just shoes I could wear in semi-comfort.  I usually wear a 7.5/8 women's, and ordered these in a women's 8, which are fitting well.Additionally, at the end of the day if I need to slip on shoes for whatever reason, these are the only ones which I can stuff my feet into without pain, pinching, or having to try and bend down and adjust straps.  Would highly recommend to people who have swollen feet, looking for comfort and are willing to sacrifice a little fashion for a whole lot of comfort.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2016

Title: Very comfortable. Great for my intended uses to replace flip ...

I went with a 10, and the back strap barely catches on my heel as I take a step.  Fine for walking around on dry ground, indoors, at the pool etc.  However, it's a bit too large to walk around in muck, submerged water (creeks etc) because it just isn't tight enough.  If I purchased again I would actually go down half a size.

Title: From a Catholic to a Crocoholic
Review: Let me start by saying one thing: I never thought I would own crocs.Here is my coming of Croc story.I always thought these shoes were so ugly. I first saw them about 8 years ago and thought "Why would someone ever put something like that on their feet?" and people would always say how comfortable they were. I just thought they were dumb to think wearing this shoe was okay.Well go into the futre to now, I am a graduate nurse whos feet are killing her on 12hr shifts. So I decide to give them a try.Now I am a converted crocoholic. I love these shoes, I even made my other new nurse friends buy them lolThey are honestly so comfortable on my feet, and when unsightly things spill on them, you can just wipe them off.I also love that you may or may not use the strap in the back, sometimes I like to be scandalous and let my heels out and other times I like to wear the straps around my ankles (call me bojangles).But for real, if you have never tried these before, you should. They are worth the one time try- and then you will be addicted.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2017

Title: My second pair in 12 years
Review: These are made in Mexico, those back in 2000, were made in China.  There is a slight difference in size, as these are a tad wider but the material, fit, comfort, and quality are the same.Prosvery comfortable as a clog, tend to be on the wide size for shoes and now even widerno smell with bare feeteasy to clean, just rinse with water over an open spigot with your feet still in themdurable, the sole has worn over 12 years but my old shoe is still usablelightweightresists deterioration with sunlight very well, my old shoe is faded but very intactEasy to done like a slipper yet holds firm with foot strapsConsSlippery in water, it can hydroplane easily.  If you use these to walk on water, such as walking into a pool, puddle, or boat, make sure you plant your feet down firmly to insure it contacts surface wellShoes sizes always tended to be towards the big end, you have to get used to free play inside the shoe
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2012

Review: My "go-to" shoes for all outdoor gardening.  They are light weight and cool in the summer, easy to clean, durable in the mud and the morning dew, and pretty much indestructible! I've tried other types of gardening shoes, and these are my favorite by far.

Title: Comfy sandals, but gets dirty easily
Review: These are great casual lightweight sandals that are cushy and mold to your feet.  They are also great for wearing in/around water.  I bought a pair for myself and my hubby, who loves his as well.  Our only complaint is that these sandals get dirty easily.  We both got black, so it is always a little dusty on the outside (makes it look like dark grey), and when we wear around the yard or around town, we often get dust, pebbles, and grass in our shoes.  I suppose if you wore them where there was zero debris on the ground, they'd be the perfect shoes!  They are also easy to clean, however - just damp paper towel or cloth wipes it clean.  Fairly good traction below, too.

Title: Comfy summer work shoes
Review: I work in the medical field, and normally wear danskos to work. Wanted to see if I could get something a little less hot for summer, so I gave these a try. I'm so glad I did, they are SOOO comfy! I would not wear them without socks, feel like that would end up pretty smelly after a few times wearing them like that. My favorite part of these are the ventilation holes - the AC in the car can actually cool my feet after a long day! I live in Phoenix, so that is actually a really big deal - I used to take my shoes off for the drive home to keep them from getting so hot, and you really aren't supposed to drive barefoot! The squishy foam is quite comfortable as well. Some flooring materials (laminate specifically) will make these squeak when walking, but not much different from my danskos honestly. They are totally silent on tile and linoleum. Wish I had bought these years ago for summers!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2016

Title: As comfy as they are ugly !
Review: I really like my clogs. I just don't like the way they look. And I wouldn't have considered them but I had to travel very light at some point and was jealous of a friend's clogs that served her well. The weight is amazingly low. So I tried them on and they are so comfy. First I didn't buy any because locally they are rather pricey but then I found them on amazon for a very reasonable price. I only wear them at home because I think they are really ugly but at home I wear them all the time. The are great for the garden because you can just hose them off if they get muddy. They are great for inside because they don't slip and the material warms up fast in the winter to keep my feet warm. The are treated with something antibacterial so they don't start to smell in the summer when your feet are sweaty. And they are made in Mexico which I prefer over made in China, for some reason including the short way to transport them. I like the strap in the back too. It is good if you have to walk further with them (which I usually don't but it is good to have options).
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2013

Title: * PERFECT SHOWER SHOES!
Review: When I deployed to Iraq back in 2008, I bought these to use as shower shoes.  They worked very well offering a decent grip on the shower floor.  I used them for an entire year while I was deployed and they held up great.  Not just in the shower trailers, but also when  walking on the desert ground that was super hot.  After using them in Iraq, I decided to just throw them out as I wasn't about to bring them home after using everyday in public showers.  Upon my return I bought another pair that I wear to go outside or down in my basement.  I give 4 stars only because the sizing is a little off.  I am a 9.5 so I ordered size 9 which was too small.  I returned that pair, with ease might I add thanks to Amazon free return, and ordered a size 10.  The size 10 is slightly too big but not to the point where it's annoyingly coming off my foot.  The back strap does the job in keeping them on my feet.I highly recommend these Crocs.  They are a perfect shower shoe due to the almost rubberish material.  They will not deteriorate.  Also great little slip on shoes for camping as well for treks to and from the community shower house.  Enjoy!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2016

Title: Classics are the ONLY Crocs
Review: I've had 'em all and I keep returning to the Classic Crocs. Best shoe, despite any argument ANYONE has, I've ever owned. I have countless pair to the dismay of those around me... and I LOVE THEM.Since I like them so much here's some Crocs Classic info.They are great just about everywhere. I can accomplish just about every chore I do in them. They are worthless once they get water in them. (two pair and a towel nearby when gardening, really? ...hahah) So, they dry quickly.They aren't for bouldering or climbing trees but they can make it most places on a job site, trail walking, house and yard wearing.Classics are great because of the holes in the front for shaking out constant debris. Classics are affordable, but they all are relatively... these are just the best. More comfortable than the Rx pair, better than the rugged outdoor pair, night and day better than any of the fleece-lined winter ones. Get the Classics and forget the rest. ~ Cheers.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2014

Title: Comfort needs to be engineered back into the product
Review: I bought these to replace a pair I bought 18 years ago. As others have noted, the current "Classic" model is made with a stiffer material than the original...this is absolutely correct. I prefer the softer original, but I'm pretty sure the copycats don't make the soft ones anymore, either. These are also slightly narrower, and the raised rubber nubs feel pointier (maybe because of the stiffer rubber?). Otherwise, these are almost identical to the 18 year old model. I usually like to buy products from the innovator, even if they're more expensive than the copycats, so I may buy these again in the future. On the other hand, the most desirable features have been pretty much designed out of the product, so, when it comes time to replace these, I may go with an entirely different product.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 18, 2017

Title: Crocs around the house, with or without socks
Review: I love Crocs, because they're easy to slip on and off, and because they're washable. I pretty much live in them around the house. Of course, I don't know whether or not they're somehow contributing to my back pain. And I think it probably took a while for me to learn to walk in them without tripping a little now and then -- there is a little extra length in them, but I think they are supposed to fit that way.This might be the most recent pair I bought, and it's almost two years old. I don't remember whether or not it was the case with them, but over the years I remember that on at least a couple of occasions new Crocs smelled when I first received them. Can't remember exactly, but it might be sort of a fruity smell. I don't *think* it washes out, at least not in one wash, but I think it dissipates over time. I think we used to leave them to air out for a while before wearing them. My sense of smell is sometimes annoyingly sensitive, so this might not pose a problem for the average person, especially if you keep your feet away from your (and anyone else's) nose.Roomy enough to wear with socks when my feet are cold, which is another reason to prefer them over my pink fabric slides. (Those are really awkward with socks).
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 21, 2016

Title: I like 'em for playing drums (and just about other general purpose use).
Review: Fit great!  I used my old pair so much for practically everything that they became 'outdoor' Crocs.  I ordered this pair for my 'indoor' Crocs.A few things I really like about them, and a slightly different perspective than the norm: I love them for playing drums!  Sometimes the kick drum beater swings back and hits the top of my foot, which hurts.  The layer of plastic 'armor' that the Crocs provide eliminates that pain.  The sole isn't too grippy and the shoes are very light weight, so switching between the hi-hat and second kick pedal is easy and comfortable, too.  Great for playing drums!

Title: This is THE most comfortable shoe that you can wear for this long
Review: I work in medicine and am on my feet 10-12 hours or more daily.  This is THE most comfortable shoe that you can wear for this long.  Athletic shoes have great support, but they strangle your feet and they suffocate.  These are FOAM shoes.  They are roomy and comfy and your feet breatheeeeeeeee. Other options are the Birkenstock clogs, but they are HEAVY as heck.  These are light as a feather.One thing to consider is where they are made.  I have had a few pairs of the same size and they all fit VERY VERY differently.  My previous pair was "made in China" and though they were size 8, they fit like a 9.  Too wide and too long.  I got used to them and used them for years.  These here IIRC are "made in Mexico" and they fit as a size 8 should.  At first I thought they were too small, but I was used to the ones that were too large. I read somewhere that different factories may have different molds for the same shoe.  It feels weird having ones that touch the sides of my feet, but they will break in and comform to my feet.  They are after all, foam.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2015

Title: Non-slip sole is a great protection
Review: Many times I slipped in the shower either at home or at the gym, beside on wet store-floors on rainy days but after I bought this product I have the peace of mind because the non-slip sole is a great protection. I love this product, it's worth the money. The only thing I would like the manufacturer to change in this product is the strong smell of new rubber that stays for weeks. I'm planning to buy more of those Crocs in different colors.Please note that not all of this Crocs are non slip, make sure it's non-slip before you buy.

Title: Difficulty with Crocs' Online Sizing Tool
Review: I've enjoyed Crocs for years -- tough, durable, water-proof, comfortable, even stylish. I've always purchased them in a store but ordered online just because I knew exactly what I wanted -- or thought I did until the pair I received through Amazon was a full size too big (even though the size imprinted in the shoe was identical to prior Crocs I've owned that fit well). The second (replacement) pair, sze 9M/11W, fit very well, even though I wear size 10M. As I noted upon returning the first pair, Crocs' sizing tool is not user-friendly and resulted, despite my best effort, in my having to return the first pair. Like most folks, I'm only going to re-order replacement shoes online if they are going to be VERY consistent in their size and width -- otherwise, I'll go to a store for the traditional try-on method of shopping. Since Crocs are not very expensive and available everywhere, I'm actually going to go to a store for try-ons in the future, even though Amazon's system for returns and replacing is excellent. Amazon did a great getting me the right size; my disappointment is with Crocs, who in my view make a great line of products but have a clunky and unreliable sizing system that, for me at least, made ordering online a disappointing experience.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2016
